title: Test Managers
skills: Communicating in both a written and verbal form
job_description:
Role - Testers

Location - Milton Keynes

Rate - £350 to £360

Duration 12 to 24 Months

Our client is looking for Test Managers to manage test teams, and their testing functions. They may recruit, hire and train staff to work on teams that prepare and execute tests plans. Responsible for all planning and reporting of testing activities and the overall quality of the delivery to the client. The Test Manager owns the Test Strategy and the Overall Test Plan and the delivery thereof. The Test Manager is the ultimate sign off that testing is complete and is satisfactory.

Test Manager Job Duties:

These teams will follow and ensure that standards, like ISO9000, are being followed. They provide training and job shadowing opportunities for their staff; this allows productivity and the work quality to improve. Test Managers also conduct risk assessment, risk management, quality assurance functions, writing reports and scheduling.

  • A Test Manager usually performs many of the following tasks:
  • Test Planning
  • Developing the test strategy and approach that will be employed during the testing cycle
  • Developing the Test Metrics to show the effectiveness of the testing planned or being performed
  • Developing and ensuring adherence to standards
  • Conducting performance reviews
  • Maintaining and improving testing roles
  • Facilitating development through effective defect reporting and prioritisation
  • Support the creation of Business Requirements
  • Evaluating training and development needs
  • Managing tests and testing teams
  • Managing budget expenditure on testing
  • Setting up test schedules
  • Documenting overall test findings
  • Be overall champion of the testing process
  • Final escalation point in disputes on testing related issues

Test Manager Skills and Qualifications:

QA and Testing, Meeting project deadlines, Multitasking , Executing effective leadership , Negotiating and networking , Communicating in both a written and verbal form , Being dynamic and self-motivated , Conducting teambuilding activities , Being persistent and resilient , Achieving set objectives , Working in a diverse environment , Presentation and listening, Stakeholder Management

title: BI Project Manager
job_description:
Position Summary:

The role of the BI Project Manager is to plan, control and execute a BI project(s) to meet identified business needs and deliver business value, acquiring and utilising the necessary resources and skills, within agreed parameters of cost, timescales and quality.

  • Typically project budgets range up to approximately £1+m
  • On time delivery of projects with limited business interruption
  • Ensure technology project direction meets technical principles
  • Manage the Programme budget and benefits realisation
  • Management and coordination of multi-party delivery teams (internal/external)

Key Responsibilities/Duties:

The BI Project Manager is accountable for the end to end delivery of their assigned project objectives from inception to close down. During delivery, full responsibility for the technology project deliverables are within their remit.

Project Management

  • Takes responsibility for the definition, documentation and satisfactory completion of large-scale projects.
  • Identifies, assesses and manages risks to the success of the project.
  • Ensures that realistic project and quality plans are prepared and maintained and provides regular reports to stakeholders.
  • Ensures that quality reviews occur on schedule and according to procedure.
  • Manages the change control procedure and ensures that deliverables are completed within planned cost, timescale and resource budgets and are signed off.
  • Provides effective leadership to the team and takes appropriate action where performance deviates from agreed tolerances.

Benefits Management

  • Identifies mechanisms by which benefits can be delivered and measured and plans to activate these mechanisms at the required time.
  • Monitors outcomes against what was predicted in the business case and ensures that operational managers and staff are informed and involved throughout the change programme and fully prepared to exploit the new operational business environment once it is in place.
  • Coordinates personnel from different disciplines and leads activities required in the realisation of the benefits of each part of the change programme.

Change Implementation Planning and Management

  • Creates business readiness plan, taking into consideration technology deployment, data migration\integration, capability deployment (training and engagement activities) and any business activities required to integrate new processes or jobs into the 'business as usual’ environment.
  • Determines the readiness levels of business users with regard to upcoming changes; uncovers readiness gaps and creates and implements action plans to close the gaps prior to going live.
  • Reports progress on business readiness targets, business engagement activity, training design and deployment activities, key operational metrics and return to productivity measures. Defines the series and sequence of activities to bring stakeholders to the required level of commitment, prior to going live.

General:

  • As a high achieving Project Manager educated to degree level or have equivalent experience, you’ll ideally also have a Project Management Qualification/Certification.
  • You will have a proven track record of successfully managing and delivering BI projects on time, within budget and scope, with end-to-end accountability, within a large multi-site organisation.
  • Broadly skilled in information and communications technology. Have a knowledge of relevant BI development life-cycles and the environment in which they operate.
  • Has deep understanding on a range of BI analysis, modelling and design, and able to cope with complex data; has good current knowledge of technical standards, applications and trends.
  • Has sound understanding of the costs of technology and the ability to cost operational technology services.
  • Knowledge of risk management.
  • Understands the interdependencies of business processes and information systems and it’s connection to the BI landscape.

Personal Characteristics:

  • Confident and self-motivated, your excellent interpersonal and communication skills mean you will be able to liaise effectively with all levels of management and other businesses
  • Able to build and maintain strong relationships with a large number of stakeholders, customers, leaders as well as team members.
  • Uses business acumen to make smart decisions

Knowledge, Skills and Experience:

Related work experience:

  • Extensive experience delivering BI projects with a comprehensive technical understanding of BI tools and architecture.
  • Proven track record in being able to challenge and drive development teams in terms of design and solution delivery
  • Project management experience in managing large cross-functional teams with a transformation project environment
  • Proven track record of influencing senior management and stakeholders
  • Maintain business buy-in and adoption to the solution throughout the delivery lifecycle
  • Experience of delivering business intelligence and data warehousing projects and systems in greenfield sites.
  • Exposure to SAP BW, Netezza and SSIS would be highly regarded
  • Experience with SAP Business Objects and SAP ERP Modules beneficial

Formal education or equivalent:

  • Strong academic credentials coupled with sound technical capabilities
  • Higher degree desirable (MBA etc.)
  • PRINCE Practitioner, PMI or equivalent
  • Deep knowledge of Business Intelligence technologies

Skills:

  • Open positive attitude promoting confidence and credibility to team, peers and stakeholders; positive engagement and self-promotion to stakeholders
  • Strong leadership qualities, i.e. Honest, Competent, Inspiring, Intelligent, Assertive
  • Strong facilitation and negotiation skills, acting ethically in all situations
  • Coaches and supports staff, facilitating staff and maximizing performance
  • Embraces diversity and proactively manages performance issues
  • Ability to influence peers, team, sponsor, Steering Group and wider business stakeholders
  • Influencing stakeholders
  • Communicates effectively (written and verbal) at executive level

title: Graduate On-Boarding- Slaford/Manchester - URGENT
job_description:
Graduate On-boarding Engineer - Manchester - Graduate, Electrical Engineering, Software, Programming, Scripting, Support, Applications, Hardware - £18,000 - £25,000

The Role

This role will be reporting directly to the Project Manager to help with the role out of new hardware and software to remote client sites. You will deal with the whole product lifecycle including discussing with clients the use of technology, gathering requirements, feasibility reviews, and site visits. Once the product is installed you will be dealing with the logging of data, supporting any technical issues and deploying new applications after you have tested them into the software.

The skills of an On-boarding / Technical Engineer

  • University Degree, 2:1 or above in Electrical Engineering / Networking / Information Technology / Computing
  • Network Installations and support
  • Hardware / Software installations and support
  • Bash scripting
  • Full UK driving license

Desirable

  • Knowledge of Raspberry PI
  • Python
  • Java Spring

The client

The client is a software provider which has created a new product that harnesses waste energy used by households and stores that energy so that when peak times occur they can feed back waste energy into the grid, thus saving PowerStation's using more expensive solutions. It has also been endorsed by large energy providers due to its green approach; the software they have created has allowed providers to cut down on the use of fossil fuels.

The company have seen huge growth in previous years and still continue to grow, they offer training and progression within there teams, allowing individuals to go down any path they wish to.

Apply now

If you are a Junior On-boarding / Technical Engineer with skills or knowledge surrounding Networking, Hardware, Software, Bash, Raspberry PI, Python, Java Spring, Windows, Installation, Support then waste no time and apply now.

title: Software Development Test Engineer. SDET. Cambridge, £42k-£55k
job_description:
Software Development Engineer in TEST. S D E T. Cambridge.

SDET, Software Developer, Software Development, Testing, Tester, Engineer, Automation, NUnit, C#, Capital Modelling, WPF, OO, SDLC, unit testing, integration, system testing, performance testing, automation, TFS, MPF, MVVM

A SDET role is pretty much what you make it, as evidenced by all its different names: You may be a QA Software Developer, QA Engineer, Automation Developer, Automation Tester, Destructive Tester, QA Coder, Software Test Engineer etc…

Regardless of the specific title, it is a fairly new position in most companies, so the expectations are usually either extremely loose or in this case, very specific.

Another aspect of the job is process improvement. SDET's typically have been doing QA for a while, and typically, they are more technical than the rest of the QA team, including their manager. They know a lot about the system or software under test, i.e., "where the bodies are buried". For these reasons, SDET's tend to get listened to by management, and can have a lot of influence on process--not just testing process, but how the product is built. Which can be cool, if you're into that.

Beyond that, it depends on your level of experience, the scope of your responsibilities, and the type of software that the employer would be producing. In this case it's market leading financial capital modelling software - so if you've done anything similar please do get in touch!

This SDET position will include

  • Translating user stories into test cases
  • Participating in design meetings
  • Agile environment so participating in retrospectives at the end of each sprint
  • Working closely with the Software Engineers
  • Reviewing code, unit tests (C#, NUnit) and test data for functional and code coverage
  • Implementation of unit tests (C#, NUnit)
  • Identifying where automation of tests is appropriate
  • Integration of test tools into the automated build process
  • Execution of tests, both manual and automated, including exploratory testing, regression testing, verification of fixes
  • You'll be passionate about development and testing with experience of the full software development lifecycle (SDLC) able to work from test strategy to system and component level testing
  • Software development using C#, we may consider other modern OO languages
  • Extensive experience of testing and quality assurance. Testing experience must include unit testing, integration, system and performance testing from an Agile environment.

What will set you apart?

  • Interest in math, stats, complex algorithms
  • Knowledge of or previous experience developing Capital Modelling Software or you may just have experience with financial modelling in general.
  • Exposure to Big Data systems
  • WPF / MVVM
  • SQL
  • NUnit (or other unit testing frameworks)
  • GUI test automation, with experience of coding tests rather than just record & replay
  • Microsoft Team Foundation Server (or other version control system)
  • Mocking frameworks

Please send your CV for immediate consideration

SDET, Software Developer, Software Development, Testing, Tester, Engineer, Automation, NUnit, C#, Capital Modelling, WPF, OO, SDLC, unit testing, integration, system testing, performance testing, automation, TFS, MPF, MVVM

title: Application Architect Guidewire
job_description:
Application Architect (Guidewire)
Perth

The role
To oversee architecture design, product customisation and configuration of Guidewire, one of the largest implementations in Europe. Be the recognised expert in Guidewire implementation, providing technical direction to development teams on best practices in product modelling, extensions, integration, APIs, user interface design, reporting.

The Team
Aviva's Guidewire development team for the UK is well established (since the last 3 years) and operates distributed Agile development across multiple sites in the UK and offshore development centres. Mature practices are in place but the team are forever striving to optimise and refine these to increase throughput of development whilst being very careful to maintain design integrity and not introduce technical debt. It is a very friendly and supportive team with a hunger to learn and develop. There is a separate Guidewire implementation for the Canadian market with a team based in Canada, creating opportunities to collaborate more broadly and share best practices.

The ideal candidate
Requires someone with extensive Guidewire technical knowledge and experience from previous implementations. Someone with a solid engineering background familiar with large scale Agile development, an inspiring individual with natural gravitas around the development teams and the ability to lead and motivate them. Someone who is technically inquisitive and keen to pursue innovation opportunities around Guidewire to really make their mark, including componentisation, re-use and shared-services with other Geographical deployments of Guidewire. The role offers the opportunity to be placed right at the heart of the one of the largest and most complex Guidewire implementations in Europe, with accolades from conferences, public speaking and industry awards.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Provide technical leadership over Guidewire implementation - best practices and pitfalls to avoid
  • Provide support to development teams as needed, in sprint planning and during sprints, being at least code conversant and ideally able to roll sleeves up and lead by example
  • Maintain an overall technical roadmap for the Guidewire and collaborate as part of a broader architecture practice (solution architects, Enterprise architects)
  • Inspire and motivate development teams to reach new levels, especially pushing the boundaries with DevOps, CI/CD and Cloud adoption
  • Passionately champion non-functional requirements, ensuring that Guidewire and related applications are operationally performant and stable at all times; proactively manage down technical debt
  • Protect deliveries and service by identifying and addressing technology issues and highlighting opportunities for improvement
  • Be responsible for a range of related business issues requiring investigation and use judgement to resolve
  • Ensure alignment with Aviva UK strategy as appropriate
  • Demonstrate conceptual thinking and research skills
  • Build long term relationships with stakeholders


Skills & Experience required

  • Expert Guidewire solution architecture and design skills, including integration with upstream and downstream systems - web interface, Finance systems, MI, Content management, print
  • Prior (or current) hands-on development experience at a senior level
  • Large program/project involvement and distributed Agile delivery
  • General Insurance background, with ability to quickly understand business processes and design solutions to deliver these
  • Guidewire v7 and upwards (PolicyCentre, ClaimCentre, Contact Mgr)
  • Java/J2EE, Gosu
  • Integration technologies & patterns, especially IIB, SOAP, REST, Fuse
  • IBM Content Manager or other CM solutions (Alfresco / FileNet)
  • Oracle, SAS, Informatica
  • AWS
  • APM tools, especially AppDynamics
  • Splunk


Desirable

  • Alfresco, Hadoop
  • Containers (Cubernetes/Docker)
  • Guidewire v9
  • Experience of Guidewire upgrades


About the rewards
Competitive bonus and pension scheme alongside great flexible benefit options'.

About Aviva
We're here to free people from the fear of uncertainty. Our insurance, savings and investment products help some 31 million customers enjoy life today, knowing that tomorrow is covered. And we definitely know how to look after our own people. If you love doing a great job to improve things for customers, you'll be at home here. Help us build a future to be proud of and get ready to fulfil your potential with Aviva.

title: Technical Business Analyst
job_description:
Technical Business Analyst

We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Technical Business Analyst to join our Business Planning and Analysis team on a permanent basis, here at our Head Office in Maidenhead.

Our Head Office is based in picturesque surroundings at Maidenhead Office Park. We are located just off the A404 and are easily accessible also by public transport. We operate a free shuttle bus service for all employees; our bus runs regularly from Maidenhead town centre and surrounding locations.

The Technical Business Analyst will be responsible for providing support on departmental applications / database systems developed with MS Access, MS SQL Server, ASP and will assist UK users at all levels with reporting or data related technical queries.

The main responsibilities of the role will be:

  • Maintaining of departmental applications and database systems developed with MS Access, MS Excel, VBA, MS SQL Server, AS400 DB2, ASP/.Net and Qlikview
  • Supporting overall business covering data management, database administration and MIS reporting.
  • Undertaking/assisting with business-wide projects and compiling reports and insight documentation as requested, tailored to each specific end user’s needs.
  • Liaising with all areas of the business to understand reporting requirements.
  • Developing and maintaining legacy Excel and Access reports, manipulating data to provide detailed insight and analysis.
  • Understanding and developing reporting using new tools as they become available.
  • Identifying and developing new areas of business analysis that can improve the company’s commercial performance.
  • Co-ordinating and distributing information to management across the business, providing a support service and dealing with any queries.
  • Developing and maintaining an understanding of Toys R Us retail and commercial operations.
  • Assisting other areas of the business with analytical support as and when necessary.
  • Troubleshooting queries relating to databases, web applications and 3rd party data feeds
  • Providing flexibility in working times to meet the needs of the role.

It is essential that you have excellent IT literacy and PC skills including an advanced level of skill in SQL Server, MS Excel, MS Access and VBA . An understanding of SSIS ETL processes and Qlikview would be advantageous, but is not essential.

The ideal candidate will have the ability to work with systems and able to review and streamline business processes, whilst demonstrating a good attention to detail and ability to capture and translate business requirements into an actionable specification. To be successful in this role, you will have experience of writing complex queries and developing insightful reports and dashboards. You will also have excellent 'people skills’ and be able to communicate with key stakeholders within our Toys R Us family.

Please give an indication of your salary expectations when applying for this role. With regret, due to the high volume of applications we are currently receiving, only successful candidates will be contacted.

Toys R Us operates as an equal opportunities employer and we welcome all applications regardless of gender, race, disability, sexual orientation, religion or belief, age, gender reassignment, marital or civil partnership status, pregnancy or maternity.

title: Project Manager - Sports
job_description:
How about working your Project Management magic?

We’ve some significant changes and developments coming to our Sportsbook products throughout 2017. We’re looking for a Project Manager to help us deliver our projects successfully. At William Hill, Project Management means pulling together all the technical elements which allow us to deliver a great experience to our customers. We know that’s what you do best.

Our hardware and software requirements will be planned, sourced, implemented and managed efficiently thanks to you and your relationships with external suppliers and internal IT teams. You’ll be in charge of tracking the finances of projects as well as keeping all parties up to date with their scale, scope and progress. As you’d expect, you’ll face challenges, so you'll need to help stakeholders and suppliers have open and honest conversations. Oh, and if you can juggle with your eyes shut…

Essential skills / behaviours

We’d like to see Agile development techniques and a broad awareness of wider project methodologies. Coming from e-commerce or gaming, you’ll be familiar with software, desktop, mobile and native applications and infrastructure, would give you an advantage. It can be tough to take a step back and reflect, but from time to time you’ll have to make decisions based on ambiguous information… although that’s probably all in a day’s work for you.


We’re an international business offering fantastic opportunities for personal and career development as well as great benefits. Our industry is exciting and fast moving, so we welcome hardworking people who embrace change and like to bring an element of fun to the workplace. This role involves occasional travel to our offices in London and further afield.

Perks

  • Help with learning the local language

  • Healthcare and Life Assurance Pension Benefits

title: Service Delivery Manager
job_description:
Service Delivery Manager

Our Vision

To provide World Class IT Outsourcing to the Mid-Market.

We aim to do this by being Game Changers in that market, providing outsourced IT services that cater to the ever-changing needs of the most dynamic, visionary, agile businesses that want to develop and improve themselves. We will provide them with the freedom to flex strategically, adapt faster, and seize opportunity - supported at every step by an expertly managed IT strategy.

We will grow with our clients in mutually beneficial relationships, building better businesses through understanding the drivers of our Customer’s long-term success.

Service Delivery Manager

Our Values

We’re proud to share the values we live by. They’re not dusty abstract concepts. Our values define our culture: they act as a promise to our customers and a constant challenge to ourselves, both as individuals and as a team, to be Game-Changers;

  • Be the best you can be.
  • We do what we say.
  • Together we win.
  • Defying expectation.

Purpose/Responsibilities of Role:

As a Service Delivery Manager you will own the service experience of one or more allocated customers, overseeing a number of key functions within the Service Operations department that enable the delivery of a high quality of service.

This position is a customer facing role, and requires that you establish and manage expectations within your customer portfolio in alignment with contracted service levels whilst seeking to strengthen and develop relationships for the longer-term.

  • Pro-actively monitor, control and support service delivery; working with Service Level Managers and colleagues in the Service Operations team ensuring systems, methodologies and procedures are in place and followed.
  • Champion customer service and support in Projects and develop a strong understanding of projects impacting your customer portfolio as well as ensuring comprehensive acceptance into support is undertaken ahead of go-live.
  • Demonstrate a strong understanding of your customers’ utilisation of our services (SLA/KPI as well as other service metrics and supporting data)
  • Drive internal and third party service review meetings covering performance against SLA/KPI, service improvements, customer satisfaction, quality and processes.
  • Own and manage continual service improvement plans ('CSIPs’) to ensure the company’s contracted services are delivered to the agreed level and quality.
  • Provide high quality Service Reporting to the customer as outlined in the Master Services Agreement.
  • Own to conclusion and operational escalations or formal complaints.
  • Play an active part during any major incidents that may affect your customers.
  • Identify areas of service improvement and technical remediation and liaise with the Account Director to raise sales opportunities as they arise.
  • Understand and take an active role in the applications/toolset used by the company to support the delivery of services.
  • You should be able to demonstrate the ability to undertake the above responsibilities.

Service Delivery Manager

Job Requirements/Experience:

  • Strong leadership and people management skills with an
  • An evident passion for good customer service.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and able to communicate to senior internal and external stakeholder - typically to C-level.
  • Able to demonstrate strong organisational skills and the ability to manage ongoing activity across multiple allocated customers.
  • Manage and prioritise tasks/time efficiently and encourage the same in others.
  • Able to facilitate, chair and steer meetings to achieve the stated objective/decision.
  • Experience of service management in an IT environment (ideally Operations/Infrastructure) with demonstrable working knowledge of incident management, escalation procedures and related disciplines.
  • ITIL foundation qualification or better.
  • Experience of managing, measuring and improving 3rd parties and 3rd party delivered services.
  • Willingness to support and mentor junior members of the team.
  • Able to excel under pressure and meet deadlines.
  • Demonstrate a creative approach to problem solving and conflict resolution.
  • Must be flexible as travel within the UK and Europe may be necessary at times.

Profile:

  • Service Delivery Managers will have the following capabilities/background:
  • Able to travel to customer premises across the UK on a regular basis.
  • Eligibility to live and work in the UK.
  • A full UK/EU driving licence.
  • Successful completion of the company Pre-Employment Screening (PES) checks.
  • Will present themselves as smart and credible, customer-facing and service-oriented.
  • Would ideally have prior experience of working in an organisation operating to international standards such as ISO 9001, ISO 20000, ISO 27001 or BS 25999.
  • Experience of working for a managed service provider helpful and welcome.
  • Good Trouble-shooting and problem solving skills.
  • Attention to detail and high levels of personal organisation are important.
  • Background in Financial Service desirable, but not essential.

Service Delivery Manager

Key competencies for this role:

  • Energy, Drive & Initiative
  • Commercial Awareness
  • Communication Skills
  • Creativity
  • Customer Service skills
  • Impact/Self Confidence
  • Interpersonal sensitivity (empathy/diplomacy)
  • Judgement
  • Leadership skills
  • Strategic Planning/Planning skills
  • Technical skills
  • Decision-making skills

  • Remain current on the latest technologies that align to our business initiatives.

Required background:

  • Product knowledge of Data, Voice, IP, and converged communication solutions.
  • Knowledge of WAN/LAN topologies and protocols, networking technologies. (Ethernet, TCP/IP, BGP, OSPF, PIM, SNMP, MPLS)

title: Senior IT Officer with Somali
job_description:
A well established global firm within the financial services sector is looking for a Somali and English speaker to join their London Office as a Senior IT Officer. You will also be required to analyse the firm's needs in regards to update of existing systems and advising management on requirements in order to develop IT systems. As the Senior IT Officer you'll be evaluating, updating and be responsible for the day to day running of IT systems, including servers, hardware, software and security systems.

Training of existing, as well as new staff, on all IT matters is also a part of this role. You will also be required to travel sometimes but this is not a huge part of the role.

You ideally hold a degree in an IT related subject and have 2-3+ years of experience in the IT sector. Help desk experience is essential as you will be supporting agents and staff with all IT related issues in the UK and abroad.

Due to the intensity of the work you need to be able to focus whilst maintaining the broad overview of IT budgeting, maintenance, development, training and technical support. This role provides great opportunity to grow within the company with the possibility of future management and team leading responsibilities.

title: Global Service Desk Manager
job_description:
Are you working as an IT Service Desk Manager or as an experienced Team Leader? If so this may be the next exciting career step for you. You will be working for ESP Global Services - a market leader of IT Support within the Air Travel Industry as the Global Service Desk Manager, based onsite at our Head Quarters in Reading.

Global Service Desk Manager- Reading- £35,000- £45,000- DOE
The Global Service Desk is the contact point for all customers wishing to raise an Incident or service request. On an annual basis, the Global Service Desk handles c70,000 calls. The Global Service Desk manages the lifecycle of a call ensuring the accurate recording and rapid processing of tickets to the relevant resolution groups, with the main driver being final closure within agreed service levels ensuring customer satisfaction . The Global Service Desk is open 24/7, 365 days a year.



In a nutshell...

To lead the Global Service Desk Team managing all customer incidents and service requests and ensure that all tickets are responded to promptly, to defined operating procedures and within agreed contractual service levels, whilst achieving high levels of client satisfaction.

Responsibilities:

* Provide line management, technical leadership and direction to the Technical Service Desk Team.

* Improve Customer Satisfaction

* Manage the operational performance of the Global Service Desk Team to ensure that the Service Desk is appropriately resourced 24/7, 365 days a year

* Act as a role model and coach to support, direct and counsel individuals to continuously challenge themselves to achieve greater levels of performance and customer satisfaction

* Proactively review areas impacting operational efficiency and work with the relevant `stakeholders`

* Manage the operational performance of the Technical Service Desk Team

* Monitor team performance levels and identify and resolve any tickets in "jeopardy"

*Lead the set-up and implementation of all new IT services being delivered through the team to ensure operational `readiness`, including service transition, resource requirements, training.



What is required?

* Experience of being a Team Leader/ IT Service Desk Manager

* ITIL Foundation level

* Good understanding of service desk ticketing systems

* Experience of managing a 24/7/365 operation

* Strong stakeholder management skills. High levels of impact and personal presence



About ESP

ESP is trusted by global organisations to deliver tailored IT support and infrastructure solutions around the world, 24/7. We have added value to our customers for over 20 years by listening to their needs and proactively delivering the service they want, wherever in the world that might be.

We are head-quartered in Reading, with staff in most of the major UK airports and regional Service Delivery hubs in Hong Kong, Trinidad and Mexico. Our customers include many household brand names such as easyJet, United Airlines and Virgin Atlantic.

We are looking for vibrant, enthusiastic individuals with a can do attitude who can join our team. ESP offers a dynamic environment, a strong sense of fun and a commitment to career progression from within, all of which help us to deliver our outstanding services to our global clients.

You will be there to solution and script automation into the tools and design that are implemented at client sites. This is to reduce the man-time spent doing BAU tasks and improve the ROI for the tools in use.

As a team player, you must have good clear communication skills, with excellent interpersonal skills. Write and maintain Operational and User procedures to ensure standards are met.

You should be able to demonstrate a methodical approach to problem solving, be able to multi-task a mixture of projects, and support related tasks.

  • OS Management including MDT, MDOP, WIM images and WAIK

  • Exhibit excellent communications skills with proven experience of handling difficult customers.
  • Demonstrate enthusiasm and passion for delivering an excellent customer service. Strive to over deliver on Service Level Agreements to delight the customer.

Sopra Steria is trusted by leading private and public organisations to deliver successful transformation programmes that address their most complex and critical business challenges. With 35,000 professionals in over 20 countries (of which over 5000 are based in the UK) and pro forma revenue of €3.1 billion in 2013, this is a great time to join the organisation as you will be pivotal to our continued development and growth plans. We’re offering you the opportunity to do more too - using your business skills and knowledge, and your creativity, to add more value than clients would traditionally expect.

title: Senior Service Desk Manager- London
job_description:
THE COMPANY:
A global staffing company are seeking a Head of IT Production to join their experienced and forward-thinking team in the heart of London. They are seeking a Senior Service Desk Manager with experience managing the relationship of an offshore or outsourced service desk.

THE ROLE:
*Ensure the performance of all IT for the country in close collaboration with Business Partners and key Stakeholders. This includes the relationship management with the customers, the management of IT budget and resources as well as IT operations and delivery.
*Ensure the stability and performance of IT Operations in the country. Eg (non-exhaustive list) Phone, local network, local applications and underlying infrastructure
*Build and maintains strong relationships with IT Production Vendors ensuring that they meet or exceed their contractual obligations by delivering quality services/products on time.
*Ensure the delivery of a consistent and highly cost effective end to end workplace provisioning service across the region, in accordance with the "Branch Office" Services as described in the Company's Service Catalogue
*Ensure the delivery of reliable connectivity (LAN/WAN) up to the office workplace (physical devices at the desk of the end-user), everywhere, anywhere according to agreed SLA's. This includes the connectivity to the physical locations (e.g. branches; head-quarters) as well as delivering fixed and mobile telecommunication solutions to the end-user

RESPONSIBILITIES:
*Represent IT Production in regular IT country meetings chaired by Regional Head of IT.
*Attend board meetings to present status of IT Production and action plan progress if
*required by the Regional Head of IT or other local board members
*Participate to steering of local IT Production projects and projects involving IT Production resources (including 3rd party vendors).
*Permanent member of the country Change Advisory Board
*Identify and execute pro-active actions to ensure continued stability and performance
*Managing local IT Production budget (budget, forecast and actuals)
*Help to cover for other Country IT Production Managers as needed.
*Work closely with BPs and Business Leaders to ensure direct feedback from business
*Provide recommendations that will ensure a customer focused, consistent and cost effective IT Production services
*Direct teams or suppliers that execute IMACD / soft IMACD activities
*Direct teams or suppliers that deploy and maintain infrastructure that support opening, moving and closing of physical locations
*Responsible for IT elements of end user printing / Branch office printing

*Networking (Wired and Wireless, incl. Cabling Standards)
*Communications (Incl. Voice, VOIP, IVR, CTI etc.)
*End User Devices and Tools related to networking
*Security (incl. Firewall, Proxy servers, IPS, Content Filtering, DNS etc.) if applicable

REQUIREMENTS:
*Ability to build pro-active, co-operative working relationships with customers, peers and key stakeholders based on respect and team work
*Ability to act under strong pressure and to manage efficiently crisis situations

Professional & Leadership Experience:

*Minimum 3 years of experience in a IT Production position of comparable complexity
*Minimum 5 years experience managing large scale contracts with tier 1 vendors
*Minimum of 3 years experience managing IT Operations/Production elements of internal and external Audits
*Excellent and broad technology knowledge
*Excellent Infrastructure and Operations background
*Proven track record and experience of successful management of technical teams including career development, performance feedback and evaluation
*Experience in working within a Global company
*Experience in owning and managing a substantial Budget

Education & Training

*University degree preferably in technical subject or any comparable education.
*ITIL 3 certification or Equivalent experience
*Project Management education and experience

title: Technical Programme Manager - Infrastructure Server Refresh
job_description:
Summary

Tesco has a variety of Technology Hardware deployed into our stores. Within the team we look after the service management of this hardware, and support the business with deployments or new or replacement hardware.

Currently our stores compute platform is varied with four servers of varying specification, robustness and security. This footprint can restrict our ability to quickly support the business change plans. We are launching a major strategic initiative - involving multidisciplinary teams, including Retail, Infrastructure, Product and Engineering - to upgrade the server hardware across the whole of our estate to a resilient, scalable and future-proofed edge compute platform.

Package

We offer excellent benefits that help make Tesco a great place to work. These include but aren't limited to:

- An annual bonus scheme which you can achieve up to 3.5% of base salary.

- Privilegecard (including a 2nd card for a family member) after 6 months service with 10% off most purchases at Tesco.

- A retirement savings plan - 4%-7.5% contribution rate

- Life Assurance - 5 x contractual pay

- Buy As You Earn Scheme

- Save As You Earn Scheme

- Deals & Discounts through Tesco including Tesco Mobile & Tesco Bank

- Deals and Discounts through many other external businesses

Main Responsibilities

Whilst specific responsibilities will be dependent upon the changing needs of the Tesco business, the following provides an overview of the role's key responsibilities and measures:

  • Engage key stakeholders across Technology Application Teams
  • Business and Technology communication plans
  • Create and shape a plan for the deployment of our new Edge Compute platform in stores
  • Work with partners to manage the installation of the hardware
  • Manage the technical program plan and deliverables alongside the infrastructure TPM.
  • Coordinating the dependencies from other teams. ie development, testing and deployment
  • Be central in the deployment of the application migration plan.
  • Ensure we follow Tesco standard practices
  • Budget management
  • Risk and issue management, conflict and issue resolution.
  • Help others across the organization
  • Support of the pilot and rollout planning.
Ideal Candidate

You'll need to have demonstrated experience of:

  • Managing a complex technical plan, coordinating multiple teams to deliver to a plan
  • Managing 3rd party partners to deliver a plan to a schedule
  • Experience managing project and budgets exceeding 10m
  • Understand technology concepts, grasp new ones quickly and appreciate their implications on delivery, bridging the architectural impacts of Infrastructure hardware, OS and application prerequisites
  • Optimise or use a standard programme delivery methodology for delivering programme goals (e.g. agile, waterfall, iterative) or mixture of
  • Working effectively with and leading multi-disciplinary teams and understanding how to contribute to all phases of the software development lifecycle.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills - you must be able to articulate complex concepts/ issues to all levels appropriately.
  • Experience of communicating effectively at all level.
  • The ability to influence without authority.
  • Bachelors degree or demonstrable experience required advanced degree a plus.

title: IT Service Desk Analyst
job_description:
IT Service Desk Analyst

Location: Huddersfield

Salary: £19,000

Job Type: Full time, Permanent 37.5 hours per week

About the company

Our client helps Financial/Mortgage Advisers to advise their customers (the end consumer) in the best possible way. Their employees, advisers and business partners will be able to confidentially demonstrate that the way they work, act and think is wholly consistent with the principle Treating Customers Fairly and delivering fair outcomes for the end consumer.

Why should you join the IT Operations team....

There aren’t many roles where you will interact with members of staff from every department within the business, from HR, Contact Centre or Finance to the Executive team. If customer service excellence is your forte then this could be the role for you; they’re keen to continue to be their best and are looking for someone to join the team that our client's True Gem works within.

Overview of the IT Service Desk Analyst

Our client's Service Desk is the face (or voice!) of the IT department, if you enjoy working with people and building strong long lasting relationships then this role may be right up your street. Within the role there is scope for personal development, progression and the enhancement of existing skills. You will work within a close-knit team where the success of the department depends upon a collaborative effort.

What is a typical day like in the role of an IT Service Desk Analyst?

You will be providing technical first line support to all employees across the Group, supporting the use of IT equipment including laptops/PCs, printers, iPhones and internal systems. This support will require physical intervention or telephone based support to employees at other sites or those who work remotely in the field.

What skills and knowledge would you need to possess?

Are you the person who is always fixing the printer at home? Do you have to connect the home PC or laptop up to the broadband? Our client are looking for someone with excellent customer service skills and a professional, helpful telephone manner.

A quick learner with an ability to manage customer expectations effectively and appropriately. You should have excellent attention to detail with an ability to investigate technical problems with a swift resolution as the ultimate goal. Knowledge of Microsoft operating systems, mobile operating systems (such as iOS) and Microsoft Office applications would be advantageous.

What is a key objective for the team in 2017?

To enhance the internal customer service experience, providing a first class service whilst driving efficiencies and suggesting improvements to systems where appropriate.

What benefits are offered to you?

  • Career progression
  • Travel Season Ticket Loans
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • Childcare Voucher Scheme

title: Senior Information Security Officer
job_description:
Senior Information Security Officer

Location: Altrincham

Salary: up to £45,000 depending on experience including 7% pension

About the company

Our client helps Financial/Mortgage Advisers to advise their customers (the end consumer) in the best possible way. Their employees, advisers and business partners will be able to confidentially demonstrate that the way they work, act and think is wholly consistent with the principle Treating Customers Fairly and delivering fair outcomes for the end consumer.

What is a typical day like in the role of a Senior Information Security Officer?

You will spend your day providing our client with information and guidance on Information Security policies and legislation, overseeing their IT department’s first line procedures and system changes. The role involves testing, challenging and risk assessing out IT controls and Firewalls, account management processes and IT system logs. This is a varied role providing the opportunity for an IT security specialist to branch out into the Financial Crime arena focussing solely on the security of our data management and governance.

What skills and knowledge are required of Senior Information Security Officer?

You do not need prior financial services experience, our client can provide training and the relevant support required. You will need strong working knowledge of data protection law and thorough operational understanding of Firewalls, system logs and user account management. You will ideally possess excellent knowledge of information security risk assessments and the ability to identify risks whilst remaining solution focussed. Technically, you will need operational knowledge of Cryptography and sound knowledge of information security protocols. This is a small team so there will always be importance placed on communication and interpersonal skills as the success of the department depends upon our client's abilities to work well with others.

What will be the key objectives ahead?

You will be responsible for the development of an information security framework in line with our client's business standards and assist in the production of guidance documents ensuring adherence to this framework across our client's adviser population. You will also provide an independent critical eye to or IT team reviewing and approving IS training to specialist IT staff and testing schedules for vulnerability and penetration testing and DLP control/rules. You will also advise the business on emerging cybercrime threats and tools to mitigate that risk.

Why should you join the Financial Crime & Assurance team....?

There is a lot of potential for individual and team growth. This is a great opportunity to learn and to introduce yourself to the world of financial services within an information security setting, it’s not only an excellent gateway to thei business, but if you are passionate and driven, you will be working in a positive and dynamic team, that is continually developing and making a positive impact in the business. This is a full time role Monday to Friday however there is flexibility with start and finish times. There is also the opportunity for occasional home working.

Benefits offered to the Senior Information Security Officer

  • Career progression
  • Life Assurance Benefit
  • Single PMI
  • Travel Season Ticket Loans
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • Childcare Voucher Scheme
  • Free parking
  • 25 days holiday + Bank holidays
  • Bonus
  • Shopping vouchers
  • Gym membership
  • Two hours off on your birthday

title: Applications Support Analyst - Contract
job_description:
Applications Support Analyst - Contract

  • Based in Sutton, London - SM2 5AS
  • 8-12 month contract
  • Day rate between £250 and £300 + on call allowance

The Department:

We are looking for an experienced senior application support analyst with good understanding of C#.NET based web applications to join one of our flagship digital brands based in our Sutton office. You will join a team supporting a data rich, highly interactive commercial web based product to customers of one of our most innovative businesses.

Job Purpose:

A fully proficient and experienced member of the Application Support team, the purpose of this role is to undertake support and maintenance of back-office & front-end applications and infrastructure with minimal supervision. Where appropriate, actively promote the design phase and implementation of new infrastructure solutions or the enhancement of existing systems. Actively on-board the support of new applications. This individual may be required to undertake assignments not directly covered by this role profile as the needs of the business demand, as part of their personal development plan or to enhance the departmental capability.

Key Accountabilities/Responsibilities:

  • Provide escalated support to .NET based web applications hosted in IIS
  • Identify defects in an application by local code debug and raise change requests with the development teams
  • Define health check for bespoke applications and set up monitoring and alerting in Nagios/Opsview
  • Troubleshoot data discrepancies using HTTP requests to REST APIs for both in-house and third party applications
  • Support data bridges built on SSIS that writes to NoSQL database
  • Identify root cause for production issues by data extraction from NoSQL databases using Xquery
  • Create T-SQL scripts/ Views on demand for data manipulation on legacy systems
  • Troubleshoot excel macros/VBA for legacy systems and enhance them as required
  • Use powershell to automate application status checks for monitoring and alerting
  • Actively participate in requirement gathering meetings and sprint showcases by development teams
  • Identification and prioritisation of future areas/opportunities for operational improvement through analysing business processes within Operations
  • Driving delivery of change programmes to ensure better monitoring and alerting
  • Provide support as part of an on-call ROTA out of UK business hours

Key Skills required:

  • Experience with REST API
  • Working knowledge with XML data using Xquery
  • Good understanding of .NET based web applications, MVC model, IIS
  • Exposure to T-SQL/SSIS/SSRS
  • Amazon Web Services (AWS)
  • Powershell Scripting
  • Experience working with any monitoring systems Eg. Nagios
  • Basic network troubleshooting - Windows and Linux
  • Understanding of NoSQL
  • Version control system Eg. Atlassian Stash

Experience Required:

  • Must have 6 or more of the key skills listed above
  • Strong client focus and genuine desire to assist
  • Experience working in tight deadlines
  • Experience working closely with key business stakeholders and development teams
  • Should be technically minded, quick learner and adaptable
  • Strong communication and documentation skills

So who are we?

We are a global online media and information business cited amongst the world's top-100 'online superpowers'. We have an international portfolio of market leading brands that spans Western Europe, North America, China, Singapore, Australia and beyond; we're also part of a FTSE 100 Group, a global media and publishing group with a history spanning several hundred years and revenues in the region of $10bn.

How important is technology to us?

Technology is a central part of our business. The technology team provides the online products and systems to collect and distribute data to our global audience. We also create innovative sources of new insight - for example modelling of power demands, processing of European gas flows or tracking/predicting in real-time worldwide ship movements. We use modern technologies, work almost exclusively in the cloud and focus on agile development approaches.

What's it like to work here?

Outstanding - you've probably already got a feel for what we do and the technology we're involved with but what's really stands us out from the crowd is our culture. We're an agile, dynamic and forward thinking organisation who understands the importance of looking after our staff. We pride ourselves on delivering high-quality products, providing our employees with interesting challenges for their personal and career development whilst also striking the right balance between work and family life.

By applying for this role, your details will be sent to Ortolan People, who are acting as consultants for the hiring company. Ortolan People are engaged to provide recruitment support in processing applications. We will endeavour to respond to all applicants within three working days. Occasionally for roles with a very high volume of applicants, this may not be possible.

title: Sales Support Executive
job_description:
Are you a highly organised person? Are you a team player? Do you want to work for a global technology leader?

About NCC Group:

NCC Group is a global expert in cyber security and risk mitigation, working with businesses to protect their brand, value and reputation against the ever-evolving threat landscape.

With our knowledge, experience and global footprint, we are best placed to help businesses identify, assess, mitigate & respond to the risks they face.

We are passionate about making the Internet safer and revolutionising the way in which organisations think about cyber security.

Headquartered in Manchester, UK, with over 35 offices across the world, NCC Group employs more than 2,000 people and is a trusted advisor to 15,000 clients worldwide.

This is an exciting time to join us as we have been experiencing year on year growth - with last year’s revenues increasing by 56%.

Role Description:

We are currently looking for a Sales Support Executive who will work within our Assurance Strategic Customer Team and be the hub linking our Account Directors, Solution Architects and broader business functions together. They will provide varied and wide range of support to both internal and client facing departments to facilitate an effective service to our clients. This is an exciting and developmental role which for the right person will provide a good level of scope to learn.

Key Responsibilities:

As a Sales Support Executive you will be responsible for the following:

  • Working with our Account Directors and the solution team to help with proposal and solution co-ordination
  • Co-ordinating between central service teams to ensure the smooth progress of bids, opportunities and proposals
  • Assistance in customer account planning and stakeholder management
  • Assistance in strategic analysis to support customer and industry planning
  • Initial Qualification of Sales Support requirements, requests could be received via web based systems, email or inbound telephone calls from a range of internal staff.
  • Working with other Central Services departments to ensure effective collaboration between teams, such as attendance of Bid Management meetings to capture minutes and follow up actions.
  • Assisting the Solution Architecture team with the quality assurance of client-facing documents, including both proposals and methodology literature, to ensure the solution proposed by NCC Group meets the client’s requirements and that the time allowed in the proposals is sufficient to perform the work in scope. The majority of the documents in question are highly technical in nature although full training on NCC Group’s products and services will be provided.
  • Creation of reports on the operational performance of the Strategic Accounts and Solution Architecture team and associated activities.
  • General administrative duties to facilities an effective team

Essential Skills:

If you are interested in applying for this positions you should have a demonstrable background in sales support or an administrative role, preferably within the technology sector and be comfortable at working to deadlines. You should also be a strong communicator (both written and verbal) and have experience of working with Microsoft Office software and have Microsoft Excel skills.

Desirable Skills:

If you have experience of working within a technical team such as an IT Helpdesk, sales support or within the IT security sector before then this would be also be beneficial.

Next Steps:

If this opportunity sounds like you then please click apply today and a member of our internal recruitment team will be in touch to discuss your background and experience. We will also be happy to tell you more about our organisation and the role.

***** Please note that this role has background clearance as mandatory due to the nature of the work NCC Group does. To apply, you must be willing and able to undergo the vetting process *****

title: Solution Architect EBI
job_description:
The insurance industry is complex and often difficult to predict. EBI enables us to be a successful, data driven organisation.

We are often asking "how do we become highly effective and make quick, fact-based decisions particularly where data comes from different sources and takes a long time to reach users?" and "how do we ensure we have quality and timely data that internal and external users can trust and can be used to achieve faster business insights?"

To help us answer these questions Allianz Insurance is undergoing a large programme of work to cover three main areas: Enterprise Information Management (EIM), Management Information (MI) and Business Intelligence (BI).

As part of this programme we are seeking a Solution Architect to work alongside other Allianz and 3rd party resources to deliver the EBI architecture platform and oversee its exploitation for multiple business areas.

The role will involve:

  • Thought leadership on building the EBI architecture
  • Participating as a member of the EBI IT Design Authority to review and approve technical deliverables ensuring they align with business requirements
  • Identifying and managing the impact of EBI solutions on existing Allianz UK systems, and future technology roadmaps
  • Assisting as needed in the technical assessment and selection of external suppliers
  • Assisting in the development of the IT Strategy and architectures to support the EBI business goals while also focusing on simplification, cost reduction, faster time to market, security control, data control & performance design
  • Being aware of Allianz Group & IT industry strategy and standards exploiting synergies and contributing to these where appropriate

Skills and experience:

* Active experience of using Oracle Exadata, IBM Information Server and IBM MDM Server
* Experience of Big Data technologies and platforms
* Extensive experience of data modelling
* Good architectural understanding of the market offering when it comes to BI tools and analytics
* Experience of aligning Group architectures, design standards and frameworks to project solutions
* Strong collaboration across architecture and project disciplines including; project management, requirements management, testing, infrastructure, enterprise architecture and other solution architects
* Design authority engagement and managing risks, issues and changes
* IT governance experience, including experience of relevant frameworks such as TOGAF, COBIT, Prince and ITIL

* Extensive experience as a Solution Architect within large multi-year, multi-million pound software development projects delivering EBI solutions

Key competencies:

* Very strong architecture and design skills
* Excellent ability to understand and analyse complex technical problems and propose viable solutions quickly
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Self-motivated, positive, tenacious and robust individual with a strong work ethic and the ability to use their own initiative
* Strong MS Office skills (Word, Excel, Powerpoint)
* Ability to collaborate effectively with IT Managers, Project Managers, and others

title: Network Security Specialist
job_description:
Background

Created in January 2002, AXA Technology Services is a fully-owned AXA Group subsidiary. Its objective is to provide AXA Group companies with high-quality IT and telecommunications infrastructure management services. We have gradually built up by grouping together the various teams responsible for IT infrastructure services in AXA Group companies.

We are committed to providing Quality of Service, Price Competitiveness, Customer Centricity and Expertise and Professionalism, through our core attitudes of being Available, Attentive and Reliable. We believe this ambition can be achieved through people who are empowered, focused on customer service and champions of operational excellence.

We have an exciting new role as a Technical Specialist - Network Security based in our Bristol office.



The role

The Technical Specialist for the Network Security Infrastructure will focus on the operational management, maintenance and continual evolvement of the MEDC Network Security platforms.

Other duties will include;

  • Ensuring the delivery of Network Security Services in line with SLA agreements and acting as a focal point for the team in all Security related matters
  • Providing routine processes and guidance where required to ensure that security service affecting issues are promptly addressed and SLA’s are met
  • Identifying opportunities for service improvement through proactive monitoring and customer liaison in order to improve customer service
  • Providing management information and insightful analysis to senior managers, both internally and externally with AXA Tech’s customers demonstrating progress against key performance indicators
  • Problem manage serious security related incidents, involving other parties as required to ensure effective problem resolution
  • Facilitating effective resolution of high profile/complex priority 1 security issues and ensuring that steps are taken to eliminate root cause and recurrence

Knowledge and Qualifications

Experience

title: IT Support Engineer - IT apprentices or graduates
job_description:
Do you want to work for a company that makes a difference?

You will be providing ICT support to your new colleagues, who sell & install products that help to save lives, so your work will actually be helping to save lives too. How amazing is that?

We have an ICT vacancy based at our Head Office in Derby.

You will be assisting our ICT Manager with the ICT support for our users (desktop PCs, laptops, tablets, mobile phones) and some system administration (assisting with setting up profiles, computers & the backup procedure). For the right candidate, the role could in time develop into assisting with network & server administration. This is a great opportunity for you to get stuck in on a practical level, in many areas of ICT in a business.

Alerter Group plc is a market leading technology company.

We design, manufacture, install & maintain a range of innovative products. These are emergency and/or communication systems to be used in workplaces, Universities/Colleges or hotels for example.

What’s in it for you?

Your base salary will start at £15,000-£20,000 a year (depending on experience). We also only work office hours of 8:30-17:00, Monday to Friday (with an hour for lunch). We also provide a staff pension scheme and a childcare voucher scheme.

Do I need to be qualified/experienced in IT?

Experience is vital, but this position would suit someone looking for a junior role, with only 1 to 2 years of experience in some areas of IT, or someone with a bit more experience of servers, networks, desktops, help desk and mobile devices. Having IT qualifications as well as experience would be an advantage.

What will your working environment be like?

You will work from our Head Office, which is a beautiful period building on the edge of Derby city centre (however, although a period building, we invest in the latest ICT infrastructure!). You will have your own desk in your own office adjoining the ICT Manager’s. So, you’ll have your own space, but also advice and support will be close by.

What’s the company culture like?

We’re a friendly bunch of people who share similar goals. We all want to work hard and achieve something at work, but also make a difference in the World and earn money doing this! Our team are welcoming and good-natured.

Will my role really make a difference?

YES! We’re still a relatively small company with about 40 members of staff (although hoping to be about 50 by the end of this year). The Managers and Directors really do take an interest in your work and notice when people make that extra bit of effort (there are recognition schemes for this too).

Will I have fun too?

Yes, we like to have fun as a team too. We have staff social events at least 4 times a year (which the company pays for). In the past, this has included things like curry nights, ten pin bowling, laser quest, Christmas meals and a fun casino. They aren’t compulsory, but a great chance to socialise with people for all areas of the business.

What are the career prospects for this role?

We would be happy for someone to stay in this role, becoming an ICT specialist in this key area of the business. However, this type of role could be a stepping stone in your IT career.

We’re Innovative…

At Innovative Technology we’re a global market leader in the design and manufacture of cash validation devices and processing services. We’ve over 300 employees at 10 locations across five continents, with around 120 based in their state-of-the-art head office at the Innovative Business Park in Oldham, Greater Manchester.

We strive to be the best at what we do and are proud of our track record of innovation and growth, so it’s great to be recognised for our achievements and success. Recent accolades include The Queen’s Award for Enterprise: International Trade, The Sunday Times BDO Profit Track 100 and being listed in the London Stock Exchange 1000 companies to inspire Britain.

You’ll find us on the edge of the Pennines and less than half an hour from central Manchester, with great local amenities and transport links on our doorstep. On-site we’ve modern, open-plan offices, which along with our friendly and hardworking culture should help you feel right at home.

Position: Embedded Linux Engineer / Developer

Salary: £Highly-competitive and negotiable, depending on experience
Benefits: Flexible working hours (with many of our team finishing at 2 o’clock on Fridays), paid breaks, 24 days holiday plus bank holidays, pension with 3% contribution from us, private healthcare, childcare vouchers, cycle to work scheme, free onsite modern gym, free secure parking, staff car workshop, free premium hot drinks and an active social calendar.

Our opportunity:

In this newly created and exciting role you’ll be part of our talented and growing team of developers at InnoPrint, working on the forefront of their latest products and services. As an Embedded Linux Engineer you’ll design and develop Linux based solutions, and be responsible for building Linux images and driver development.

Our products are complex and the work is challenging, as we strive to incorporate appropriate innovative technologies into our designs, to provide our customers with cost effective systems. - Implement systems in to their day to day AWP (Amusements with Prizes) operations, including TIT0 (Ticket in Ticket out) and cutting edge cloud based solutions
- Interact with Linux kernel, framework, and integrate new device drivers

Your skills and experience:

- Linux systems and developing network applications on Linux with TCP / IP
- Embedded development, using C, C++ with knowledge of hardware and low-level development
- Experience of working in a hardware development team environment
- Experience with web-based systems and cloud architectures, such as, Soap, PHP, HTML
- Experience of Linux kernel and device-driver development
- Use of git or similar for source control and auto build / test / deploy
- HNC, HND or Degree in Computer Science, or a related subject, is preferable

You may have experience of the following: Embedded Linux Developer, Embedded Linux Engineer, Systems Engineer, Linux Engineer, Linux Systems Engineer, Software Developer, Linux Developer, Software Engineer etc.

title: Automation Test Manager
job_description:
Overview

  • The Automation Test Manager will be responsible for the day-to-day management of a test team and the varied test work the team participates in. This will include the allocation, support and review of work carried out by the Automated Test Analysts and Senior Automation.
  • The Automation Test Manager will be responsible for the end-to-end management of a discrete piece of testing work; from initiation and planning, through management of specification and execution to completion. Reporting and provision of appropriate management information will also be an important requirement of the role. A test project could be performed in-house or at a client’s site, as appropriate.
  • Initially the Automation Test Manager will be the sole individual overseeing automated testing within the testing function. They must therefore be able to demonstrate a broad and thorough knowledge of automated testing in order to come from a position of authority and so influence testing strategy. They should have extensive experience within a number of different organisations, and be able to use their knowledge and experience to articulate clearly their reasons for suggesting a particular approach.

Automation Test Manager

Responsibilities

  • Management of Test Projects
  • Resource planning to ensure effective provision of test resources to projects, changes and fixes.
  • Provide input on testing at project initiation stage, including provision of test estimates and any special requirements for that project
  • Plan the test project to meet the wider project’s objectives and timescales
  • Monitor progress against the plan and regularly report on the status of the test project
  • Identify, agree and implement mitigating actions when progress slips against plan
  • Monitor defects/bugs raised;

o Review defects, updating status when required.

o Chase defects where resolution is outstanding.

o Feedback results to team members.

o Escalate high priority defects immediately to the appropriate person

  • Agree and review targets for automation script completion and all other testing related activities
  • Make decisions as to which scripts should be automated
  • Accountable for the production of all test project documentation
  • Produce reports, lessons learnt documentation and associated management information to both provide an accurate picture of testing and to drive on-going continuous improvement activities
  • Ensure that test projects are closed down tidily; that all reusable assets from the project are archived in a way which makes them available for future use and that resources are released from the project in a timely fashion
  • Act as a trusted, expert advisor for all testing/automation related questions
  • Propose, agree and implement improvements to processes and test approach in order to improve software quality
  • Substantial input into the Test Team training plan, including:

o Making oneself available to prepare and deliver training to the team when required.

o Delivering training to clients when on site.

Line Management

The Automation Test Manager will directly manage a team of testers and will ensure the structured and coordinated planning of their team’s development.

  • Set a clear direction for the team, communicates this well to team, and delivers on targets.
  • Ensure all team members are kept up to date on changes within the organisation, and encourage team members to increase their awareness of other areas of the business.
  • Agree performance objectives for all members of team and conduct formal 6 month and 12 month appraisals.
  • Carry out regular 1-2-1s with all team members and provide feedback on a timely basis - directly approach other managers for feedback on their team members.
  • Provide regular feedback to other managers on individuals the Automation Test Manager has been working with outside their own direct team.
  • Support team members in achieving their own personal development & career goals, through regular coaching sessions.
  • Manage any performance and disciplinary issues in conjunction with HR.
  • Act as an escalation point for team members to raise issues through

Automation Test Manager

Experience

Essential

  • Testing experience incorporating Unit Testing, System Testing, User Interface Testing, Acceptance Testing and Integration Testing all under the automation umbrella.
  • Test management experience; proven ability to plan, manage and report on test projects.
  • Experience of automated testing tools such as Test Bench, QTP, Selenium, BDD frameworks and test management tools.
  • Experience in one or more of following development languages - Java, VB Script, and Scala.
  • Experience in building, maintaining and enhancing automation frameworks.
  • Experience in providing consultancy and support to clients around test approach and software functionality.
  • Thorough knowledge of structured test methods and processes.
  • Good knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle.

Qualifications

ISEB / ISQTB Foundation Certificate in Software Testing qualified

Our contemporary workspace and strong team working ethic promotes creativity and collaboration across all teams and offices. We offer a competitive salary package, a great working environment working split site across our vibrant London headquarters on the river right next to London Bridge station and our offices on the 20th floor of Croydon's most iconic building, plus the opportunity to become part of a thriving and rapidly growing, award winning company.

Whilst you and the team will be working across our existing IT processes, for example the new starters and leavers processes, this is also an opportunity to evolve existing processes and develop new ones.   • Desirable but not essential: Any MS Dynamics CRM experience
  • Desirable but not essential: ITIL foundation

title: IT Developer .Net Developer
job_description:
IT Developer

Job Role

To join a fast growing independent logistics company which offers fully tracked international home deliveries for the ecommerce market. Due to the over-whelming demand of these services for both UK and International retailers we are looking to expand the IT function quickly with highly experienced individuals.

Reporting to the Head of Architecture, this role will be assisting in the development of Applications within the business.

The IT Developer will assist in the developing of the company applications, using a variety of tools and technologies. This role will be required to provide the on-going development of applications to across all core businesses and will be a very project focused role. You will be supported by Head of Development to ensure that the company meets its aggressive growth objectives. There is excellent scope for progression and the chance to work for a company that values their employees.

Key Responsibilities

* A key member of the development team.
* Analyses problems (both technical and operational) and arrives at workable solutions.
* To liaise with users regarding escalated issues and to agree appropriate courses of action and priorities.
* Design, document and develop new or enhance existing functionality to support business needs.
* To keep users up to date with progress and to liaise with colleagues and partners in a timely manner.
* To undertake and maintain own project and development plans and work in an agile manner using standardized development methodologies.
* Perform hands-on fixes, including software/ hardware install and upgrade, version control best practices, and configuring systems and applications. -
* Monitor progress of requests for support and ensure users and other interested parties are kept informed.
* Manage and develop your own and team projects to support the growth of the business.
* Develop best practice unit and system tests in software applications developed as part of the businesses development plan.

Skills / Attributes Required

* Excellent understanding of the development life cycle for business applications across a number of technologies in the UK and International market place.
* Strong .NET experience.
* Ability to develop and produce efficient, scalable, reusable code using C#, XML, and other languages as needed (e.g. PHP would also be desirable).
* Create and design databases, views, stored procedures, T-SQL statements and user-defined functions of varying complexity with a "best practices" approach to keys, indices and relationships in MS SQL Server (MySQL experience also desirable).
* To be able manage all aspects of development from start to finish, including testing and bug fixes
* Create intuitive, logical and dynamic user interfaces using ASP.Net, WPF as well as client side, JavaScript, and AJAX.

Future Opportunities

* This is a key role and fundamental to the support capabilities required to support the growth aspirations of the company. Going forward the support function will need to grow in line with the business and this role will help to shape and manage this capability.
