title: Embedded Engineer
job_description:
Embedded Engineer (C, Visual Studio)

We’re Innovative…

At Innovative Technology we’re a global market leader in the design and manufacture of cash validation devices and processing services. We’ve over 300 employees at 10 locations across five continents, with around 120 based in their state-of-the-art head office at the Innovative Business Park in Oldham, Greater Manchester.

We strive to be the best at what we do and are proud of our track record of innovation and growth, so it’s great to be recognised for our achievements and success. Recent accolades include The Queen’s Award for Enterprise: International Trade, The Sunday Times BDO Profit Track 100 and being listed in the London Stock Exchange 1000 companies to inspire Britain.

You’ll find us on the edge of the Pennines and less than half an hour from central Manchester, with great local amenities and transport links on our doorstep. On-site we’ve modern, open-plan offices, which along with our friendly and hardworking culture should help you feel right at home.

Position: Embedded Engineer
Location: Oldham, Manchester
Job Type: Permanent
Salary: £Highly-competitive and negotiable, depending on experience
Benefits: Flexible working hours (with many of our team finishing at 2 o’clock on Fridays), paid breaks, 24 days holiday plus bank holidays, pension with 3% contribution from us, private healthcare, childcare vouchers, cycle to work scheme, free onsite modern gym, free secure parking, staff car workshop, free premium hot drinks and an active social calendar.

Our opportunity:

At Innovative Technology we’ve an exciting new opportunity for two experienced Embedded Engineers to develop firmware and support software tools for our new and existing product range.

With design offices in Oldham, Barcelona and Milton Keynes, you’ll collaborate throughout the product lifecycle with our creative Research and Development team consisting of Mechanical Design Engineers, Electronic Engineers and Scientists.

With a company ethos focussed on innovation, our track record in research and development is substantiated by their unique SPF™ Core Technology.

Your responsibilities:

- Design and develop firmware / support software for new or existing products.
- Develop firmware for real time microprocessor based products using C.
- Develop reusable code libraries and support tools using Visual Basic / C.
- Write test specifications and procedures for new or modified software.
- Conduct feasibility studies on concept designs and product improvements.
- Support the production team during the initial stages of new product build.
- Take responsibility for the project lifecycle, regularly updating colleagues.

Your skills and experience:

- The ability to program in embedded C and C is essential.
- Experience programming in C++ and Visual Studio.Net would be an advantage.
- Some knowledge of HTML, PHP and MySQL would be helpful.
- Software control of small electro-mechanical / electronic products.
- Sound understanding of control theory.
- Knowledge of analogue and digital hardware.
- A degree or equivalent, in Electronics, Systems or Software Engineering, is preferable.
- Ideally, experience of real time embedded Linux.
- Ideally experience of DSP algorithms and techniques.

You may have experience of the following: Firmware Engineer, Embedded Engineer, Software Engineer, Embedded Software, Software Engineer, Software Developer, Programmer etc.

Innovative Technology are an equal opportunities employer.

title: Lead Business Analyst
job_description:
When you join Peabody, you join an extensive and growing business. One with 29,000 homes, 80,000 residents and a 150-year history. As a major housing association we have outstanding challenges for people with talent and motivation. But we also have a strong commitment to the ideals of our philanthropist founder: George Peabody. That means you’ll have every chance to achieve - while making a difference.

Our principles are simple: we believe in helping people and communities to grow, in estates that are springboards - not safety nets. With operations in nearly every London borough and one of the sector’s largest community regeneration programmes, we’re always keen to meet talented people who support our ambitions.

This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced Lead Business Analyst to head up our team of Business Analysts, being the champion for BA best practice, developing and driving forward our emerging BA Centre of Excellence.

Peabody is in the process of a cross-cutting two to three-year business transformation programme and requires an experienced Lead BA with a proven track-record of managing support of the journey from business needs though to delivery within an Agile environment.

The transformation will shift the organisation away from traditional legacy housing management systems towards a best of breed solution based around Microsoft Dynamics CRM to provide a solution that is truly customer centric and which follows the journey of our customers, providing social housing, community services and back office functions such as Asset Management and Finance Series.

Skills and Experience Required:

Essential:

  • Experience in managing a pool of BA resources to support the delivery of a change portfolio.
  • Solid, multi-organisation experience as a Business Analyst, with demonstrable skills in business process, systems and data analysis, modelling and the production of high quality written documentation.
  • Sound experience of Agile delivery and knowledge of Agile techniques such as User Stories, Acceptance Test Driven Development (ATDD), Test-driven development (TDD), Continuous Integration, Continuous Testing, Pairing, Automated Testing etc.
  • The ability to drive and challenge business users and delivery teams in the specification, design and delivery of fit for purpose solutions.
  • A clear understanding of quality assurance and testing processes, with solid experience of organising and managing effective UAT.
  • Strong business process understanding, with the ability to understand business process models in a short space of time, as well as the implications of changes to this model.
  • A persuasive, articulate communicator with a passion for delivery, who is able to communicate business analysis concepts and related matters to a broad range of technical and non-technical staff.
  • Must have an aptitude for attention to detail and the ability to maintain effective control over many tasks in parallel.
  • Strong interpersonal, written and presentation skills - service orientation, collaboration, facilitation and negotiation skills, situational awareness and conflict resolution.
  • Team player with a passion for best practice and skilled in working within a collaborative environment working across matrixed teams in projects.

Desirable:

  • BCS Diploma in Business Analysis, ISEB Diploma in Business Analysis or BCS Certificate in Business Analysis Practice

Qualifications Required:

  • University graduate preferred, ideally in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering or a numerate discipline. Also see skills/experience above.

Closing date: 5pm, 23 February 2017

Peabody is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity.

title: Senior .Net Developer - Lead your own projects
job_description:
Principal .Net  Developer required by one of the largest and best known organisations in Bournemouth. They are looking for someone with proven experience to join the team with the ability to not only take control of current projects and handle requirements but to have a desire to bring in new tech and methods to bring the organisation to and keep it at the very forefront of the tech market. Whilst you'll currently be in a small team, with the benefit of flexibility and increased responsibility; the division itself is 100+ and growing and there are plenty of chances to develop your career.

What experience you'll need

You'll need at least 6 years’ experience application development using ASP.Net, C#.Net, ADO.Net, XML and MVC  on top of web development skills using HTML, CSS, JavaScript libraries (Angular ideally). You need knowledge of database design & development with SQL Server and Oracle. Any knowledge of Linux, Apache, MySQL or PHP is highly beneficial. Any SharePoint development experience would be a huge bonus but a willingness to learn or adapt to working with SharePoint is important. Outside of the tech stack, you’ll need proven project management skills as well as systems analysis, development and support experience. You’ll need to be able to work directly with customers as well as the rest of the team.

What you'll be doing

You'll be designing, developing and maintaining digital solutions that will include web apps, web services and interfaces and portals. This will all be through either bespoke software or using package support. You’ll be creating and maintaining the continuous integration strategy, from preparing release guidelines through to delivery. The responsibility will be yours to take control of projects in their entirety and to help liaise with other teams and manage assigned Developers and Senior Developers. Maintaining an awareness of new tech and products is key to the role, allowing you to know what could contribute positively to your work or the organisation as a whole.

What you'll get in return for your talents

A fantastic working environment with a team that really cares about their tech. The Head of Development, as well as many others in the team come from agency backgrounds and the mentality has been brought with them. You’ll be encouraged to introduce and discuss new tech and methods that you think are interesting, with a view to using them whenever you see fit. You’ll be joining an organisation with a great reputation and a strong mentality of treating their staff well. You’ll be given 30 days holiday, plus a Christmas shutdown and any unused holiday will be carried over to the next year. On top of holiday and generous pension, there’s a host of other benefits to be had as well (including a sea view from the office and currently the chance to play with an Oculus Rift at home!). title: Service Desk Analyst
job_description:
Service Desk Analyst - Ruddington

Are you looking to progress your career and customer service experience in a FTSE100 Company? Are you excited by a role where you will provide support to business customers? Then read on….

Smart meters are the next generation of gas and electricity meters and offer a range of intelligent functions. For example, they can tell you how much energy you are using through a display in your home. They can also communicate directly with your energy supplier meaning that no one will need to come and read your meter in future.

Capita manage the data and communications network to connect smart meters to the business systems of energy suppliers, network operators and other authorised service users of the network.

We have an opportunity for exceptional customer service professional to join us in a Customer Support / Service Desk Capacity, providing advice, guidance and support to users of the network.

The role is based in Ruddington and we work a shift between 8am and 8pm Monday to Friday. We also ask you to work 1 weekend in 4 and you'll get time back in lieu for this.

What you will do:

  • You'll deliver outstanding customer service standards by answering all queries promptly, remaining approachable, courteous and professional at all times.
  • Proactively manage customers' expectations through either resolution or by updating them on progress of their outstanding incidents/requests.
  • Respond to calls both on the telephone but also via email and ensure that all systems are kept up to date
  • Ensure that all cases owned are resolved and that our customers are pleased with our service!

About Capita | End User Services

Capita End User Services is part of Capita plc, the UK's leading provider of business process management and integrated professional support service solutions, with 74,000 staff across the UK, Europe, South Africa and India.

End User Services' solutions address the 'workplace of the future' and are designed to facilitate the mobility and productivity of employees, irrespective of their location or the device they're using. Enabling smarter use of corporate and personal devices by combining the best blend of devices, security services and productivity applications we improve productivity and user satisfaction.

Our key areas are service management, managed workplace, on demand toolset and service integration and management (SIAM). We understand the technology and processes so we can provide a flexible approach to help achieve the best, end-to-end solution that delivers real, tangible benefits.

Your experience will include:

  • Background in Service Desk, Customer Service call centre or Service Management environments.
  • Strong aptitude for technical concepts and an interest in emerging technologies
  • Ability to communicate with all levels of the organisation.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Willing to undergo security checks if successful

What's in it for you?

At Capita, training and development aren't optional extras: they're how we do our job. We will motivate you to perform at your peak, recognising your achievements and rewarding them appropriately. As well as a generous basic salary we also give you 23 day's holiday ( after 2 years goes to 25 days and after 5 years to 27 days), company pension scheme and access to voluntary benefit options including; child care vouchers, share save scheme, life assurance, holiday buy and many more designed to suit your own personal lifestyle. All of this, in a professional but fun environment

What we hope you will do next

Help us find out more about you by completing our short application process - click apply now.

Follow Capita on twitter @capitacareers
Follow Capita on facebook @careersatcapita

Capita Resourcing welcome applications from all suitably qualified people regardless of gender, race, disability, age or sexual orientation.

title: Digital Solutions Architect - Micro-Services, AWS
job_description:
One of the South-West’s fastest growing businesses are looking to cement their place as the best in their field by bringing in a Digital Solutions Architect into their fantastic team. With beautifully designed offices near to Stroud and easy reach from Gloucester, Bristol and Cirencester, this vibrant company are disrupting their market with their unique approach and investment in digital technology.

What skills you’ll be needing

The company is looking to move towards a Micro-service based architecture for the delivery of both their customer facing and back-end systems. As a result, the technologies that they would love to see from a prospective candidate would hopefully include some of; AWS, Micro services architecture, Docker containerisation, AWS platform tech i.e. RDS/Lambda, Restful API’s and SOAP API’s. They need someone who has held ownership of digital architecture within an agile/scrum environment and has at least one example of a migration project to micro-service based architecture. You’ll be expected to be an enthusiastic problem solver, team player and have an articulate approach with excellent communication skills.

What you’ll be doing

Reporting in to the Head of Digital, you’ll be responsible for defining the components and approach to delivering online services. They have a number of apps, services and platforms with the current tech including a Symfony based CMS, Salesforce, SAP (PI and MCF), SOAP, Restful API’s and Odata. Your role will be to enable them to implement the micro service based architecture, providing solutions architectures and delivery estimates. You will be working with both internal and external development teams, making recommendations and evaluating/selecting technologies that are fit for purpose.

What you’ll get in return for your talents

You can expect a competitive salary (£65-80K), private healthcare, 6% pension, 25 days holiday, free gym membership, staff socials/trips and free coffee/fruit and more. This is a great opportunity to own and drive forward digital change within a high profile, fast-growing company with a supportive, informal and innovative working environment

title: Radio Optimization Engineer
job_description:
Radio Optimization Engineer

£250 - £270 per day

London

6 months

UK Leading Provider

One on the UK’s leading Telecoms organisations is looking for a Radio Optimisation Engineer to join a highly skilled Radio Optimisation team based in their leads office. If successful you will be responsible for the 2G/3G/4G network performance and optimisation with a geographic region and management of area wide network quality

Core Responsibilities:

  • Manage a geographic area’s 2G/3G/4G voice & data performance, optimising new and existing sites to agreed KPIs, in a MORAN swap environment.
  • Manage Customer issues to resolution using REMEDY (trouble ticket system) within the agreed SLA’s.
  • Manage area wide optimisation and network quality improvement workstreams
  • Management of radio capacity within area of ownership
  • Manage adhoc quality improvement projects
  • Produce daily and or weekly reports when required to identify trends as well as possible network issues.
  • Produce radio optimisation plans to achieve quality targets for area of ownership
  • Provide support and fix of performance related issues affecting customers which may require additional support from third parties to progress to resolution.
  • Provide presentations to share knowledge to the Optimisation team.
  • Support business requests using inhouse tools.

Core Technical skills:

  • Good knowledge of current Ericsson & NSN 2G, 3G & 4G features, key parameters, counters, OSS and optimisation tool set.
  • Good knowledge and working experience with MORAN deployments.
  • Good breadth and depth of understanding of 2G/GPRS/EDGE/3G/HSPA/HSPA+/4G/VoLTE technologies.
  • Good understanding of RF principals, design techniques and network architecture.
  • Hands-on experience of air interface optimisation of multi-layered multi-band network.
  • Good understanding of the fundamentals of capacity management.
  • Good understanding and hands-on experience using drive test tools (TEMS), Network performance database (Proptima), databuild tools and radio planning tools (Atoll)
  • At least 6 years of industry experience
  • Relevant academic degree (or equivalent)
  • General computer/database skills (MS Office, Mapinfo, SQL)

This is an awesome opportunity to work a Radio Optimisation Engineer for one of the very top UK Telecoms providers. If you enjoy working in an adult environment with plent of room for creativity this could be the contract for you. If you have the relevant experience I look forward to hearing from you soon

title: Application Tester - Innovative software house, learn automation
job_description:
An Application Tester is being sought by a worldwide payment solutions provider, based here in Bristol. The business is a forerunner in their industry and they already work across dozens of countries. You’ll be joining an experienced and collaborative team, always looking to bring in new talent. There are plenty of opportunities here to learn new skills and improve the ones you already have! There is also an emphasis on providing staff at all levels the opportunity to progress through the business.

What experience you'll need

You’ll need to have been working in a common development environment such as Visual Studio, Eclipse or NetBeans, amongst others. You’ll also be experienced with development languages such as C#, Java, PHP or similar. You will need experience using test management tools like HP-QC, Zephyr or similar and will have used ticket management tools such as Jira or Trac in a professional capacity. Some basic knowledge of automated testing will be needed. Ideally you’ll be capable of writing unit tests, have an understanding of standard SQL commands, have an understanding of Secure Programming Practices or have professional experience with version control in a multi-user environment.

What you'll be doing

This role will be mainly focussed around creating test cases (both manual and automated), execution of scripts and providing feedback to developers, as well as helping collaborate with other teams when necessary. The creation of test cases will revolve around product improvements, defect resolution and new development. You’ll be executing these test cases and making sure that all records are completed and stored safely. You’ll be helping developers prioritise identified issues and working out suitable timescales. You’ll also be learning new skills and keeping up to date with industry practices.

What you'll get in return for your talents

On top of a generous salary, you’ll receive 25 days holiday + bank holidays (+1 for each year of service, capping at 30), flexi time, private health insurance, pension scheme, a cycle to work scheme as well as other perks. You’ll be located in central Bristol in nice offices that will make coming into work each day enjoyable. There are plenty of opportunities to learn new skills and progress through the business.

Work in the Cayman Islands!

Earn TAX FREE, $US pegged compensation working in a top offshore financial center while enjoying a Caribbean Island paradise!

This will be an excellent opportunity for the right person to escape the cold winter weather while gaining international experience working with sophisticated clientele operating in this unique offshore financial setting.

We are seeking an intermediate level professional with expertise in both HP/Cisco Networking and Mitel Telephony solutions in a position to relocate and joing our client’s professional services team in the sunny, tax-free Cayman Islands.

We're looking for as much as possible of the following in an ideal candidate:

  • A minimum of 3 years of proven professional experience installing and maintaining HP/Cisco networking equipment

title: Application Support Analyst
job_description:
Travelodge has an exciting opportunity for an Application Support Analyst to join the team based in Thame. You will be on a full time permanent contract with a highly competitive salary of up to £22,000 per annum.

The job in a nutshell

The role of the Application Support Analyst is to ensure an awesome service to our internal customers. Working closely with the Application Support Team Lead to deliver stable, robust core systems support whilst ensuring day to day system availability for Travelodge Hotels and Support Centre users.

What you’ll be doing as our Application Support Analyst

- Perform daily health-checks on core business applications, ensuring systems are available to meet business requirements.

- Escalate any system related issues to 3rd party suppliers, and manage incident to successful conclusion.

- Manage the Oracle support queue, using Oracle MOS ticketing system, ensure tickets are managed to agreed KPI’s.

- Perform routine system housekeeping duties.

- Support the building of new hotels, to support hotel opening team.

- Manage OPERA configuration changes.

- Provide support to CDW for OPERA and other application queries.

- Support Application Support Team Lead to produce monthly internal service reporting.

- Provide the initial escalation point for business queries.

You will also work with the Service Delivery team and Application Support Team Lead to deliver:

- A comprehensive set of SLA’s for each service.

- Ensure that all developed/procured systems are able to meet agreed SLA’s.

- Engage with Development to ensure safe delivery into the production environment.

What we’ll expect from our Application Support Analyst

- Strong working knowledge of hotel operations

- Relevant experience in Application Support

- “Hands on” and comfortable working in the detail of technology and application support

- Excellent working knowledge of the Opera system.

- ITIL qualified (or appropriate practical experience).

What you can expect from us

Culture

At Travelodge, we are warm, straightforward and optimistic. We have a big footprint in the UK, but still a small company feel and you can expect quality and value to be built in to everything we do. You’ll have the support of a close network of colleagues and managers, and every day is different here! We want you to bring your personality to work and we love our diversity.

Reward and recognition

It’s not just our customers we want to wake up with a smile on their face. As well as a competitive salary, being part of our hotel support centre means great holiday entitlements, pension contribution deals, being part of our bonus scheme, and a Thanks Card giving generous room and food discounts as well as friends and family rates.

Career and development

We want you to develop further with us at Travelodge and we’ll provide you a development plan to help you reach your goals. You can expect to have a full induction and training relevant to your role. We advertise all our vacancies internally, so you’ll have the opportunity to really develop your career with Travelodge.

If you feel you are the right candidate for the role as our Application Support Analyst then please click ‘apply’ now! We’d love to hear from you!

title: Agile Delivery Manager
job_description:
At Sky Betting & Gaming we don't have team Teams we have Tribes. Each Tribe is made up of small, agile and autonomous squads who work collaboratively with a shared purpose.

So whether you join our Bet Tribe, Early Careers Tribe or anything in between, you will work with a group of people with raw energy, natural talent, and the kind of spirit that helps us think big, act bold, and change the game.

It all means that we've created the kind of workplace that wins awards such as a place on the prestigious list of Sunday Times 100 Best Companies to Work For.

Our challenge

The Agile Delivery Manager is a senior role with overall responsibility for the software delivery processes that take components from suppliers and in-house development teams through to a complete packaged deployment to production.

That requires a deep understanding of software development process, including a strong focus on agile and lean methodologies such as Scrum, Kanban, and Lean Startup principles.

Working with the Engineering Manager, Test Lead, Lead Architect and Service Lifecycle Managers you will provide delivery oversight and look for ways to eliminate waste and improve time to market.

The role demands energy, tenacity, and stamina to identify and see through constant improvement, while being sensitive to the impact on the team.

Your focus will be on quality and predictability, while promoting our key values:

  • Be Customer obsessed
  • Be a Game Changing Thinker
  • Be an amazing colleague working without boundaries

What we need from you

You will have significant experience of software delivery and driving process improvement in similar roles within a fast moving online business.

As a people person influencing and gaining consensus will come naturally to you, and you will be used to working with varied contributors from the deeply technical to senior business leadership. You'll understand how to get support for continual process refinements, and how to empower teams to drive change from within rather than purely top-down. You will be equally adept at managing third parties and their deliverables.

This is a key role within the International tribe's technology leadership team, and therefore you will work with the Director and his other direct reports on day to day management, continual improvement, and making it a great place to work!

Key responsibilities:

  • Line management of a small number of agile practitioners, including Scrum Masters/Agile Coaches
  • Coach the International Technology leadership team, Scrum Masters, Engineers, Product Owners, Analysts, and wider business team on great agile software development practices
  • Driving a realistic, data-driven and risk-aware approach to continual process improvement and waste reduction
  • Progress reporting and forecasting, supported by tooling evolution to improve accuracy and reduce reporting overheads
  • Management of dependencies across multiple delivery teams in the lead up to production deployments
  • Advising on resource management, team structure, and tooling improvements
  • Stakeholder management across internal and external teams
  • Management of vendor contracts, legal & compliancy requirements which cross multiple teams effecting deliverables and/or require affirmative action
  • Management of 3rd party software providers to ensure they deliver appropriate levels of quality in a cost-effective, TTM-focussed way.
  • Promote an agile 'one team' culture across suppliers, business, and technology teams that will aid efficiency in delivery.

Key skills we want you to have the ability in;

* Being flexible
* Being analytical
* Being collaborative
* Creative thinking
* Problem solving
* Negotiating

* Being persistent
* Being confident
* Leadership
* Being open minded
* Being approachable
* Being commercially aware

Based in Yorkshire, we have grown to become one of the UK's leading online betting and gaming companies. A business driven by bleeding edge technology, that brings the excitement of sports betting, casino games, poker and bingo to over 200,000 customers a day & growing!

It's a workplace like no other, with a mission to make Betting & Gaming better.

And we want you to be part of it.

title: 1st Line Help Desk Advisor
job_description:
The Service Desk is the initial point of contact for all customer incidents, which are generally raised via the telephone.
The Service Desk Advisor is the point of contact for all Support Service customers reporting system related faults and adopts the ethos of the highest quality customer service in resolution of these faults.

RESPONSIBILITIES
 Handle incoming telephone calls; answering with standard greeting.
 Log all fault information from the customer onto the incident management system. To question and diagnose each incident ensuring all details are accurate and meaningful with the correct level of information recorded.
 Log emails from customers as above.
 Apply first time fixes wherever possible before passing incidents to the correct resolving group.
 Monitor all incidents and follow up with resolving groups ensuring SLA's are adhered to.
 Update customers on the status of their incident.
 Resolve and close cases ensuring ownership through to a satisfactory conclusion.
 Perform callbacks to customers to confirm call closure.
 Ensure agreed escalation procedures are adhered to and appropriate personnel are informed of high priority or potentially high-risk customer problems.
 Log calls with 3rd parties and liaise with them to ensure resolution.

PRE-REQUISITES
 Excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively at all levels.
 Clear and polite telephone manner.
 Rapid and accurate data entry skills.
 Excellent social skills with the ability to establish and maintain good/productive relationships with colleagues and customers.
 Ability to display a logical and methodical approach to problem solving
 A desire to provide exceptional customer service. The individual should maintain a consistent emphasis on delivering customer service even during periods of stress and pressure.
 Initiative and the ability to bring forward ideas.
 Takes pride in a job well done.
 A good level of general education.

Applicants should be customer focused, IT literate and be interested in developing a career in IT.

Applicants must be able to work a 37½ hour week on a shift based system within a 24/7, 365 rota. Travelling to customer sites may be required. Full product training will be provided.

Having a qualification within IT would be hugely beneficial nit not essential.

title: Scrum Master Richmond/Kingston
job_description:
SCRUM MASTER TO SUPPORT AGILE TRANSFORMATION FOR IN-HOUSE SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT TEAM ALONGSIDE PRODUCT OWNER AND CTO.

We are a very successful software development company in the Kingston/Richmond area, that is committed to introducing Agile best practices across the whole business. We are talking full culture and mindset change here! We'll be honest - we are not the finished article, we still have issues with our sprint estimations and protecting focus of our development teams but that's why we need YOU!

We need a Scrum Master to help us in promoting best practice and to bring energy and enthusiasm to motivating a Development team through this transition, with the goal of achieving a self-sustaining software delivery process.

You will be helping us establish cross-functional development teams that are not silo'd, helping the Product Owner and teammembers throughout the sprints, you will make sure that the Dev team's time is being protected from outside disruptions and we have happy productive engineers!

Some of the skills needed are:

*You need to LOVE Agile - this is your religion, you love it more than your family! All joke aside, this is an absolutely key requirement - we want someone who knows WHY agile works, that it is a mindset and not just a "we have 2-week sprints therefore we're Agile" methodology.
*BUT we are also NOT looking for a purist - we are not looking for someone to read us by-the-book definitions. We want someone who is flexible and can adapt theory to useful practice.
*We are approaching this carefully, as we don't want too much disruption initially. But you will have the full support of our CTO when it comes to change management. Some situations will require you to utilize your knowledge of Kanban depending on the uniqueness of the team and their goals.
*You need to have real PASSION - it might sound cliché but you really need to love being a Scrum Master and be able to demonstrate it! An energetic person would be a great fit for this dynamic team!
*You understand both technical and business people, and can comfortably interact with both types of stakeholders at all levels.

This is an amazing chance for someone who wants to be an integral part of a team and to contribute to a real company-wide Agile transformation done the right way! If this sounds like a place where you see your career growing, please apply now so we can get in touch with more information.

We regret that due to the high volume of applications we cannot get in touch with every applicant personally. If you have not heard back within 2 weeks please assume your application has been unsuccessful.
No terminology in this advert is designed to discriminate on grounds of gender, race, colour, religion, creed, disability, age, sex or sexual orientation. Talent Point Ltd (including the trading name First Point) is a member of the Recruitment and Employment Confederation (REC) 00072652, an equal-opportunity employer and does not discriminate against these or any other class protected by applicable law.

job_description:
A new role has arisen within Experian for an inquisitive Senior Solutions Analyst to work within our Retros department. Working as part of a close knit, sociable and supportive team, you will be responsible for acting as the conduit between our clients and the business. Within the role, you will develop and evolve metrics across multiple markets, solve real business problems by getting "under the skin" of key stakeholders and presenting compelling analysis back to the clients in both a technical and non-technical manner.

This role offers you the opportunity to expand your skills and knowledge base across further teams within the Product Capability Unit, giving you greater exposure to the wider business and stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities:

Data analysis, delivery and product development

  • Extract, formulate and manipulate data to create the structured samples necessary to address business requirements
  • Interpret outputs of retrospective data creations to produce meaningful insight to clients.
  • Follow governance procedures and processes throughout the development/delivery process, ensuring work is produced to specification, and maintaining documentation / MI
  • Identify and contribute to the resolution of data or analytical problems that may impact on results, seeking advice when necessary
  • Question results through applied intelligence
  • Share findings with peers and knowledge sharing forums

Supporting client relationships

  • Communicate with client and/or other divisions within Experian to help ensure accurate and timely implementation of project work, and enable them to manage client expectations
  • Demonstrate understanding of the client's requirements
  • Build and maintain positive day to day client relationships at peer level
  • Attend, support and contribute to client meetings, including presenting results, conclusions and recommendations in both written and verbal form
  • Recognise and raise client problems or issues with the relevant internal stakeholder
  • Recognise opportunities for chargeable work within project and communicates these opportunities to your manager/consultant/sales lead

Skills & Attributes:

Essential:

  • Educated to degree level in a relevant subject or equivalent industry experience.
  • Process and/or data management experience
  • Good communication skills, including report writing and presentation of results
  • Good personal planning and time management
  • An inquisitive mind, focused on addressing and solving data and analysis problems
  • Logical approach to mathematical reasoning
  • Collaborative and a team worker

Desirable:

title: UI/UX Designer
job_description:
UI/UX Designer

Manchester

Up to £40,000 based on experience

Job Purpose

To manage the design process of all our company internal and external web applications, ensuring that we provide a consistent look and feel throughout our product range.

Job Overview

The successful candidate will manage the creation of all designs for our current software project teams. You will work closely with the Product Owners and Business Analysts to supply UX solutions based on requirements. You will need to be comfortable working in agile environment and managing priorities over a range of projects. The role also be involves working with the Marketing department, ensuring that all designs follow the company branding guidelines. You will be primarily creating designs and emphasising the user experience to the developers, but any front-end development skills are advantageous, but not essential.

Day-to-Day Responsibilities

  • To design and oversee the user experience of the company bespoke web and mobile-based applications.
  • To deliver new UI solutions using AGILE and LEAN techniques.
  • Create UX deliverables wireframes, site maps, user journeys, flows etc.
  • Work closely with the Product Owners and Business Analysts to deliver design solutions to meet business requirements.
  • To provide application support to our internal and external users to ensure stability of our services.
  • Oversee the front-end development of the software projects, signing off UI development before it tested by the Quality Assurance team.
  • To be pro-active in suggesting and proposing new styles, navigation and interaction techniques and to support the development goals.
  • Identify on-going improvements to existing business systems and processes across the system portfolio.

What you Bring to the Team

  • Qualified to degree level in Computer Science or related qualification
  • Creative design experience in the Industry experience - 2 year's minimum
  • Skills and experience of Graphical Design using Photoshop (Adobe Creative Suite)
  • Understanding of different web and mobile platforms and how designs should be tailored accordingly
  • Some experience of writing HTML, CSS
  • A portfolio of previous design work that you are proud of
  • Self-motivated with a strong work ethic that can work with limited supervision and guidance
  • Thrives in a supportive and friendly working environment and with a desire to share new innovative ideas and skills

Why Join our Team?

This is a superb place to work if you love solving problems, enjoy a challenge and have genuine enthusiasm for overcoming obstacles and learning, you'll love it. Your people and technical skills will be tested every day. There are endless opportunities for you to develop and grow and you'll really make a difference to all sorts of people. We're a family-run business, who are incredibly ambitious and constantly expanding and I can promise you'll enjoy every single day.

If this sounds like the role for you then click apply today!

title: Non-Functional tester

The Senior Test Analyst will deliver end-to-end testing services either as part of a major strategic programme, 'stand-alone' testing service or development / upgrade project. We are looking for someone with experience using JMeter and also Blaze Runner. Also experience with Load Runner would be an advantage.

At this level the Senior Test Analyst will be expected to have responsibility for day to day client engagement as well as test management and delivery.

This role may require global travel, so you must be eligible to work in the UK and Europe. Work VISA's may be required for other countries.

Key responsibilities

  • To assess the effort required for testing and produce estimates of time to be spent on work where required for the assigned project
  • To provide input to the design of the end-to-end test approach for complex IT programmes and projects, utilising a risk-based approach
  • To create robust test plans to support the delivery of the overall test strategy
  • To produce test cases and test scripts, including desired outcomes, for more complex scenarios and systems
  • To create test data and specify the testing environment
  • To audit test plans, test cases and test scripts created by other team members
  • To execute all levels of testing in line with overall project plan and support other team members with their testing work, as required
  • To document and verify test results. To record all incidents encountered during testing
  • To undertake peer reviews for test deliverables and to provide coaching and mentoring support to more junior staff
  • To ensure all work meets the guidelines & standards defined for the team and the Company
  • To perform effective version control management in all aspects of documentation / script output
  • To develop business/customer understanding and proactively contribute to and utilise the team's technical knowledge base
  • To liaise with other workforce members to better understand requirements and produce more effective test scripts
  • To complete impact analysis of change requests, changing priorities and implementation of change control
  • To proactively raise defects, in the agreed system, and ensure they are actively followed up on to resolution
  • To manage small testing teams as a test lead
  • To ensure appropriate, comprehensive and timely reporting of work and early escalation of any issue that may impact on the quality or delivery timescales of software
  • To assist with the 'hand over' for new software into the support environment, including
  • knowledge transfer and personal assistance during the transition and early support phase
  • To complete ad hoc duties and tasks allocated through line management chain from time to time

Skills & Experience

  • ISEB / ISTQB Certified
  • At least 3 years' experience managing small testing teams
  • Experience working with any Atlassian products such as JIRA, Confluence and Bitbucket

Reporting Lines

The Test Analyst reports into the Test Manager

Please note - This role may have direct reports depending on the size of the team.

In carrying out the role, the incumbent will also work closely with members of the development and QA teams in all the verticals as well as Product and Project Managers.

title: Network Engineer - MPLS/BGP/VRF
job_description:
This is a great opportunity for a CCNP/JNCP level or equivalent experienced Network Engineer to configure, provision and support customer network solutions from build to deployment for Enterprise customers on behalf of a leading UK Telecoms & Cloud Services Provider (Voice, Data, Cloud & Datacentre). Candidates should have experience around MPLS/VRFs and BGP within in an ISP / Telecom's provider environment. £38k basic plus circa £3k On-Call allowance plus excellent benefits. Based around Birmingham / Warwickshire area.

As well as appropriate technical skills, candidates will have a strong customer service ethic and able to work a flexible work pattern including on-call (varying between 1 week in 6 to 1 week in 4).

Responsibilities of the Network Engineer include:
- 2nd/3rd line troubleshooting and support of customer faults and equipment and core network.
- Configuration and deployment of customer network solutions from build to deployment within IP Routing, MPLS / BGP environment.
- Provide OOH On-Call Support for customer networks on a rota basis (typically 1 in 4 weeks).

The Network Engineer will have demonstrative experience of:
- Support and troubleshooting a mix of networking technologies including MPLS, VRF and BGP working within in an ISP / Telecoms service provider environment.
- Implementation / configuring / provisioning of MPLS services would be very useful but not essential.
- Experience in dynamic protocols including OSPF and BGP.
- Experience configuring and deploying Juniper and Cisco routers, switches and firewalls in an MPLS network environment.

In return you can expect to receive a competitive salary of £38k dependant on experience plus on-call allowance and excellent benefits including:
- Approximately £3,000 p/a On Call Allowance
- 25 days holiday plus public holidays
- Healthcare and Pension
- Death in Service
- Entrepreneurial, supportive company culture and opportunity to progress your career (for example, Network Architect).

If you are a Network Engineer with experience configuring and supporting customer network solutions from build to deployment fordeploying customer network solutions then apply now in the strictest confidence or contact Mike Sherwood at Inspire People for further information.

Network Engineer, Support Engineer, Project Engineer, Provisioning Engineer, Deployment, Implementation, Configuration, Installation, Voice, Data, MPLS, OSPF, BGP, VRF, Cisco, Juniper, ISP, MSP, Carrier, Network Services.

title: Data Analyst
job_description:
Data Analyst

General Motors strive to earn customers for life; therefore we put the customer at the centre of everything we do. While our roots in the earliest days of automobile development give us plenty to celebrate, our success has always been founded on our forward thinking philosophy and drive for excellence.

“Customers are our compass” is one of GM’s global values. The Customer 360 team sits within the Customer Experience organisation in Europe, covering the Opel and Vauxhall brands. The team manages GM’s Customer Data Eco System in order to win customers for life. This includes capturing all touch points we have with customers on their journey through our digital worlds to create a 360° view of our customers. The Customer 360 team manages customer data capture and processing systems, such as the Owner Centre website, an Owner App and CRM, to deliver the tools and experiences to increase customer loyalty and retention.

The Data Analyst analyses, queries and manipulates data according to defined business rules and procedures. This role would be involved in documenting business rules and data quality impacts with assistance from effected groups. The role researches data discrepancies identified by data audits and maintain data quality and integrity and support the management and completion of data updates, changes, additions/deletions per service level agreements.

Other responsibilities include:

  • Understand data lineage from collection to transformation to end user consumption to measure data quality.
  • Verify reporting and analytics requirements and provide measures and scorecards to monitor data quality.
  • Create and maintain excellent working relationships across the company to resolve data questions and issues.
  • Recommend and manage data validation processes to confirm that data is available and accurate.
  • Create and maintain data profiling requirements to assess data quality of potential source systems.
  • Develop detailed requirements, manage the data ingestion, extraction, transformation, and load (ETL) processes, working closely with IT.
  • Track and analyse suspected data quality issues to determine root cause and then follow through on corrective and preventative measures.
  • Conduct periodic database clean-ups.
  • Participate in data-related communication, such as notifying stakeholders during and after data quality incidents and managing documentation about data elements.
  • Communicate Data Quality non-compliance to Data Stewards and Business users to resolve issues.
  • Updates reports, track and publish Data Quality resolution.
  • Prepare auditing analysis to identify trends, patterns, and/or system issues that may contribute to coding and documentation deficiencies and risk areas.
  • Deliver recommendations to business leadership regarding steps to alleviate deficiencies (such as training needs, monitoring processes and formalized procedures)
  • Manage projects end to end.
  • Ensure legal compliance of all CXE initiatives with regional/local Data Privacy regulations.
  • Collaborate with regional Data Protection Officers on data protection issues.
  • Maintaining a record of all data processing / sharing agreements.
  • Maintaining & updating customer data protection notices.
  • Advise on the management and resolution of incidents involving personal data
  • Provide guidance and training on data handling
  • Play a key role in the delivery of a European Data Governance program.
  • Support the review and refresh of relevant policies, procedures and guidance.

Qualifications

The successful candidate will have the following:

Knowledge:

  • Knowledge and experience with a range of Business Intelligence tools, including Database systems and Extract, Transform and Loading (ETLs) tools.
  • Detailed knowledge of the European Data Privacy laws and regulations.

Skills:

  • Knowledge of enterprise systems, CRM, SFA and ERP (e.g. Siebel, , Oracle).
  • Demonstrate experience with at least one Data Quality Toolset and Metadata Management
  • Effective experience working with SQL.
  • Excellent Analytical thinking and problem solving skills.
  • Solid project management ability with attention to detail.
  • Strong communication skills, especially as the translator between business and technical groups.
  • Language(s): English (fluent), German and any other language would be an advantage.

Experience/Education:

  • Intermediate experience in a data quality, data operations or data governance role.
  • Bachelor’s degree (e.g. Information Science).

title: Data Modeller
job_description:
Job Description

The role will involve working as part of the Chief Data Office across a number of Transformation & Regulatory Programmes within RSA. This role is fundamental towards driving the creation of key assets from business data architecture through to the logical data architecture to provide traceability through to the Physical Domains and Business Functions.

Previous experience of Business, Logical and Physical Data Modelling in both Relational and Dimensional methods within Insurance or Financial Services industry having worked on large scale transformation programmes is preferable.

Must be self-starter and have experience of industry standard models as well as bespoke data modelling skills. Previous experience of the IBM data Models a bonus

Responsibilities

* Articulating content and modelling principles to other modellers and business users
* Developing models to reflect business area-specific data needs
* Support review, sign-off and adoption of models in collaboration with global businesses
* Facilitate resolution of model conflicts created by competing business requirements
* Lead and Participate in design workshops
* Provide communication of decisions

The Individual

* Strong understanding of Data modelling practices
* Experience of creating and maintaining business information models and logical data models
* Data Modelling Tools (e.g. Erwin, Infosphere Data Architect etc…)
* Case Tools (e.g. Sparx EA, Rational Rose, Casewise, Infosphere Software Architect etc…)
* Previous experience of Master Data Management a plus
* Experience of working in multi-disciplinary teams with designers and developers

About Us

We may be old, but we're not old fashioned. Over the past 300 years we've become one of the largest international insurers. We encourage everyone at RSA to be an individual.
Be Yourself. Be RSA

Good Luck with your application we hope to be seeing you soon!

job_description:

The Front Office IT team is responsible for the implementation of strategic and tactical portfolio management and trading solutions across the Front Office.
As well as performing business analysis, the BA must build strong relationships with the QA testers, Developers, Product Owner and end-users to ensure that the requirements properly meet the demands of the portfolio managers, traders and other business users.

Skills Required

Graduate calibre, although degree not essential.

title: Data Analyst
job_description:
SUMMARY

InXpress are a growing international express and freight company, reselling the services of market leaders in the transportation industry.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to determine, review, analyse and present data to various stakeholders across our global organisation. The role will be based in the UK and will involve reviewing current reports available in our business, analysing the trends and presenting new information to meet the objectives of the key global stakeholders. This role will also involve validating the accuracy of data, designing new reports and working with our IT team to identify new data reports and extracts as required to facilitate this.

Key responsibilities:

  • Review data and measure trends to meet goals set by our global stakeholders. Design and produce new dashboards and KPI reports to provide the business with key insights on a daily, weekly and monthly basis for regular monitoring and assessment of business performance.
  • Analyse and raise awareness of performance and process issues within teams.
  • Undertake audits of data accuracy across our systems to ensure the accuracy of reports being presented.
  • Defining and then taking raw data and being able to analyse it utilising different tools.
  • Presentation of findings to key stakeholders

Key skills and qualifications:

You will be Computer literate and will be analytical with a good eye for detail.

You will have good mathematical skills, excellent knowledge of Excel and detailed knowledge of different functions.

You will have excellent knowledge of Access and / or other tools for the analysis and presentation of data.

You will have excellent communication and presentation skills.

Minimum 2 years experience in a similar role required.

To apply, please send your CV with a covering letter stating why "this is the role for you" and current salary.

title: Network Analyst
job_description:
The Crick uses a state-of-the-art ICT infrastructure to enable world-leading scientific research. The Crick’s ICT is science driven, flexible, and forward-looking, and expedites collaboration within and beyond the Institute. Research at The Crick is data-intensive, and involves experimental, theoretical and computational science. ICT also supports the business and business management systems required to run the Crick Institute.

The Network Analyst supports the core ICT Network. The role will work closely with team members and the IT&S Helpdesk to operate and develop the networking services to support all IP services, including building management, security services, campus connectivity and Wide Area Networking.

This role is pivotal in ensuring the successful operation of the core ICT network. The role will be part of the Crick Information Technology and Services department. This role will report to the Network Team Lead and need to forge close working relationships with IT&S colleagues, the building services team, and the systems integrator.

The Network Analyst will provide second line support for the Crick’s network. They will support the design, implementation, operation, sustainability and optimisation of the network services. This role will be required to support the business-as-usual activities including monitoring, on-going support and optimisation of the network services.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

These include but are not limited to;

  • Respond to and resolve Incidents, Requests, problems and other tickets logged in the Crick’s ticketing system

  • Raise and execute Change Requests

  • Maintain local area and WAN network equipment, maintain routing, firewall and related configurations. This includes switches, routers, hubs, firewalls, wireless LAN controllers and wireless access points.

  • Create and maintain key low level network configuration for routing, VLANs, DNS, DHCP, etc in conjunction with other IT team members as appropriate.

  • Install and configure network monitoring systems to allow troubleshooting, performance monitoring and tuning.

  • Monitoring and patching of network hardware and software to maintain appropriate security levels for the network.

  • Install, configure and performance-tune storage and server connections, including virtual network devices, Fibre Channel and SAN.

  • Configure and maintain the remote access and site-to-site VPN appliances

  • Configure and maintain access to directory services for user authentication of network services such as wireless and VPN.

  • Work with System Administrators to optimise network performance for a scientific research environment, such as transfer of large datasets and high performance compute workflows

  • Implement and configure segregated networks for scientific acquisition devices

  • Provide support for network reliant services such as video streaming, voice and video calls

  • Provide guidance to other IT team members on network configuration, management and troubleshooting.

  • Maintain an awareness of current and emerging technologies and share this with colleagues.

  • Occasional unsociable or additional hours may be required, including out of hours support in exceptional circumstances.

title: Scrum Master
job_description:
Our client, a successful and rapidly growing organisation, urgently require an experience Scrum Master to join their Bristol office on a permanent basis.

In order to be successful it is essential that you are an experienced Scrum Master, with a background in leading software development teams. It is also essential that you are Scrum Certified.

In addition, you will be experienced within Kanban along with working with UX and Design teams to ensure the accurate delivery of projects.

Within this exceptional role you will be responsible for leading a development team, working on long term development projects. You will support product owners and manage the team in a `lead by example` manner.

You will guide and coach the development team on Agile/Scrum principles and on how to fill gaps within Agile frameworks. You will also interact with all areas of the business to ensure accurate delivery of projects.

This represents an outstanding opportunity to join a dynamic organisation within a commercially focused role.

title: SQL Developer
job_description:
SQL Developer

Manchester

Up to £40,000 based on experience

Peninsula is the leading UK’s Employment Law and Health & Safety Specialists, providing an integral service to over 30,000               client’s daily business operations. 

Job Purpose

To support the development of our company SQL Server databases, ensuring that best practices are used throughout.

Job Overview

The successful candidate will be involved in the SQL development on our day-to-day software development projects. You will work as part of a team to help manage multiple databases and support the ETL process of transferring data between databases. The optimum solution must always be considered to guarantee robust systems. The candidate will be a key member of the Development team, working closely with other SQL developers and full-stack software developers, as well as working with DBAs, the MI team and updating Project Management on progress.

Day-to-Day Responsibilities

  • Working with SQL Server Management Studio 2008 R2, 2012, 2014, 2016 for managing development on the software projects
  • Writing stored procedures and functions to deliver CRUD solutions
  • Collaborating with business analysts, subject matter experts, and other team members to determine data requirements
  • Working with DBAs on physical database design and modelling
  • Following data standards, resolving data issues, completing unit testing and writing system documentation
  • Helping prepare and run unit, integration, UAT, regression, stress and performance plan documents and tests while documenting results
  • Gaining experience of using SSIS to deliver ETL solutions to transfer data between a suite of databases
  • Mentoring of software developers when required, on best practices for SQL development

What you Bring to the Team

  • Qualified to degree level in Computer Science or related qualification
  • IT Industry experience in SQL development – 1 year minimum
  • Good knowledge of SQL Server management using SSMS 2008, 2012, 2014, 2016
  • Experience in SQL programming. Writing Stored procedures, functions, views
  • Data integration and ETL experience with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) knowledge – Highly desirable
  • Knowledge of RedGate tools or similar, for source control, SQL compare, etc – Highly desirable
  • Self-motivated with a strong work ethic that can work with limited supervision and guidance
  • Thrives in a supportive and friendly working environment and with a desire to share new innovative ideas and skills

Why Join our Team?

This is a superb place to work if you love solving problems, enjoy a challenge and have genuine enthusiasm for overcoming obstacles and learning, you’ll love it. Your people and technical skills will be tested every day. There are endless opportunities for you to develop and grow and you’ll really make a difference to all sorts of people. We’re a family-run business, who are incredibly ambitious and constantly expanding and I can promise you’ll enjoy every single day.

If this sounds like the role for you then click apply today!

title: Billings Operations / Data Analyst - Telecoms - FTSE 250
job_description:
On offer: a challenging entry level position working as a billing operations analyst in a forward-thinking team in a global high technology company based in the City. We are looking for a bright graduate with a naturally analytical approach able to grasp how a billing system contributes to the wider success of a company and its good relations with distribution partners.

This is not a dull or static set up - this is a progressive company at the forefront of maritime, aviation, government and enterprise communications operating in over 80 countries with more than 40 offices worldwide operating a range of billing systems, including industry-standard applications such as CSG’s Singleview and InterconnecT, SAP, in addition to bespoke applications. The systems are mostly Oracle-based.

This role will bolster the billing team ahead of the launch of cutting edge services and the billing activity that will ensue. For the right individual, progression into wider systems analysis in years to come would certainly be a possibility.

The billing and reporting cycle is calendar-month based and the team you would be joining is responsible for call data extraction, analysis and pricing, which in turn supports the invoicing of distribution partners. Thus you will need to be detail oriented, focused and confident in your own ability when asked to progressively take ownership of one or more of billing systems, manage the acquisition and processing of data, analyse trends, spot anomalies and run queries on a database. As the problem solving aspect of the work relates to external partners, you must also possess good communication skills.

In short, this is a fantastic opportunity for a recent graduate to sharpen his/her financial and analytical skills in joining a global leader within the telecommunications industry.

Key Responsibilities

  • Support the monthly billing cycle, including capture of adjustments, analytic reviews, and the interface of data to the financial system.
  • Ensure that the required quality standards are met, by operating effective controls procedures. Achieve compliance with internal and external audit requirements.
  • Support the evolution of the company’s commercial pricing through the configuration of pricing and other key reference data to introduce new price and maintain existing ones.
  • Conduct projects or assignments to improve quality and performance, deal with change, or resolve issues.
  • Investigate, resolve and respond to queries from distribution partners.

Essential

  • University degree, probably business or IT-related.
  • Good standard of written English; ability to prepare concise written summaries when required.
  • Good standard of numeracy and an aptitude for working with structured data in an analytical way.
  • Reasonable working knowledge of standard office automation software: Excel, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint.
  • Working knowledge of SQL, preferably in an Oracle environment
  • Ability to develop good working relationships with the other members of the billing team, other staff, and external contacts as required.
  • Ability to quickly absorb new learning experiences and to deploy new knowledge quickly and effectively.

Desirable

  • Reasonable understanding or appreciation of high-transaction volume business systems.
  • Experience of system analysis or testing.

title: Service Desk Analyst
job_description:
Alternative Networks is one of the country’s leading providers of IT solutions to businesses in the UK, from device to datacentre. Alternative delivers IT technology and telecommunications managed services, including cloud computing, virtualisation, managed hosting, fixed line voice, mobile, systems, IP networks and complex billing software solutions.

The Service Desk forms part of Technical Operations who are responsible for providing support that is dedicated to maintaining service within agreed service levels to Alternative customers 24x7, 365 days per year.

Purpose

Service Desk Analysts are primarily responsible for 1st level customer support and triage of support tickets to the relevant support teams across the business. Analysts act as a central point of contact between the customer and Alternative, handling service requests, incidents, and events while providing an interface for other functions such as Change Management and Incident Management.

Dimensions

  • Provide telephone and ticketing based customer support
  • Proactively investigate monitored events
  • Provide 1st line support
  • Provide request fulfilment
  • Escalate issues to teams as appropriate
  • Effectively communicate between support teams and the customer

Key Responsibilities / Accountabilities

  • Ensure that the highest levels of service are delivered to Alternative customers
  • Providing telephone and ticketing based customer support
  • Proactively investigate monitored events in a manner consistent with documented best practice
  • Assess the impact and urgency of tickets and gather the appropriate information for the type of request
  • Responsible for the resolution of all customer issues raised, ensuring that customers are updated within agreed SLA’s and that all issues are resolved quickly and efficiently
  • Maintain accurate records of activity taken throughout the lifecycle of a ticket
  • Management of escalation through other teams ensuring high quality of feedback and service to customers at all times
  • Liaising with third party suppliers to ensure that faults are resolved within the correct time frames according to the product service level agreements in place
  • Develop a good understanding and technical expertise across Alternative’s entire product catalogue
  • Support the Team Manager towards continued improvement of team process and customer experience
  • Answer inbound telephone calls
  • Validate contact and ensure security process is adhered to
  • Log all relevant request details, allocating category and prioritisation
  • Provide first-line investigation and diagnosis, resolving at first contact whenever possible
  • Follow security protocol
  • Escalate incidents/requests that cannot be resolved within agreed timescales
  • Keep customers informed of progress
  • Contribute and search the knowledge base
  • Developing and maintaining customer facing documentation when required
  • Occasional visits to various Alternative datacentres (Inc. international travel)
  • Perform ad-hoc tasks as necessary

Essential Criteria

  • Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Ability to translate technical language into user friendly information
  • Good understanding and awareness of IT terminology
  • Customer focused
  • Leadership skills
  • Decision maker, able to act decisively under pressure
  • Highly motivated, pragmatic and energetic team player, positive, determined and driven with a can-do attitude
  • Ability to work in a highly pressurised environment in terms of volume and intensity of activity.

Desirable Criteria

  • Previous ISP, Managed Service or Telecoms experience Relevant industry qualifications
  • Proven analytical and problem solving skills
  • Good understanding of IT Service Management
  • ITIL v3 Foundation and experience working in an ITIL environment
  • Relevant industry qualifications
  • Holds some relevant technical accreditations (MCP / MCSE)
  • Previous experience of working for a service provider or Telecommunications business
  • Customer Service trained

Key Technologies

  • Cisco
  • CheckPoint
  • Juniper
  • Microsoft
  • Citrix
  • Symantec
  • Trend
  • Service Now

title: Digital Content Specialist
job_description:
Digital Content Specialist

Bedfordshire, UK

£ Competitive Salary and Attractive Benefits Package

General Motors strive to earn customers for life; therefore we put the customer at the centre of everything we do. While our roots in the earliest days of automobile development give us plenty to celebrate, our success has always been founded on our forward thinking philosophy and drive for excellence.

“Customers are our compass” is one of GM’s global values. The Customer 360 team sits within the Customer Experience organisation in Europe, covering the Opel and Vauxhall brands. The team manages GM’s Customer Data Eco System in order to win customers for life. This includes capturing all touch points we have with customers on their journey through our digital worlds to create a 360° view of our customers. The Customer 360 team manages customer data capture and processing systems, such as the Owner Centre website, an Owner App and CRM, to deliver the tools and experiences to increase customer loyalty and retention.

Reporting to the Owner Services Content Manager, this role will ensure a high level of quality content – features, functionality and media – are built, optimized and delivered to Europe’s Owner Services platforms including our website and smart phone app.

Responsibilities include:

  • Define the role of content and content types required across the Customer Lifecycle
  • Create and maintain content and feature framework
  • Work with internal and external stakeholders to manage project from start to finish
  • Write content briefs
  • Gain approval on briefs and requirements
  • Manage testing process
  • Work with the market coordination team to define plan and deliverables
  • Define go-to-market and communications plan per project, including online and offline materials
  • Create a reporting structure to monitor KPIs
  • Use insights to develop new ideas, changes and improvements
  • Develop and establish methods to measure how features are received by customers
  • Maintain reporting repository

Qualifications

Are you made for more?

You will need to have a good level of experience in Marketing or Customer Experience, ideally with specialisation in digital and/or CRM. You need a degree qualifications or equivalent. You also need to have project& time management skills & ideally have the ability to draw insights from data and convert to new ideas, opportunities and projects.

Got what it takes? Then we want you to apply. In return, we’ll offer you a highly competitive benefits package, coupled with future career development.

General Motors is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Digital / Software Release Manager - AEM / Agile
job_description:
Digital / Software Release Manager - AEM / Agile

A leading North West business are looking to appoint a contract Release Manager into what will be a newly-created post. The position has been created following the migration of their core website onto a new AEM platform & is tasked with inheriting & improving release processes, and ultimately owning & driving forward releases.

The successful applicant will be someone who will own and drive forward releases (and the processes) rather than just manage the transition to production. Success in the role will be measured by release frequency, release quality, governance adherence and continuous improvement.

This involves joining a mature Agile practicing organisation therefore a strong understanding of Agile project delivery & software development principles are important, but more important, how to apply those principle pragmatically.

Extensive stakeholder management, communication and negotiation skills will be required so excellent verbal & written skills are essential

This offers a great opportunity for a passionate technologist to define release processes from scratch!

Responsibilities:

  • Owns the release process end to end, from local environment to production
  • Runs the release process, liaising with Development, DevOps, Transition and QA teams
  • Works closely with the delivery leads to coordinate releases across the platform and multiple channels
  • Handles the release communication
  • Assures the quality of the releases made
  • Defines and monitors release KPIs and monitors these
  • Owns configuration management and version control
  • Manages the release governance and sign off process
  • Searches for efficiency in the process and drives continuous improvement
  • Manages a wide group of stakeholders across multiple locations

Behaviours:

  • Tenacious, proactive, organised. Has an eye for detail. Can break-down barriers, overcome inertia and resistance.
  • Good verbal and written communications
  • Schedule oriented pragmatist who is able to work in a fast paced Agile delivery environment

Beneficial:

  • Understanding of Jenkins and release pipelines
  • Understanding of GetIt
  • Understanding of GitHub principles
  • Understanding of branching strategies

Oscar Technology Limited is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.
