title: PMO Manager - Digital
skills: Agile, Waterfall and Hybrid project methodologies
Digital and / or Change sector experience
job_description:
Introduction

Transport is a rapidly changing industry. The way people consume travel and their requirements while on the move are increasingly diverse. To ensure we maintain our position as a leading transport organisation we’re undergoing a wide-ranging digital transformation aimed at embracing the many and varied opportunities digital presents.

With ambitious plans in terms of both scope and timescale, we are in the process of implementing a new delivery structure. To ensure this is effective, we are looking to recruit a talented and tenacious PMO Manager who will help define, set up and manage a new PMO structure.

As a newly created position, no two days will be the same and the role will undertake strategic work to set up the PMO and basic portfolio administration in equal measure. As such, you will be an ambitious PMO professional with excellent organisational, planning and interpersonal skills, with great attention to detail. You will be a hands-on practitioner with experience within a business change / digital transformational environment.

What you’ll be doing

  • Work with the Head of Portfolio to create and maintain portfolio standards, methodologies and tools to ensure portfolio delivery performance is effectively managed.
  • Be the champion of PMO best practice, promoting this culture across Stagecoach Group examples of which include a standardisation of governance, project life cycles, reporting, statuses etc.
  • Work closely with senior stakeholders and finance colleagues from across our Group to ensure the reporting cycle is completed, providing one true version of the portfolio status.
  • Pro-actively identify, manage and escalate risks and issues.
  • Provide ad-hoc progress reports and updates to stakeholders across the Group.
  • Provide general day-to-day portfolio administration support to the senior leadership team as required.
  • Support the Portfolio Change Control process.
  • Ensure tracking of project costs including contractors, project suppliers etc.
  • Maintaining resource planning.

Who are we looking for?

Experience of…

  • Working in a similar senior portfolio / programme administration position.
  • Taking complex sets of information and report in a visually appealing, engaging and clear manner.
  • Identifying and track risks and issues at a Portfolio level.
  • Resource planning and monitoring.
  • Working within either a digital transformation or business change environment an advantage.

Knowledge of…

  • Working in a Group environment would be advantageous, but not essential.
  • MS toolset including MS Project and collaboration tools.
  • Agile, waterfall and hybrid project methodologies.
  • You may have not yet set a PMO however you will be able to demonstrate the knowledge of what a successful structure and responsibilities would look like.

Skills

  • High degree of self-organisation, motivation and self-reliance.
  • Ability to successfully manage the expectations of and communicate with a wide variety of senior stakeholders.
  • A stickler for detail, you will demonstrate a passion for delivering regular detailed, quality driven reporting.
  • Demonstrable experience of being a strong team player.
  • Proven ability to work under pressure.
  • Provide clarity in areas of ambiguity to support decision making.

In Return

In return for your skills and experience, we’re offering a competitive salary and benefits package. As important, is the opportunity to work in a role that will have significant influence in shaping the future of our organisation while working in an industry sector at the beginning of an exciting period of transformation.

To Apply

Please send your CV along with a covering letter explaining why you believe your experience is relevant for this role by Wednesday 22nd February 2017.

Telephone interviews will be held week beginning 27th February 2017 with face-to-face interviews being held week beginning 6th March 2017.

About Stagecoach Group

With a £3.8bn turnover, 39,000 employees and 3 million customer journeys each day, we are a leading international transportation group with rail, bus and coach operations across the UK, mainland Europe and North America.

title: Network Support Technician
job_description:
Network Support Technician - £20,000 - £25,000 + excellent benefits package
Retail
Livingston

A retail leading business based Nr Livingston, Scotland have asked us to assist in the hire of a Network Support Technician.

The Network Support Technician role is situated within the IT Infrastructure team, supporting the Network Manager and reporting to the Infrastructure Manager The network infrastructure comprises ~3000 routers/switches (predominantly Cisco), across ~1000 locations in the UK each of which also has WiFi access points.

Job responsibilities will include
*Use of Network Monitoring tools to monitor network for signs of anomalies in order to proactively address issues before they become service affecting
*Resolve network related issues in order to restore normal operations as quickly as possible
*Provide direction/guidance to technicians/end-users in troubleshooting network issues
*Carry out network changes following correct change management procedures - properly record, classify and document changes
*Apply network device upgrades and patching
*Install and configure network devices
*Set-up of users for remote VPN access (Cisco AnyConnect) and Two Factor Authentication (RSA SECURID)
*Basic firewall administration (Cisco ASA, Fortigate)

Technology Knowledge/Experience/Skills Required:
*Ethernet switching - VLANs, 802.1Q trunking
*IP Addressing and subnetting
*Cisco devices & CCENT/CCNA accredited or in progress
*VoIP and Unified Communications
*IPSEC and MPLS VPNs
*Routing protocols (RIP, OSPF, BGP)
*MPLS and QoS implementation
*802.1x and RADIUS authentication
*Network monitoring concepts using ICMP, SNMP, WMI, Netflow (WhatsUpGold experience helpful)
*LAN/WAN concepts including Ethernet, ADSL, Leased Lines
*Corporate WiFi operations

We will always email you a full role specification, name our client and wait for your email authorisation before we send your CV to this organisation. Deerfoot IT: Est. 1997. REC member. title: User Experience Researcher - Technical Content
job_description:
- User Experience Researcher – Technical Content
- £300 - £360 per day  
- 6 month contract
- Role based in Cambridge

As one of the most revered leaders in their industry, this technology led organisation is widely regarded as one of Britain’s global success stories. This is a fantastic opportunity to join them as a User Experience Researcher.

This organisation ensures success for it’s customers by providing timely, leading-edge knowledge through innovative services. Technical content is a valuable business asset that our customers access and use every day in their work to develop market leading products. The UX Researcher sits within the Content Services team, which plays an important role in shaping this technical content.

The Content Services team is tasked with improving technical content efficiency and delivery so that the customers can get the information they need, when they need it, and get the best from their digital journey with the company. The team uses a data-driven approach to ensure that the technical content is relevant, up-to-date, timely and meets our partners needs.

This new role provides an opportunity to shape the research strategy for all of the organisations technical audiences, covering technical content on a website that will soon contain well over 100,000 web pages.

Your work will have a direct impact on the experience of hundreds of thousands of hardware and software engineers who are working to develop market leading products based the companies technology.

What will I be accountable for

- Aggregate existing research on user goals and journeys and identify gaps to fill as part of our ongoing content strategy.
- Plan and execute additional user journey insights studies which result in significant improvements to the developer experience.
- Collaborate with other project team members to create user stories, user journeys, wireframes and prototypes.
- Be the voice of UX in project teams, explaining your design rationale to developers, editorial staff and product managers.
- Contribute to the Content Services roadmap with appropriate UX research and design milestones.
- Build and continuously improve a robust and thoughtful approach to gather customer insights and collaborate with other UX teams around the company to align on best practice.
- Build and manage vendor relationships with research agencies as applicable.
- Work cross functionally with peers/colleagues globally to support training, best practices, and shared opportunities.

What skills, experience, and qualifications do I need?

As an ideal candidate you will have a deep understanding of user experience research and design methods and best practices, but also adopt a creative and pragmatic approach. You will have excellent observational and analytical skills, but will also be able to collaborate with other teams, with a determination to do what is right for customers. You will require only minimal direction in delivering high-quality output.

Essential:

- Evidence of success leading customer focused user experience projects (including research and design elements) with demonstrated impact.
- Hands-on experience with a number of qualitative and quantitative research methods commonly used in UX research, and the creation of associated artefacts to inform the work of product managers and web developers around the business.
- Experience in User Experience Design techniques including journey mapping and the creation of wireframes.
- Excellent communication, presentation and interpersonal skills; the ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization.

- Proven history of having worked across cross-functional teams and functions.
Excellent attention to detail.

title: Test Manager
job_description:
My client a continuously growing retail organisation seek a Test manager to help initiate new ideas and processes.

You will,

* provide immediate suggestions for improvement to enhance control, maximise testing coverage, whilst minimising and delivering ongoing testing service.

The key elements that will be addressed further will be:

* Analysis of current testing practices, methods and processes to determine ways to strengthen.

* Review current test scripts for manual testing, gearing for automated testing.

* Analysis of areas likely to cause project slippage through inter-dependencies between testing streams.

* Review testing documentation and reporting.

* Determine feasibility of using automation to shorten timescales in testing. Recommend areas for test automation to increase efficiency of future releases.

* Analysis of defect tracking and fixing procedures to ensure maximum efficiency.

* Review testing environments, static data and the general readiness as well as management of those environments.

* Analysis of integration testing plans, detailing points of greatest risk.

* Analysis of performance and load testing.

* Analysis of plans for User Acceptance phase. Recommendations for how best to maximise Acceptance test efficiency through Integration test planning / scripting re-use.

* Analysis of staffing for forthcoming test execution and preparation.

* Review reporting between and within testing organisations including structure, reporting and staffing across all aspects of testing.

If this is of interest, please get in contact ASAP.

title: Project Manager (Finland)
job_description:
Project Manager (Finland)

Brief Overview

My client has a new and exciting opportunity for a Project Manager to lead the second phase of a Hydrographic Survey project in Finland.

The contract is for 9 months and based at the picturesque Finnish lakes. If you are looking for something different and challenging over the next nine or so months this role may just be for you.

You will be expected to be out in Finland for the majority of the time but will have access to travel home from time to time.

The client will look to pay a day rate as well as cover any travel, accommodation and food allowance.

We are looking from someone with experience in managing projects. The role is based around the inland surveying of Finland’s many lakes. You do not have to be from a hydrographic or a survey background although this may help you understand the nature of the work. We are happy to speak with PMs who are from logistical or civil engineering backgrounds also.

The people you will manage will be a mixture of surveyors and boat drivers who will work in teams to survey the lakes.

You will be responsible for the management of the team and their workloads in Finland, setting targets, planning the logistics of the boats and crews to undertake the survey work, trying to work out time saving and process methods, motivating the team and you will have some responsibility for managing budgets and client liaison.

If you feel this role is the right challenge for you please drop your CV over today.

Other information

If this role is of interest to you or you would like more information please contact Jon Graham or submit your application now.

Triad is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all suitably qualified people regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief.

Triad Group Plc acts as an Employment Business for this contract position.

title: Web Systems Administrator
job_description:
JD Williams / N Brown group is a leading FTSE 250 internet and catalogue home shopping company with over 150 years of distance shopping experience and is now seeking a Web Systems Administrator based in Manchester to join its expanding team.

Best known by our 3 power brands; Simply Be, Jacamo and of course JD Williams, we turned over £818 million in 2014/2015, with a pre-tax profit of £86.2 million. Our vision is to become a leading digital retailer and to continue to expand our active customer base of over 4 million, becoming the universally loved experts in fashion that fits by helping our customers’ look and feel amazing through our trusted family of over 20 brands.

In this role, the Web Systems Administrator will provide second line technical support and expertise for the JD Williams digital solutions. This involves the configuration, management, monitoring and support of Hybris, Web Servers, Application Servers and any other systems that are included within the JDW  digital solution.

As the Web Systems Administrator, your duties will be to:

- Investigate, identify and implement performance improvements for the web solution in conjunction with architecture.
- Assist in the investigation, identification and implementation of solutions of any incidents for the JDW web solution.
- Assist in the configuration, management and monitoring of the underlying databases that support the above systems.
- Assist in the configuration, management and monitoring of the Virtual Machines or Operating System that support the above systems.
- Training and ongoing support of junior team members.
- Assistance and support for capacity management planning of the associated environments.
- Liaison and coordination with our IT suppliers, contractors and other IT and business teams.
- Included within the scope are associated web technologies such as CDN’s and other services that comprise the delivered service.
- Work seamlessly alongside Development in a DevOps / Continuous Integration environment to ensure maximum flexibility and responsiveness to business needs, while balanced with operational performance and stability.

To be a successful Web Systems Administrator you will have the following skills and experience:

- Dynamic and creative individuals who see technology as their true passion. Individuals who are comfortable with fast pace ever changing the environment to understand and enjoy our transforming business.
- An excellent communicator with the ability to translate complex technology solutions to wider business and colleagues.
- Ability to demonstrate the previous problem-solving experience as you will constantly work towards effectively resolving incidents with a drive to minimalize the business impact. 
- Be commercially aware and have infrastructure administration experience, preferably in the technologies of the JDW digital solution or similar including Linux, Oracle DB, scripting languages e.g. Perl, Apache/Tomcat at a minimum.  Experience in Hybris, Websphere, DB2, IBM z/OS, configuration management tools e.g. Puppet and monitoring tools e.g. Wiley is desirable but not essential.

In return, the Web Systems Administrator will receive a competitive salary.

Employees in our business may have access to our customers’ personal data therefore for a number of our roles, offers of employment are subject to a satisfactory criminal record check.  Having a criminal record will not necessarily prevent an individual from obtaining a position with N Brown Group / JD Williams.

title: DevOps Lead Engineer
job_description:
DevOps Lead Engineer - DevOps,DevOps Engineer,Site Reliability Engineer,Site reliability engineer jobs,Devops Jobs,Linux Jobs,Cloud Jobs, AWS Jobs,MySQL,SQL,Software Development,Operations,Ops,Linux,Unix,Infrastructure,AWS,Amazon Web Services,Cloud,Cloud Solutions,Redhat,Java,Docker,Chef,Puppet,Jenkins,CI,CD,Saas £65k-£75k + Benefits

We are seeking a high calibre individual to become the "go to" person for all things DevOps for the UK. This company are at the forefront of Enterprise Saas and seek someone to become the 1st dedicated DevOps Engineer in the UK & to take the Lead role with regards to building a robust DevOps culture. Is this you?

This job is very much a hands on role; holding responsibility for a 24/7 cloud system with some 40 million end users. A big part of your role will be centred around scalability, availability & performance of this system; supporting and managing what is in place, ensuring the systems grows and evolves and coming up with new ways to better deployment and maintenance strategy.

We're mad for all things automation, as we expect you will be too, you will play an important role when it comes to the continuous integration pipeline; used by multiple agile teams. In the first year of this role you will;

- React to live issues across production - support and resolve production issues.

- Lead on the development of DevOps within the business.

- Collaborate towards proactive improvements in the way our agile teams create and deploy software, whilst also monitoring & alerting systems and processes.

- Drive improvements in load testing & be instrumental in capacity planning and strategy

- Implement large scale containerisation strategies.

- Work in tandem with the Agile teams & Automate the SDLC for agile production teams.

Skills & Experience for the DevOps Lead Engineer will include a combination of;

- Supporting complicated large scale cloud deployed services that includes continuous integration.

- Enterprise level instrumentation/monitoring tools. Examples - New Relic, Solar Winds, and Extra Hop.

- Container technology experience. Examples - Swarm, Docker, Kubernettes.

- Prior experience in a software development environment, as part of an agile team. Any of the following-Jenkins, Circle CI, Junit, Java, JMeter, Gatling, Riak, MySQL, Couchbase.

- Load balancing & concept/usage understanding whilst also being able to carry out basic configuration alterations.

- Network troubleshooting, understanding of routing protocol and its configurations. Ideally with experience with CDN's such as AKAmai.

- Knowledge of common failure patterns in cloud and distributed systems.

- Basic database skills. SQL, stored procedures & basic performance tuning.

- BASH or alternatives for shell scripting.

- Deploying releases and hotfixes to test environments and production data centres.

What would make you stand out to us for this role?

- Some form of engineering degree or professional qualification.

- Previous experience within a decision making lead role, that has elements of software development & infrastructure/application support.

- Excellent communicative skills, able to communicate effectively to global teams & labs.

- Strong Linux experience - Redhat ideally

- In depth understanding of JVM and tools to aid optimisation.

- Exposure to Java programming & Knowledge of automating SDLC's.

- Familiarity of continuous integration pipeline implementation.

Excellent starting salary based on skills & experience - £65k-£75k + bonus & benefits. If you have a blend of the above skills and experience, a passion for DevOps we can have a confidential conversation about this opportunity - please send your CV for consideration.

title: Software Architect in Test
job_description:
Opening Date: 9 February 2017
Closing Date: 13 March 2017

About the Role of Software Architect in Test @ Utility Warehouse:

You are passionate about all aspects of automation (monitoring, unit tests, system tests and regression tests). You're comfortable estimating work for your teams, with the know-how to manage the agile development process and how to get the most out of it.

Responsibilities:

  • Developing high level design patterns in response to the test requirements for the each product area and ensuring consistency in patterns across product areas.
  • This is a senior role, with some hands-on development to produce the initial version of the product or to support the investigation issues.
  • Collaborating across team boundaries to address the functional and nonfunctional requirements for new test frameworks.
  • Providing technical guidance and coaching to our software engineers to ensure high quality and sustainable software systems.
  • Ensuring software meets all requirements of quality, security, reusability, modifiability, extensibility etc.
  • Occasionally providing evidence of compliance of the architecture and its instantiation to the project scope.
  • Defining the test approach for applications, with a particular focus on the strategy for regression testing (testing/verifying that changes do not compromise the functioning of the product).
  • Identifying product and process improvements relating to the development of existing and future products.

Qualifications / Experience:

  • You will see the "big picture" and create architectural approaches for software design and implementation to guide the development team.
  • You will have experience in all aspects of development, testing, and infrastructure.
  • You will have a good knowledge of modern development approaches and tooling to support modern practices.
  • You will need to be comfortable work and communicate with both product managers, software architects and software engineers.
  • You will be comfortable with a modern infrastructure, having worked with Kubernetes, Docker Swarm or Mesos in some capacity in the past 12 months.
  • You will favour a collaborative open approach to development and have the ability to inspire others; ensuring that an agreed Test Solution is understood and maintained during development.

About Us:

Telecom Plus PLC, trading as Utility Warehouse is a FTSE 250 listed multi-utility supplier and currently the UK’s only fully integrated provider of utility services, spanning both the communications and energy markets.

We may be a FTSE 250 Company, but we are far from a corporate monolith! We are about to embark on a dynamic new phase as we transition from our legacy systems to new technologies, and we are looking for bright, talented and enthusiastic Engineers to help us. As part of a newly formed team, you will be able to work in an agile, fast-paced environment, using your skills to help create the technology and culture on the road to our next exciting stage as a leading UK provider of utilities.

Technology Stack:

Beginning 2016 we’ve started a fundamental transformation here at Utility Warehouse - driven by the board there’s a strong desire to become a technology-led business again.

Today the legacy stack is mostly LAMP with a mixture of VB/C on the backend. All of that will be left behind for distributed API backed, built with modern tech, tested and automated.

We always try to think in a technology agnostic way - while the decision on how to build out our environment is not baked in yet, we are firm believers in modern engineering culture built around agile principles, devops methodology, distributed architecture and bold technology choices.

To give you an idea of what’s in the stack today, below is a list of few bits in play: the frontend is mostly react.js with redux and co (sagas, radium, storybooks, materialui), backend as a distributed set of APIs, Java, go and a bit of node, immutable infrastructure in AWS running kubernetes cluster (all apps dockerised) supporting infrastructure in the form of NoSQL stores, message queues, caches, big data stores, instrumentation with prometheus, all continuously tested and deployed via a chain of CI/CD tools.

The teams are relatively new too, with a mix of new joiners and company veterans - a lot of the usual practices and processes still need establishing so definitely a good time to join and influence how things shape up in the future.

There's plenty of exciting things to happen here over the next 3-5 years; we have the plan and the budget to make it a good ride.

Breakfast & Lunch

Beer & Coffee

Great Working Environment
We're young, creative, loud and fast. We work hard but we make sure we enjoy every second of it.

title: IT Business Systems Manager
job_description:
Are you experienced in delivering IT management and working to deliver results? Are looking to take on a new challenge? If so, our client are recruiting and are looking for individuals just like you!

Our client is a family owned business which has been manufacturing in the UK since 1770 and manages a portfolio of manufacturing businesses. Their headquarters are in the UK and has representation in 50 countries and offices in Germany, France, the Netherlands, Belgium, United Kingdom and Canada.

Within the building services industry their name is recognised and respected as a leading European business specialising in the supply of high performance and ‘engineered to last’ heating, ventilation, air heater and air curtain products and solutions.

Thermoscreens produces a comprehensive range of heated, ambient and cold store air curtains for any application including retail, commercial, public sector, architectural, industrial and refrigerated environments. Products are exported to over 50 countries worldwide and are backed by Thermoscreens’ proven brand reputation offering outstanding design, service, quality reliability and availability.

Based on a platform of business success and part of its continuous improvement programme, changes in operating systems and procedures are planned and it is envisaged that this role will play a major part in that process. This is a fantastic opportunity for a IT Business Systems Manager to join our team and to make a difference. The role is based in Nuneaton, with occasional travel to Aldridge.

IT Business Systems Manager – UK Responsibilities:

In this position, you will be primarily responsible for managing the Company’s IT systems, servers and hardware and future developments alongside ensuring the security of all data, networks and back-up systems. Your responsibilities will also include:

- Day to day first line IT support and training for all employees.
- New employee equipment setup and decommissioning equipment from leavers.
- Management of all company systems. Reviewing the performance of all systems and identifying and delivering all company systems developments.
- Maintenance and development of Company servers.
- Management of the company’s manufacturing management system to ensure that we maximize operational efficiency throughout the business and working with Operations team to continually improve performance and develop best working practices.
- Providing IT support for all internal departments – develop methods to improve processes and systemize procedures throughout the business.
- Providing IT Support for small UK Head Office.
- Maintaining optimal performance of IT infrastructure.
- Reviewing and revising disaster recovery plans.
- Responsibility for the purchasing of all hardware & liaison with suppliers to ensure we maximize our buying potential.
- Responsibility for all project management relating to IT/Systems related matters.
- Managing the annual IT budget and ensure cost effectiveness
- Collaborating with Group and international colleagues on common systems developments.

The ideal IT Business Systems Manager – UK:

To be successful for this position, you will be ideally educated to degree level or equivalent along with strong IT Management experience in the manufacturing sector. You will also possess:

- Microsoft (Workstation, Server Exchange, SQL ,AD ) and VMware knowledge
- Experience of server management, integrated manufacturing systems software and CRM systems
- Experience of WAN/LAN and storage management
- Microsoft office skills
- Management of service delivery providers
- Ability to analyse statistical data and interpret the results
- Strong problem solving skills
- Effective communication skills and the ability to work with colleagues at all levels in the company
- Effective project management skills and ability to supervise colleagues to deliver milestone goals. Valid driving licence.
- Willingness to travel and stay away from home

If you are looking for your next challenge as a IT Business Systems Manager - UK, then our client want to hear from you, please click APPLY!

No terminology in the advert you have seen is intended to discriminate on the grounds of age, gender, race, colour, religion, disability or sexual orientation, and we will gladly accept applications from all sections of the community.

Your day will consist of fault management primarily, as well as general support for our in-house, market leading VoIP products, but to support these fully you will also need a solid understanding of Broadband and Ethernet class data connections.

They also know flexibility is important and is something we offer as well as ask our team for, with the ability to home work and preferred shift patterns considered.

What we value in a candidate;

job_description:

An opportunity has arisen to join the team responsible for MI as a Solution Architect, specialising in SAS.

An important part of the role will be to lead and guide the development teams in the development of re-usable services and assets to the benefit of the wider enterprise. The projects range in scale significantly from small tasks of a few days up to several man years' worth of development. This role will involve working with our Project Managers, Business Analysts, Analyst Programmers, Developers and Testers within the team. Working alongside these team members, the successful candidate will also be responsible for significant engagement with the business beneficiaries and key stakeholders.

Main duties:

* Support, encourage and participate in the growth of the Design function within the departmen

* Proposing and documenting solution options to meet business opportunities, in line with overall MI/BI design principles and best practice

* Working with the central Enterprise architect team to develop the MI / BI offering.

* Ensuring all designs meet the business needs of multiple stakeholders and conform to the central architectural principles

* Contributing to Quality Process using techniques such as design reviews

Skills and experience:

Essential:

* Strong technical knowledge of data warehouse design using SAS, experience of coding using both
SAS EBI (DI Studio and Enterprise Guide) and SAS v9 (Base and Macro)
* Structured documentation of designs to organisational and industry standards.
* Knowledge and experience of the full development lifecycle
* Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Power Point)

Desirable:

The following experience is essential:

* Ability to work under pressure and deliver to tight deadlines

Key competencies:

title: Problem Analyst - Sports
job_description:
Investigate and learn. Prevent and improve.

In a digital world, customers expect apps and websites to be performing perfectly 24/7. We need you to help us meet those expectations. As a Problem Analyst with William Hill, you’ll have two responsibilities; empower our first-line support teams, so they understand how to maintain live systems. And when incidents occur, investigate what went wrong and facilitate fixes so they don’t happen again.

With new products and releases brought to market bi-weekly you’ll work with the Product Delivery team to upskill our first-line support teams on what happens under the hood. You’ll gather information on how it works, what alerts will trigger to show us there is a problem and how to fix it. Once you’ve created this operational readiness criteria and delivered training to the team, you’ll run test drills to simulate problems, checking procedures and solutions are working how they should be.

Despite every effort, sometimes things go wrong. We’ve got teams on hand to fix problems quickly. Once service is restored, you’ll work with them to understand what went wrong, identify any workarounds and facilitate any permanent fixes that we can make.

Essential skills / behaviours

You’ll have broad exposure to the technology our customers use, for example websites and apps. Your understanding of technical jargon and basic functionality will help you investigate problems and solutions with the experts. But it’s your organisational and problem solving skills, coupled with your initiative and inquisitive personality that will give you the most success in this role. You’ll need to be comfortable speaking to, and writing reports for, people at all levels as your work will regularly be discussed with senior leaders.

Perks

Whether you decide to live in Gibraltar or southern Spain you’re never far from the beach, good surf and fantastic sailing hotspots. Whilst we work hard, we find plenty of time to take advantage of alfresco living too. We offer:

  • An excellent re-location package typically covering moving costs, accommodation deposit and 1st months’ rent
  • Help with learning the local language
  • 25 days holiday + Gibraltar bank holidays (approximately 12 days)
  • A day off for your birthday
  • Healthcare and Life Assurance Pension Benefits

As one of the leading employers in Gibraltar we’ve also offer discounted gym membership, parking loans, discounts with local restaurants and many more perks too.

title: Recruitment Manager
job_description:
Recruitment Manager 

Based in Yorkshire but with a global presence, our client is a market leading provider of telehealthcare solutions. Their unique products and services protect people’s wellbeing and empower them to live their lives to the full, as well as underpinning an efficient, person-centred health and social care system. 

They are always on the lookout for talented people who can help play a part in driving their business forward. 

Position: Recruitment Manager 
Location: Whitley Bridge, North Yorkshire 
Job Type: Full time, permanent 
Salary: £Competitive 

About the role: 

The Recruitment Manager will manage all recruitment activity for our client in the UK, with a primary focus on direct hires. Reporting to the UK and Ireland HR Director, you will be an integral part of a small but busy HR team. 

Responsibilities: 

- Work with hiring managers to further develop their direct hire model, ensuring they adopt the best strategy for each vacancy as well as attracting and selecting the best possible talent 
- Deliver training and coaching to hiring managers on selection methods, and supporting them with interviewing and selection decisions as appropriate 
- Manage relationships with external suppliers including recruitment agencies, advertising agencies and ATS provider, ensuring terms are negotiated and the best value is achieved within a set budget 
- Building their external employer brand through various channels including social media platforms 
- Manage and further develop the full end to end recruitment and onboarding process, ensuring an excellent candidate and hiring manager experience is achieved at all times 
- Production of metrics surrounding recruitment including quality of hire and cost per hire 
- Leading recruitment and wider HR and talent projects to support our client's goal of becoming an employer of choice with the healthcare sector 

Essential skills / experience: 

- Significant experience of working as an in-house recruiter, particularly with reference to working within a direct hire model in order to reduce agency costs 
- Appreciation of the legislation impacting recruitment activity, in particular equality and diversity legislation 
- Management and development of assessment centres for volume recruitment 
- Management of recruitment campaigns for difficult to fill vacancies in niche market 
- Project management experience 
- Interest in the broader HR agenda and a willingness to develop a broader range of skills 

Desirable skills / experience: 

- Generalist CIPD qualified HR professional (desirable) 

You may have experience of the following: Recruitment Manager, Internal Recruitment, In-house Recruitment, In-house Recruitment, In House Recruitment, Internal Recruiter, Resourcing Manager, Resourcing Specialist, Recruitment Specialist, CIPD, IRP, HR, Human Resources, Recruitment, etc. 

This vacancy is being advertised by EasyWeb Recruitment, the UK’s leading Online Recruitment Agency. The services advertised by EasyWeb Recruitment are those of an employment agency. No terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of gender, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, or belief, and we confirm that we will gladly accept all applications.

title: Content Optimisation Co-ordinator- Events
job_description:
Summary

The Online trading content team sit integrally between our the commercial teams and our online business, managing onsite content across Grocery home shopping* to support key trade promotions and seasonal events. The teams purpose is to drive additional basket adds through the most helpful, inspiring and engaging content possible throughout the customer journey.

In this role you will be responsible for coordinating event planning, design, code, publishing & optimisation processes to deliver engaging, relevant, timely & accurate content on site for customers, driving sales & profit for the business. This will be for our seasonal event categories which include Christmas, Mother's Day and more.

Here at Tesco, our ambition is to create a working culture that is inclusive to all. Having a diverse workforce which echoes our international footprint will help us to the meet the needs of all of our customers not only here in the UK, but worldwide. We offer equal opportunities to all, regardless of age, nationality, race, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, or religious or political belief. Our inclusive culture celebrates diversity and we welcome applications from all walks of life.

Package

We offer excellent benefits that help make Tesco a great place to work. These include but aren't limited to:

- An annual bonus scheme which you can achieve up to 3.5% of base salary.
- Privilegecard (including a 2nd card for a family member) after 6 months service with 10% off most purchases at Tesco.
- A retirement savings plan - 4%-7.5% contribution rate
- Life Assurance - 5 x contractual pay
- Buy As You Earn Scheme
- Save As You Earn Scheme
- Tesco Car Purchase Scheme (provided by Alphabet).
- Deals & Discounts through Tesco including Tesco Mobile & Tesco Bank
- Deals and Discounts through many other external businesses

Main Responsibilities

- Managing content and product lists to ensure campaigns, events & propositions land on time across all devices.
- Optimising content & the customer journey by monitoring web & trade analytics and search trends and being responsive to changes.
- Using creativity to brief compelling, relevant & inspiring content and ensuring a strong, consistent customer journey through all channels - optimising all content and text for search (SEO) and utilising agency resource in a cost-conscious manner
- Working closely with dunnhumby media sales and comms teams to ensure all supplier-sold campaigns are planned-for, in-line with commercial priorities and in accordance with Tesco guidelines.
- Driving sales, conversion & customer engagement for events, propositions & shopping missions
- Driving continuous improvement of content and customer journeys through strong testing plans every week
- Having high attention to detail and conducting daily quality-checks of all content to maintain legality of the site and ensure all content is correct.
- Keeping up-to-date with trade plan changes, being responsive to changes & problem solving any issues that arise
- Product & promotion data Issue resolution by working with the Commercial Dev, Ops & Range team

Ideal Candidate

Operational Skills

- Excel
- Googledocs
- Outlook
- Workflow process tools / CMS
- Adobe Omniture SiteCatalyst

Relevant Experience

> Experience using project management tools (such as Asana and Trello) to brief, plan and manage tasks is beneficial.

> Experience using data (Omniture, Google Analytics) to inform changes.

>Experience of communication and presenting to senior stakeholders.

> Happy to work in a fast pace and responsive environment.

> Great attention to detail - key skill to spot errors and sign off customer facing content launches.

There is also limited existing business with JLP and DSG that is ripe for long term development. Ideally from either an FMCG non-food or IT/Tech background, you will have existing exposure to National Account Management of Grocery, High Street, Online or IT distribution. Data is everything for this company. Along with their cutting edge platforms, data is their most important asset to help make a global impact on the industry. So this is no ordinary role! There is huge scope for you to make your mark on this company and own this function. You will have the autonomy and freedom to make this role your own and help the business (and their partners) understand what value that data can give to the industry.

This is completely greenfield. You will be implementing data models from scratch, help to devise/ manage meaningful data analysis, use analytics to drive insights into business problems and then turn those problems into strengths, proactively transform data into actionable insights and use your expertise to ensure this function is constantly evolving.

Snap shot of what we are looking for..

We are fairly flexible on your background. We love our working environment and we are keen to find someone who is equally ambitious and ready to make their mark. There are skills that we are happy for you to learn on the job, but having the right attitude/ passion for data is something that we cannot teach. With recent investments, we have a great budget to introduce new technology to our current stack, another way you can make your mark by helping us to implement new technology. The fundamentals that we are looking for:
Understanding of how companies can use to data to drive value
Using Analytics to influence decision making
Work well with a team. Our team heavily embrace Agile, we constantly collaborate and learn from one another. You will also be working with Data Scientist/ Analysts from our partner network.
You will be driving/ owning this function, acting as a Data SME, supporting the business through Data insight. You will need to have the confidence/ eagerness to shape the long-term data strategy across the team.
Interested in and up-to-date with current trends and technologies, with ability to scope out and implement new technologies.
You will need to have experience coding in at least 1 core language R, Java, SQL etc. + some development experience in scripting language (i.e. Python, Shell Script etc.)
You will need to be very comfortable with statistics, with ability to create and apply statistical / predictive models / quantitative approaches for large scale data manipulation and analytics.
Ability to initiate and drive data science processes within the business
We have a mixed environment, but flexible with your background. Any experience with NoSQL, Metabase, Hadoop etc with experience in data extraction, data mining and manipulation.
Data visualisation experience, but we are flexible with the type of tools that you have used (Qlikview, Tableau, PowerBI etc. )
Confidence interpreting data analysis to non-technical stakeholders
Experience in Machine Learning is a massive plus, but you also have the opportunity to put your knowledge around machine learning into practical use!
Most of all you are keen to make an impact on an incredibly lucrative industry. You are not afraid to tackle problems that may not have been solved before.
Because of the nature of this work, we are keen to speak with Data Scientist with Insurance experience, with a sound knowledge of the industry and nature of data.

title: Principal Software Consultant
job_description:
Leading Clients on Best Practice Technical Solutions

Principal Software Consultant
£70,000 - £80,000 + Car + Benefits
Permanent
Hampshire

Who We Are:

With offices around the world, we are a market-leading software house, specialising in large-scale solutions to the Insurance market. Our solutions span the full end-to-end processing of millions of insurance policies around the world, helping our global clients provide you with the protection and service you deserve.

Your New role:

Regarded by both your colleagues and our clients as "The go-to person", you will be Instrumental in the delivery of solutions that resolve complex business issues and lead our clients into expanding business opportunities. You will be the SME, responsible for defining and delivering solutions as well as securing further opportunities within the market.

By forging a strong and trusted reputation, you will examine our clients' needs, defining and owning their vision whilst guiding them in both the technical solutions and business enhancements possible. Your leading involvement will begin at the very start - identifying and driving proposals and further market-leading enhancements, through to development, delivery and beyond.

Strategic in nature, your role will maintain a holistic enterprise-wide view of the technological direction, ensuring we maintain and grow our reputation in delivering high quality, high-impact solutions to the global insurance industry.

What you'll need

As the successful candidate you will demonstrate experience in a similar leading role. Your hands-on technical and insurance knowledge reputation is already well proven and you are familiar working within a consultancy environment. You excel at identifying and resolving large-scale, wide-ranging and often, highly complex business problems and thrive in delivering advisories and solutions that make a big impact to your clients.

Our technical solutions are developed using JAVA technologies and we manage delivery through a number of methodologies such as Waterfall, V-model and Agile. You will be well versed in these and happy to lead multiple projects in a variety of stages and methods.

Your experience will include extensive successes within pre-sales and professional services and extend into the full delivery lifecycle. Our teams are multidisciplinary, often including international "satellite" teams, supporting global implementations.

Future trends and market directions will always be at the forefront of your mind as you lead both ourselves and our clients into new and innovative remedies to an ever increasingly competitive marketplace.

Your background will be technical in natural - either as a Systems or IT Business analyst and are comfortable retaining in-depth product and technical knowledge as you demonstrate and explore the product suite to ensure our clients are able to maximise their capabilities through our solutions.

title: IT Project Manager
job_description:
Our client, a Govt organisation in Hampashire urgently requires a Technical IT Project Manager to manage and successfully deliver large and often complex technical projects to fulfil organisational business requirements, in line with corporate and departmental IT strategy. This role is based in the IT Dept, working with corporate IT infrastructure changes.

Main Responsibilities:

* Manage and successfully deliver projects, ensuring in line with agreed standards, providing fit for purpose solutions within time, quality and budget constraints

* Successfully manage project stakeholders developing strong relations with the key stakeholders and project board members

* Demonstrate strong control of the project delivery, agreeing and managing projects tolerances, utilising project standards and tools to ensure clear governance
* Manage projects for a variety of customers and partners and often a range of projects concurrently
* Identify and manage any project risks, providing appropriate controls and escalation
* Deliver project documentation and communications to a high standard

Person Specification:
Essential Qualifications
* Minimum of good A levels or equivalent plus GCSEs (grade A-C) or equivalent including Maths and English
Desirable Qualifications
* Degree and/or formal industry recognised qualifications
* PRINCE2 Practitioner (or equivalent)
Essential Knowledge, Skills and Experience

* Competence in managing and motivating colleagues on your project team
* Strong competence in project financial management
* Significant skills and experience in project management
* Effective communication skills at all levels, including oral, written, presentation, briefing and influencing others
* Experienced in the preparation of reports for senior management
* Able to establish effective working relationships with people at all levels
* Creative and innovative and able to apply this to produce business relevant solutions
* Self motivated
* Experience of developing and managing test plans
* Hands on experience of Project managing technical projects i.e. working closely with technical staff of varying levels, understanding technical documentation, probing technical options.
Other useful information:-

title: Virtualisation and Cloud Solutions Engineer
job_description:
Virtualisation and Cloud Solutions Engineer

Salary: £35,000 - £40,000 Depending on experience - company bonus scheme of £10,000 - £15,000.

Location: Reading, UK

About us

Mobius Business Technologies is rapidly expanding its technical and sales teams to fulfil the growth potential of this agile virtualisation and cloud business. Employees have the unique opportunity to be part of a team that is building the company from a virtualisation solutions provider to a leading hybrid cloud integrator utilising the latest cloud technologies.

The Virtualisation and Cloud Solutions Engineer Role

This is a role very much yours to make and will suit someone who is a strong self-starter keen to develop a leading-edge skillset in the new cloud and hybrid world. Solutions Engineers at Mobius strive to be the very best of the best.

Each Solutions Engineer brings with them a passion for solving critical business issues through the application of the latest world-class virtualisation and cloud solutions. Mobius SEs work closely with the internal sales team and customers to develop specific solutions for customer requirements and provide added value wherever possible before, during and after the sales process.

Mobius technical team members resolve customers’ technical questions through diligent evaluation, presentation, implementation and troubleshooting by leveraging their experience with virtualization (VMware / Hyper-V) and Cloud (AWS / Azure) technologies, alongside other infrastructure solutions for hybrid deployments.

Responsibilities of the Virtualisation and Cloud Solutions Engineer:

  • Deliver the Mobius message and vision including technical solution presentations and product demonstrations to prospective and existing customers
  • Engage customers and prospects via email, telephone and face-to-face meetings to discuss prospective business and technical solutions as well as post-sales support
  • This role is mostly office based with up to 20% onsite customer meetings or implementation
  • Establish relationships as a trusted technical adviser with customers, prospective customers, vendors, and potential vendors
  • Provide technical guidance and support of sales efforts to drive team-based selling with aligned internal sales team
  • Guide prospective customers through installation of proof of concept solutions, working with customers and the account executive to ensure that the customer purchases the software following the POC
  • Support and own pre and post sales technical issues through to resolution
  • Provide feedback to rest of team and management around new relevant emerging technologies and vendors. Be willing to research these, implement proof of concept and demo to the team

Requirements:

  • The ideal Virtualisation and Cloud Solutions Engineer will need to have 5+ year’s experience
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills including extensive face to face customer experience in a support or pre-sales role
  • The ability to explain technical solutions and concepts to non-technical people
  • Competent skills in use of Microsoft Office 2016 / Office 365
  • Competent skills in use of Microsoft Windows 7, 8 and 10
  • Extensive experience with hypervisor based products/infrastructure (VMWare vSphere or Microsoft Hyper-V)
  • Designing and implementing VMware or Hyper-V solutions
  • Understanding of server and storage concepts, architecture and storage platforms (e.g. SAN/NAS/DAS)
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Windows Server 2016 or Windows Server 2012
  • Excellent written skills for writing up technical proposals and documenting projects

Highly Preferred Skills:

  • Virtualisation or Cloud related technical certifications (e.g. VCP, MCSE, AWS Solutions Architect)
  • Microsoft technical certifications in related subject (e.g. Office 365, Windows Server, Azure)
  • Knowledge of Cloud technologies such as AWS and/or Azure (Office 365) including migration and implementation
  • HP Enterprise (HPE) Server and Storage product experience
  • Virtualisation and Cloud backups solutions such as Veeam
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics 365 or other major CRM application
  • Three years or more experience in an IT Solutions Provider / Integrator environment
  • Demonstrable experience with any of HTML, JavaScript, Powershell or C# technologies
  • Experience in servers, storage, and\or network administration
  • Experience with implementation and administration of Windows Server 2016, 2012 and/or Windows Server 2008 R2 environments
  • Demonstrable experience of TCP/IP networking
  • Ability to test and setup customer-like computing environments for demo/troubleshooting purposes

Benefits offered to the Virtualisation and Cloud Solutions Engineer:

  • 20 days holiday per year rising to 25 days with length of service
  • Enrollment onto the company pension scheme
  • Expensed Mobile Phone

If you feel you’re suitable for this Virtualisation and Cloud Solutions Engineer role, then please apply today!!

title: Magento Software Developer
job_description:
A Magento Software Developer Position working for Lindy Bop in Manchester

Your new company

Lindy Bop are a fast growing E-Commerce fashion business based in the Northern Quarter of Manchester. Since being founded in 2011 by Dylan Cross and Tim Hall this brand has grown to a £12m turnover business specialising in exciting and unique vintage inspired fashion.

Lindy Bop were named in the Sunday Times Fast Track 100, a league table of the 100 fastest growing companies in the UK and are in the process of rolling out their website to countries including Germany and Australia. Lindy Bop is a fast paced, exciting place to work, with great opportunity for career development and new projects, if you are looking for a boring 9-5 this role isn't for you!

Your new role

In your new role you will be responsible for developing both the front and back-end of the Magento E-Commerce site, with this being a stand-alone role you will be reporting into the company directors.

You will be responsible for scoping out new projects according to the nature of the directors requirements and then developing additional functionality in Magento to suit.

Some front end development will also be required, primarily in HTML5 and CSS; however some Javascript scripting may be required from time to time. You will primarily be building additional Magento sites for a variety of countries worldwide in addition to developing plugins and ad-ons to the website.

What you'll need to succeed In order to succeed you will need:

  • Minimum 2 years Magento experience
  • Solid background in HTML / CSS / JavaScript
  • Great enthusiasm
  • Passion for all things fashion and E-Commerce
  • Desire to learn and grow as a software developer


What you'll get in return

In return you will receive a salary of up to £45,000 plus flexible working and 25 days holiday, you will be given the chance to work autonomously and develop strategies for the business in order to maximise growth.

You will also be given opportunities to progress your own personal career into a team leader position and have more overall input into IT strategy. You will be working in a high performing team of staff within Lindy Bop and will be given inspiration to perform your duties to an outstanding standard.

title: Product Owner (Tax & Accounting Software)
job_description:
After a period of successful growth and in order to support an exciting transformation to online digital products we are recruiting a new Product Owner to work as part of a highly collaborative, cross-functional, agile product development team to deliver market leading products and services.

About us...

Wolters Kulwer Tax & Accounting is part of Wolters Kluwer, a global information, software and consultancy provider with over 19,000 employees worldwide and annual revenues of €4.2billion. We have been providing information and advice to lawyers and accountants around the world for over 175 years and are the trusted first point of call for when you have to be right.

In the UK, we are a market leader in the provision of software, training and support to professional accountants and tax advisors, from sole practitioners to most of the UK’s top 100 accounting practices. As well as helping professional firms to manage their own business, our accounting and tax products enable them to provide compliance and value added services to their clients.

About the role...

Based in our modern UKHQ in Kingston upon Thames, this will be a challenging role with full authority and responsibility for determining release content for the online product offerings within our portfolio. The successful candidate will be the evangelist and focal point for these products both inside and outside the company.

You will work within the Scrum framework to direct the team’s efforts towards delivery of the most valuable requirements, taking all necessary decisions to ensure committed stories are completed by the end of each sprint. This is a unique opportunity to take single point of ownership for product delivery, showing leadership of quarterly release planning activities and accountability for the product backlog.

The successful candidate will be a strong communicator and proven decision maker, becoming the focal point for product communications and collaborating with other Product Owners to align suite delivery. As a strong team player, you will contribute to enterprise & product strategy by supporting the product management team in creating product roadmaps.

Accountabilities:

  • Owning and prioritising product backlog;
  • Working in conjunction with Off Shore development team;
  • Eliciting requirements and translating into backlog stories and designs;
  • Attending user groups and client meetings;
  • Quarterly release planning;
  • Cross departmental communication to ensure all areas are in line with product releases.

About you...

Suitable candidate will be able to demonstrate the following:

  • Solid previous experience as a Product Manager/ Product Owner in a similar environment;
  • Excellent stakeholder management skills liaising with internal subject matter experts and clients.
  • Experience working in conjunction with design teams to create and test new concepts. Preferably using lean UX methods.
  • Experience working on cloud technologies essential
  • Experience building mobile apps a plus

title: Operations Manager
job_description:
Cloud Dialogs is a rapidly growing cloud based software company. The business is run hands on by the two owners who are now looking to put a management team in place to take the business forward over the next 5 to 10 years.

We are looking for an intelligent, ambitious and hard working person who will thrive in a small company environment but operate at levels of uncompromised professionalism. Over time for the right candidate this role will grow into a general manager position with remuneration growing in line with the individual commitment and the businesses success.

As a leader in a small company, you will become the person with the deepest understanding of our software and of our customers’ businesses, you will take ownership of complex and high priority customer support issues and constantly be exploring ways to make the company more effective. The nature of the company means you will be exposed to and involved in every aspect of the business, we are not just looking for a professional manager, we need someone with the capability and energy to pick the business up and run with it.

Whilst exact plans will be determined with the successful candidate, we are anticipating a two year learning curve where you will work in different roles across the business to develop the deep understanding required to be able to manage operations. The first six months +/- will primarily be working on implementations, you will be on your own and expected to manage all aspects of the project and ensure the customer is delighted with us as a supplier, this role stretches from project managing to giving training to end users.

Once the necessary level of product and market knowledge has been built, the role will then migrate to predominantly office based, although site visits will probably always remain part of the requirement. For the next six months you will take direct responsibility for customer support. In this role you will have backup from other team members but be expected to demonstrate an ability to handle anything and everything that comes in without backup when needed.

The second year will be a transitional year where the job starts to take its final shape working closely with the directors who still expect to be fully hands-on.

Over time you will take on more of the decision making and ultimately be able to operate and handle the day to day running of the business.

This is a rare opportunity for someone who associates hard work with reward and who likes taking direct ownership of everything they do. We have a market leading software solution, we are always under extreme pressure as a result of our success and growth and we guarantee that you will never get bored.

If you think you have got what we are looking for please get in touch.

For more information on the company go to www.clouddialogs.com

title: Project Manager
job_description:
Project Manager

£47,000-£57,000 plus excellent benefits

Manchester City Centre

As the UK's leading funeral services provider, we value people and pride ourselves on offering a caring, professional and compassionate service. We're ambitious too, and we're growing to meet business need. We are transforming in fact, in order to better serve our clients, re-platforming our IT estate meaning our colleagues can spend more time with our clients. This programme of change will set us up to lead change in the Funeralcare Services Industry too, bettering people's lives. As a result we need great people to join our IT function to make all of this happen, at an exciting time for us.

As a Project Manager at Co-op you'll deliver IT projects which provide core capability as part of the transformation programme. You'll work closely with analysts, designers and development teams to create solutions which are fit for purpose. Of course all of this will need to carefully consider and keep track of budgets, time scales and quality.

What you'll do:

  • Scope, plan, design and deliver projects within the Business Unit change portfolio to agreed timescales, costs and quality standards supporting of execution of the business strategy
  • Manage work streams and IT solution delivery
  • Work closely with internal stakeholders and third parties, managing their contribution throughout the lifetime of the project

To be successful as a Project Manager at Co-op you'll need to be an experienced Project Manager with a knowledge and expertise in IT transformation. You'll join an ambitious and high performing team leading on change, so we'll need to you to passionate about this too. Complimenting your expertise in this area, you'll be an effective communicator.

What you'll bring:

  • Previous project management experience with a value in excess of £250,000
  • Excellent supplier management
  • Experience working with agile/ waterfall based projects
  • Experience from a variety of organisations and/ or industry's over your career to date
  • Degree level of education or equivalent qualification preferably relevant to the role
  • Liaise with business transformation team to align IT delivery to business change drivers

If you can help us grow our business, we can offer you a whole world of opportunity. As well as a competitive salary and some brilliant benefits, you'll get the chance to develop your skills and progress your career with a business that puts people at the heart of its strategy. We're going on an amazing journey.

Why Co-op?

172 years ago a group of businessmen in Rochdale created an idea that changed the world. They believed that when people work together, they're stronger. And that principles are just as important as profits. They were pioneers. And they left us a legacy that's never been more important or relevant than it is today.

We want to change the world all over again. And we know that to achieve our goal, we need to recruit teams that reflect the communities we serve. We're committed to equal opportunities, and we're re-discovering the pioneering spirit on which a British institution was built. If you believe in our purpose, then join us. And make a real contribution to the revival of an iconic British brand.

title: Java Developer - Telecoms. Networking, c++
job_description:
Java Developer - World leading telecoms player. London. C++

State of the art telecoms player, enjoying huge growth, with brand new offices in the heart of London, with free gym, subsidised canteen and onsite bar, my client can offer a first class career at the very forefront of their arena. A competitive basic salary and full benefits package and strong BONUS are on offer. This is top FTSE company, not a role to be missed if you are anspirational java / c++ developer. This role can lead to architecture role.

Description

To work as a member of a team of software developers, responsible for the development and support of my clients Network Monitoring Systems (NMS). which provides a high level overview of the status of all my telecom clients services in real-time. It is relied upon by hundreds of users within the business and through our distribution partners and service providers.

You will be working in a small team of developers, extending NMS from a world class network monitoring system into a broader service monitoring system, with capabilities to monitor the performance of individual user terminals and the end-user applications and meet my clients service monitoring needs for current and future services.

NMS consists of serveral components with a distributed architecture and this includes:

  • The reasoning engine which creates a dynamic real-time object model of each service with associated fault conjectures to model the network and service fault conditions
  • The Information Manager which stores all monitoring data and handles all client access to NMS
  • Various bridges, which handle the interfaces to the network elements to collect the real-time fault, performance and service information, using a variety of interfaces types, such as SNMP, Web APIs, message queues, files and databases
  • Various NMS client applications providing high performance visualisation of the services

You may be expected to work on the development of one or more of the above components, working closely alongside other team members, based on requirements originating from groups mainly within the COO division.

Responsibilities:

  • Working with NMS users to understand new requirements, develop and test new or enhanced features
  • Work with the NMS system designer to contribute to the NMS evolution and shape the future architecture of NMS to support the evolution of NMS from a network monitoring system into a true service monitoring platform
  • Working alongside engineers from the Development & Engineering divisions to understand the design and architecture of new services to be launched and ensuring there are appropriate interfaces to allow NMS to collect monitoring and service information required to support the new services
  • Work with the Service Assurance engineers, Operations staff and Business Units to identify fault and performance issues in the services/networks. Where necessary creating new fault conjectures or performance graphs so that NMS can detect and alert on new issues
  • Support network enginers and service performance specialists in network performance troubleshooting & problem resolution
  • Interact with Operations, Product Support and Customer Support teams to answer customer questions and help resolve customer network issues, identify and resolve software bugs

Essential Knowledge and Skills:

  • BSc in either Computer Science or a technical/engineering discipline
  • A minimum of 3 years of hands-on Java or C++ software development working in a real-time operational environment. If you havent got both then one with a little of the other may suffice.
  • Practical experience of whole software development lifecycle, producing high quality re-useable code in a team environment
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills in teams and corporate environments
  • Experience with technical writing and documentation.
  • Good Windows and Linux background
  • Object Oriented analysis and design using common design patterns
  • A reasonable understanding and appreciation of IT and network security best practices
  • A proactive and solution-oriented approach with attention to detail.

Desirable Knowledge and Skills:

  • Use of the Std C++ and Boost C++ libraries
  • Understanding of IP networks and exposure to network troubleshooting using Wireshark or similar tools
  • Some knowledge of SQL and NOSQL Databases, such as Cassandra
  • Experience in Network Management and network/service KPIs
  • Exposure to Web API programming and Google Web toolkit
  • Experience developing Java and Web based user interfaces

title: Software Developer
job_description:
Software Developer

Location: Treforest near Cardiff, Telford, Aston, Woking, London and other UK locations.
Start date: March, June, September and November intakes.

Be ready to reach for more

Hopes. Dreams. Aspirations. We all have them. And chances are yours aren’t a carbon copy of everyone else’s. That’s why, at Capgemini, we give you options - and the freedom to achieve your ambitions your way.

Join our Capgemini Graduate Community as a Software Developer and, from day one, you’ll be helping to create, develop and deliver cutting-edge solutions to the knottiest client problems. And thanks to our intensely collaborative environment, which allows you to work with and learn from experts in different industries, you’ll be able to continue rising to ever-greater challenges for years to come.

Be one of the team

At Capgemini, we offer smart technical solutions that help organisations across the world become more agile and more competitive. This role puts you right at the heart of it, as you work closely with clients to identify their business requirements before delivering the application or operating environment that best meets their needs.

It’s an opportunity to help businesses tackle some of their most complex challenges while also indulging your passion for software and your love of exploring ideas. You’ll gain experience in everything from coding to testing and will be exposed to all the latest languages, methods, frameworks and tools.

To succeed, you’ll need:

  • You might be a fresh graduate or have already launched your career
  • Computer science degree (or equivalent)
  • You might have developed your own applications or websites. And you’ll certainly understand that engineering is the art of developing code in the right way.
  • Willingness to challenge and be challenged
  • Desire to work with top-tier clients and guide them through change.

Please note: to meet the security clearance requirements you'll need to have lived in the UK for the past five years. If you have spent more than six months outside of the UK during the past five years we will unfortunately not be able to consider your application for this role.

Be rewarded

Accelerated career progression. An environment that encourages entrepreneurial spirit. A flexible benefits package you can tailor to suit you. They’re just some of the rewards we offer at Capgemini.

But perhaps most rewarding of all is the opportunity you’ll get to grow. We may be one of the world’s top consulting, technology and outsourcing organisations, with more than 180,000 people in over 40 countries. But we still have big ambitions - and we’ll rely on you to help us achieve them.

So expect the training, support and challenge you need to capitalise on what makes you special - and to confidently pursue the career path that most inspires you.

It’s all part of our commitment to hiring the best people and enabling them to achieve their full potential with us, regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity.

Be the you, you want to be.

Find out more about joining the Capgemini Graduate Community as a Software Developer by visiting the website.
