job_description:
Network Solution Architect - L Band, Telecoms, Satellite, IP , CISCO, IDirect, networking, CCNP, CCIE

WORLD LEADING TELECOMS HOUSE with plush modern offices in the heart of London, free gym, subsidised canteen and onsite bar, my client can offer a state art environment and a first class career at the forefront of the telecoms arena. A full benefits package, LARGE PENSION and LARGE BONUS are on offer. Flexible working hours.

Primary Purpose of the Role:

My clientS business area G2 is the leading commercial provider of Mobile Satellite Services to Governments around the world. You are responsible for creating innovative solutions based on the core network you are responsible for (e.g. GX, L band and Leasing) as well as managing interaction with the technical teams supporting and operating the relevant core network e.g. COO and CTO groups. This role is designed to ensure G2 provides offers based on the innovative use of my clients core networks whilst also ensuring G2 is abreast of what the network operations and design teams are planning for the future of these core networks.

Reporting to the Director, Solutions Engineering - Networks within G2 the successful candidate will provide the most innovative and commercially attractive solutions for G2’s customer base in support of the sales teams.

Key Responsibilities:

Primary

  • Demonstrate a high level of technical skill & knowledge in the core network you are responsible for and in a way that is most, relevant to G2 (e.g. govt satellite systems) as well as an ability to share this knowledge with the Solutions Engineering - Networks team, in a way that grows the team members knowledge.
  • In conjunction with the Director, Solutions Engineering - Networks develop and execute a compelling knowledge sharing strategy that focuses on sharing your high end Inmarsat network knowledge with the PSE team allowing them to provide the first line of technical sales interface with G2’s customers.
  • Provide support for G2 bids, offers and marketing activities by ensuring any product or service designed to leverage the high end use of my clients networks includes an innovation component making G2’s offer more operationally attractive.
  • Develop deep relationships with the relevant ‘network owner’ within COO and CTO teams thus ensuring both G2 and the relevant contacts within these functions are equally aware of the others priorities.

    Secondary

    • Create and deliver, reports and other documented metrics as agreed and required by the business
    • Support the sales channel with customer demonstrations and technical solution training as directed by the BU’s operational processes
    • Engage with multiple stakeholders on complex projects negotiating with all parties to define, shape and understand technical requirements and act as a trusted adviser to the user community on technical issues
    • Where appropriate oversee the quality and integration of all aspects of the solutions architecture working to a prescribed budget and delivery plan
    • Operate as a subject matter expert at technical meetings
    • Maintain an in-depth understanding of key market domain dynamics (operational needs, constraints and tempo) , competitor activities and solutions used by government clients
    • Essential Knowledge and Skills:
    • Degree level education
    • 5+ years’ work experience of working with complex projects in a senior technical role
    • Good knowledge of IP networks especially with Government domains
    • Accustomed to working in cross-functional teams in an international environment and generating action
    • Strong influencing and persuasion skills in both written and verbal communication
    • Good negotiation skills
    • Good organisational/project/stakeholder/team management skills
    • Good interpersonal and rapport building skills
    • Good decision-making skills
    • Proficient IT skills: ability to use in-house software – predominately Microsoft Office programmes to an advanced level (particularly MS Excel and MS Word)
    • Fluency in written and spoken business English

    Desirable Knowledge and Skills:

    • Be technically fluent on my clients services and network infrastructure including L-band and GX networks
    • Experience of Network design and Network Operations with a global carrier
    • Understanding of mobile satellite, fixed satellite and cellular industry (for example 3G, Cisco and iDirect technologies) or recognised niche systems integration activities
    • Knowledge of the Government market
    • Fluency in additional languages

title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer - Linux/vCloud/Jenkins/IaaS
job_description:

Candidates must have VmWare vCloud experience, Linux and Jenkins (or Git, SaltStack, Ansible) experience. 6-month contract starting immediately. £550 to £600 per day. Central London.

Are you a Senior Cloud Infrastructure Engineer who is able to hit the floor running from day one and providehands-on business critical DevOps/CloudOps expertise? You will have a track record of feeding into the infrastructure architectural solutions and proactively identify improvements and efficiencies by utilising new technologies and existing tools.

You will have the following Cloud Infrastructure engineering experience, skills & technology understanding:

- Produce secure scalable, cost effective cloud based infrastructure and develop/maintain DevOps/CloudOps tools and services such as performance/security/capacity monitoring; deployment/configuration/automation; continuous integration & continuous delivery of cloud infrastructure that underpin Agile (Kanban/Scrum) delivery.

- Solid expertise of using the following DevOps technologies in complex technical environments; vCloud, OpenStack, Linux, Jenkins, Git, SaltStack, Ansible, REST API's, Vagrant, Terraform, Open Source technologies.

- Extensive knowledge in DevOps/CloudOps principles: automation, infrastructure as a code, designing environments to support production and design/support robust build, deployment and configuration management systems for multi-tier applications.

- Storage design/architecture at multi-PB scale and object storage and Big Data environments.
- Understanding of networks, concepts, designs & protocols ie: TCP/IP, HTTP, SSL.

Experience in the following would be desirable:

- AAA (LDAP, Kerberos, Active Directory)
- ForgeRock Products: OpenIDM / OpenDJ
- EMC Isilon

Interested? Send your CV along with examples of similar projects within Cloud Infrastructure to Kelly or Andrew at Inspire People; alternatively please contact us for more information regarding the assignment.

Inspire People is an employment business providing services to candidates and clients.

DevOps/CloudOps, infrastructure engineering, IaaS, vCloud, Linux, Jenkins, CI, CD, Agile Principles, Kanban, Scrum, TCP/IP, HTTP, LDAP, Kerberos, Active Directory, AAA

title: Senior Systems Engineer Linux/Automation  - Thailand
job_description:
Calling all talented Senior Systems Engineers (Linux), Our client is searching for someone who has a passion for systems automation and who lives and breathes DevOps culture. We are looking for someone to help them continue to build on one of the biggest Openstack Private Clouds globally. Ideally someone who loves to solve scaling infrastructure with open source technologies, and may even contribute themselves!

*Please note this role is located in Bangkok, Thailand - full relocation and visa sponsorship available*

Experience/Requirements:

  • Willing to relocate to Thailand
  • At least 5+ years in systems engineering.
  • Bachelor's degree or higher in IT, Computer Science, Engineering or any field
  • Technical experience in:
    • Linux (CentOS/RH preferred)
    • Configuration Management (eg. Ansible, Puppet and Salt Stack)
    • Scripting with bash, python
    • Database development/administration. Knowledge of (or willingness to learn) NoSQL databases (Elasticsearch or Cassandra would be beneficial). Knowledge of caching.
    • General Networking (switches, routing, firewalls).
    • Monitoring/Alerting/Logging Services (Sensu, Nagios, logstash, graphite, grafana, kibana)
    • Understanding of Auth/Directory services
    • Understanding of Storage Concepts
    • Virtualisation (KVM is preferred).
    • Containers (Docker)
    • Experienced in scripting such as Bash, Python, Powershell etc.
  • Experience working with large and dynamic server farms, preferably in the e-commerce space.
  • Knowledge of OpenStack operation and its API's is advantageous
  • Experience collaborating with developers and operations in DevOps enabled environments.
  • Experience working in a large enterprise organization and dynamic environment.
  • Knowledge of Windows is desirable
  • Development experience in python or ruby is desirable
  • Able to work under pressure and deliver projects on time.
  • Self-motivated, approachable, and adaptable and have excellent communication skills (both strong written and verbal English is a must).

Do you have what it takes?

  • A strong desire to learn.
  • The desire to keep up with the latest technologies and stay ahead of the curve.
  • Great communication and interpersonal skills; a good sense of humor is always a plus.
  • Mindset of a team player.

Responsibilities/Key skills:

  • Develop and uses tools for systems and infrastructure automation
  • Manage and support our client's large scale Openstack private cloud.
  • Troubleshoot system and OS level issues at scale across multiple global DCs
  • Research and development of infrastructure service improvements and presentations during design reviews with stakeholders around the business.
  • Manage custom packages
  • Mentoring of other System Engineers within the team including technical documentation and training.

The Client:

Our client is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia and part of the largest online travel company in the world. Maintaining this position requires an incredible amount of data, a superior IT infrastructure, and world class talent to bring it all together. Technology is not just what they do - it's at the heart of who they are. They have the dynamism and short chain of command of a startup and the capital to make things happen. They love innovation and putting new technologies to work to extend their lead on the competition.

What's stopping you from getting in touch?

Working in one of the largest international Internet employers headquartered in Asia, your work has an impact on what they do around the globe. They move fast - why wait ages to see your ideas go live? Work on tough challenges, safe in the knowledge that you are surrounded by people as smart as you are (if not smarter!) to help solve them. And while we're on the subject, their employees come from over 65 countries: It's an incredible technical creative melting pot.

With relocation support and visa sponsorship available they've got you covered, leaving you free to look forward to an amazing new experience! Please apply now if interested.

title: Assistant Technical Author
job_description:
Assistant Technical Author - 3 Month Contract - Bournemouth

I am currently recruiting for an Assistant Technical Author for a 3 month contract based in Bournemouth. The main purpose of this position is to assist with the developing and updating end user documentation for the IT Services Department.

The successful candidate will work closely across the IT Services teams to understand and learn about the services provided, to develop easy to use and accurate information, producing documentation that will be published in web-based and traditional formats.

Your documentation will also be used for future training of end users. The Assistant Author will update existing technical and functional references, training and on-line documentation, assisting with quality management and continuous improvement processes.

In addition to the documentation you will also assist with analysing incidents and requests logged to IT Services where end user information is not available, or accurate, to help develop and improve end user skills.

We're looking for someone who has existing knowledge of computer services, systems and delivery, as well as basic knowledge of Document Management Systems. The Assistant Technical Author will have excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to interact well across a number of departments and teams.

Following a methodical and disciplined approach to gathering information you will be able to demonstrate your attention to detail, as well as excellent customer service skills.

If you have previous experience producing technical documentation and training material please send your CV for a quick response. We are looking to arrange interviews week commencing 13/02/17.

title: Workforce Mgmt Planning Analyst - Call Center -- Bangkok
job_description:
Workforce Management Planning Analyst - Call Center -- TH-Bangkok

PLEASE NOTE THIS ROLE IS BASED IN BANGKOK THAILAND AND YOU MUST BE WILLING TO RELOCATE (FULL VISA AND RELOCATION PACKAGE PROVIDED)

Company:

Our client is one of the largest online hotel and accommodation platforms in the world. Offering over 700,000 properties in 197 different destinations in 38 languages, their globe-spanning network of travel experts are at the cutting edge of an industry that is rapidly transforming the way the world travels.

Their workforce of over 1,800 comprises 64 nationalities, and is truly one of their biggest strengths. They pride themselves on a dynamic workplace where creativity thrives and collaboration is key. A positive, enjoyable culture where people work hard but smile often is what keeps their team spirit high, and they encourage communication to be open, frequent, and constructive.

Role:

The Workforce Management Planning Analyst is responsible for overseeing the day to day Contact Center workforce planning team. This includes leading a variety of workforce planning activities and recommending appropriate staffing decision as well as performing deep dive analysis and actions to meet SLAs and KPIs, in order to improve operations and customer experience for customers in the company's vibrant multilingual customer experience group (CEG).

Responsibilities:

  • Utilize workforce management software to forecast contact volume and schedule staff. Knowledge in workforce management software preferably in Verint WFM tool.
  • Analyze contact volume patterns by campaigns, contact group, queues and agents' skillsets.
  • Assist the Forecasting & Scheduling analyst in developing forecasting models to predict voice contact volume and key call statistics, email volume, and the addition of future media types such as chat.
  • Communicate necessary real time and proactive adjustments to workforce plan based on changing/dynamic forecasts and re-forecast when necessary.
  • Ensure schedules are generated on a timely manner to maximize effective allocation of resources
  • Assist in identification of call volume trends and averages on an hourly, daily, monthly, quarterly, and seasonal basis considering holiday factor to volumes.
  • Capture, store, and report on historical statistics (service level, occupancy/utilization, forecast accuracy, etc.)
  • Collaborate with other departments, team managers, service delivery managers to identify opportunities for improvement of resource utilization
  • Analyzing workload, vacation and absence records, training, meeting and coaching schedules (shrinkage) for on-going historical trend analysis and planning and forecasting purposes.
  • Advising Team Managers and Management team of observed issues and/or trends.
  • Leading special workforce management-related projects.

Requirements:

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent business experience required.
  • Experience with Verint's Impact 360 Workforce Optimization software or similar tool required
  • At least 2 to 5 years' experience in SME on Forecasting & Staffing process or in call/contact center operations
  • Excellent planning and time management skills
  • Excellent email writing skills, specific to customer facing interactions.
  • Excellent diagnostic and troubleshooting skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal English
  • Excellent analytical and communication skills.
  • Excellent in data visualization
  • Ability to work in virtual and multi-cultural team environment.
  • High level of proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint
  • Rigorous, able to cross-check results before presenting/delivering and keep common sense
  • High level of accuracy and attention to detail
  • Self-motivated person with "Get it done!" attitude
  • Eager to learn and improve him/herself
  • Proactive, practical and solution oriented
  • Ability to adapt in a fast pace environment
  • Capable to meet deadlines, to work under pressure and with changing priorities
  • Ability to teamwork as well as work independently
  • Ability to multi-tasks and work with minimal supervision

Good to have

  • Experience with Avaya products: Avaya Aura Contact Center (AACC), Avaya Contact Center Manager (ACCM), Work Force Management (WFM)
  • Understanding of Customer satisfaction concepts and metrics including Net Promoter Score (NPS), Customer Satisfaction (CSAT), contact center service levels

On Offer:

  • Be part of an exciting data-driven team
  • Opportunity to propose ideas to improve CEG operations based on data and have an impact on the customer experience
  • Possibility for continuous learning and development through corporate learning programs
  • Young and dynamic multinational team

Full relocation assistance and visa sponsorship on offer for overseas candidates.

noSQL datastore experience - Google High Replication Datastore, Google Cloud Datastore, Amazon DynamoDb, MongoDb

title: Software Engineer
job_description:
Software Engineer (Technical)
Norwich

An exciting opportunity for an experienced software engineer focused on playing a leading role in the development and support of business critical financial platforms. This involves working on multiple applications, operating across virtual sites with a number of suppliers to service all UK business areas.

Applications include Oracle financials (GL), SOA, HR payroll, PCI compliant card vault, Cash & Banking, expenses, procurement and Unit Pricing and Valuation (Life). The applications are currently based upon a tradition hosting model; however we will be looking for a candidate capable of supporting our strategy to move to cloud based offerings.

Your accountability will be to provide technical assurance, ensuring compliance to standards for change initiatives, whilst maintaining a robust and secure production service that underpins Aviva.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Researching, designing and specification of applications.
  • Governance of existing programs, analysing and identifying areas for modification.
  • Integrating new and existing software products for e2e service provision.
  • Input to technical standards.
  • Support the evolution of our Dev ops capability (Infrastructure as Code and software engineering practices).
  • Ensuring the security, performance, monitoring and non-functional requirements are inherent within designs.
  • Problem management including root cause investigations and prioritisation of resolutions.
  • Performance and availability management including system health checks, performance monitoring and disaster recovery planning.
  • Capacity management including working with others to manage physical capacity, licence management and future capacity planning.
  • Service improvements including production of improvement plans and applying software upgrades.
  • Supporting systems audit activities and overseeing remedial actions required for compliance.
  • Own working relationships with internal and external service providers to ensure continuity of Business and application service.
  • Subject matter expert providing advice, guidance, training and governance in their areas of expertise.
  • Support of new projects and initiatives, assessing the impact of initiatives or projects on systems/applications.
  • Undertaking design and code reviews to ensure systems meet functional and non functional requirements and proactively identifying where changes are required to maintain these in the future


Skills & Experience required

  • Knowledge of the Oracle e-business suite application and associated technical platforms and operating systems (Exadata, AIX, UNIX, Linux and AWS Cloud / SaaS)
  • Knowledge of the Oracle e-business suite application and associated financial business processes (includingGL/ AR / AP, Cash and Banking) and Industry wide financial practices.
    • Experience in maintaining high availability, high volume, business critical and resilient applications, ensuring compliance with upgrade paths and security patching.
    • Knowledge of Dev ops practices and Software Engineering tooling.
    • Leadership on technical recommendations for Production issues and change solutions
    • Environment management and planning
    • Technical liaison and negotiation with third party suppliers and hosting partners
    • Knowledge of modern software engineering and Dev-Ops
    • Knowledge of systems security and controls
    • Ability to influence and make key decisions.


We offer a competitive salary and fantastic benefits, including excellent pension and bonus potential, as well as generous annual leave.

We're here to free people from the fear of uncertainty. Our insurance, savings and investment products help some 31 million customers enjoy life today, knowing that tomorrow is covered. And we definitely know how to look after our own people. If you love doing a great job to improve things for customers, you'll be at home here. Help us build a future to be proud of and get ready to fulfil your potential with Aviva.

title: Global Network Engineer
job_description:
Latham & Watkins, a leading global law firm, is currently seeking a Global Network Engineer to join our newest office in Manchester. Latham & Watkins' Manchester office is an integral part of our high-performing and talented global services team, complementing and enhancing our existing support capability. Our new Manchester global services office is an exciting development for the firm and a testament to our continued international growth.

Latham & Watkins is committed to attracting the best and brightest talent. The firm is dedicated to fostering an environment that supports personal and professional development. Latham's global platform, unique collaborative culture, and deep resources provide unparalleled opportunities for career progression.

Latham offers a generous total compensation package with bonuses awarded in recognition of both individual and firm performance. Eligible employees can participate in Latham's comprehensive benefit program which includes health insurance as well as group income protection and life assurance, a pension plan, wellness programs, employee discounts and more.

The Global Network Engineer works as a member of the Global Services Organisation Technology department to assist with the design, deployment and support of technology and information services across the firm. The Global Network Engineer will be responsible for the design, operation and support of the firm's wired and wireless LAN, WAN & Telephony solutions in multiple practice office locations worldwide.

Responsibilities include:

  • Provides remote support to multiple global locations for all relevant network and voice technologies and services
  • Managing Cisco wireless LAN infrastructure (Access Points, Wireless controllers)
  • Assists manager with wireless site surveying of global practice offices and making recommendations for future development of wireless infrastructure
  • Management/Support of Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE)
  • Management/Support of Cisco IP telephony (CallManager)
  • Management/Support of Cisco wired LAN infrastructure (switches, routers, firewalls)
  • Using and developing further use of Cisco Prime for configuration and asset management
  • Data/Information Security
  • Assists Manager with planning and implementing firm-wide network upgrade and migration activity as it relates to networking and telephony
  • Provides solutions to further enhance the stability, security and reliability of the enterprise network
  • Coordinates the management of voice & data service providers and subscribed services, including but not limited to circuit ordering/termination, coordinated maintenance, problem resolution, and performance monitoring
  • Assist Manager with security audits and required changes
  • Works with the Global Enterprise Monitoring team to further enhance the performance, monitoring and alerting of network and telephony services
  • Coordinates with relevant internal groups and management to ensure that global configuration standards are maintained for all areas of responsibility
  • Creates, maintains, and amends technical documentation as required
  • Maintains inventory of spare networking hardware. Maintains and tracks associated software and firmware revisions and patches to keep to global standards
  • Offers escalation support for end-user and help-desk functions.
  • Provides out-of-hours support of Global technology infrastructure as needed
  • Assist Manager with validation of project requirements, defining project scope, developing schedules and producing detailed designs for projects
  • Promotes effective work practices, works as a team member, and shows respect for co-workers

Work experience to Cisco CCNA/CCNP Routing & Switching level or above is required and candidates with CCNA/CCNP wireless and/or Ekahau ECSE are strongly desired. ITIL Foundation level experience/training is desired. A Bachelor's degree or Higher Education Diploma in Information Technology or related field is desired. Equivalent work experience can be considered in lieu of Bachelor's degree.

Excellent knowledge in at least TWO of the following and strong knowledge in all other areas:

  • Cisco Wireless technologies
  • Ekahau Site Survey
  • Cisco Prime (or equivalent configuration and asset management tools)
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine
  • Cisco CallManager
  • Software Defined Networking

The successful candidate has well developed and professional interpersonal skills; ability to interact effectively with people at all organisational levels of the firm; analytical skills needed to troubleshoot a variety of symptoms, diagnose problems, and test, recommend and implement solutions to technology incidents and problems; ability to handle confidential and sensitive information with the appropriate discretion; ability to work in a team environment with a customer service focus; ability to manage vendors; strong communication skills, both written and verbal; organisational skills needed to manage time well, prioritise effectively, and handle multiple deadlines.

Latham & Watkins is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our commitment to diversity, equal opportunity and sustainability enables Latham & Watkins to draw from a remarkable wealth of talent to create one of the world's leading law firms.

If so, software development is renowned as one of the fastest growing industries worldwide and is a great money earner; if you’re interested why not start your journey today?

The Training Room are keen to find individuals who are eager to learn and are motivated to start a career in software development. Our qualification has been developed based on feedback from the people that matter the most; leading employers. It doesn’t matter if you are a complete novice without any experience but like the idea of starting a career in this dynamic trade, or someone who has picked up the basic’s and now wants to turn it into an internationally recognised qualification.

  • Java
  • HTML5

  • JavaScript

title: Global Technology Support Trainer French/German
job_description:
Latham & Watkins, a leading global law firm, is currently seeking a Global Technology Support Trainer to join our vibrant office in Manchester. As one of the largest law firms in the world, Latham's commitment to attracting the best and brightest talent has greatly contributed to the firm's success. Driven by the belief that our strongest asset is our people, Latham & Watkins is dedicated to fostering an environment that supports personal and professional development. Latham's global platform, unique collaborative culture, and deep resources provide unparalleled opportunities for career progression.

Latham offers a generous total compensation package with bonuses awarded in recognition of both individual and firm performance. Eligible employees can participate in Latham's comprehensive benefit program which includes health insurance as well as group income protection and life assurance, a pension plan, wellness programs, employee discounts and more.

The Global Technology Support Trainer provides a variety of software training and application support services to employees across various offices in Europe & the Middle East. He or she identifies training needs of Latham employees via training requests, new technology, analysis and help desk reports. The Trainer is also responsible for working with his or her team to develop and implement effective training programs by using a variety of different tools, media and software. He or she also provides support to the European & Middle Eastern offices regarding the resolution of desktop, notebook, and remote computing issues. Roles and responsibilities also include:

  • Provides assistance and training to end users for firm-approved applications in a variety of different methods (e.g. classroom, one on one, video, online eLearning systems and remote training). Software includes: Microsoft Office, Outlook, iManage, Cisco phone software, and other programs as deemed necessary.
  • Works with team members in technology or other departments to identify training needs, and create methods for proper instruction. Analyzes training needs and develops programs to meet those needs. Also develops training programs based on analysis of service desk reports.
  • Prepares training documentation, handouts, outlines, instructions, and other materials as needed.
  • Participates in firm-wide training conference calls and/or smaller working groups to prepare for upgrades, writing materials, and learning processes.
  • Creates classes designed to promote the most effective use of technology. Training may be given via telephone, hands-on classes, demonstrations, online learning systems, video conferences or one-on-one training.

The successful candidate should have the following knowledge, skills and abilities:

  • Ability to quickly learn and master new technologies and concepts.
  • Must have knowledge and proficiency in a wide variety of software programs, including Windows 7/10 and Microsoft Office (latest versions) Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Outlook. Also including iManage Desksite and DTE Axiom, timekeeping software.
  • Knowledge of Adobe Acrobat (e.g. extracting/inserting pages, text recognition/OCR).
  • Develops knowledge of Cisco Phone software.
  • Knowledge and proficiency of various remote communication methodologies required, including RDS and VPN technologies.
  • Working knowledge of internetworking, TCP/IP, client/server relationships, network printing and Active Directory is highly beneficial.
  • Develops knowledge of Latham & Watkins templates and macros, the intranet, DTE and IM software.

A High School Diploma or equivalent required. A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field is preferred. German or French language training or equivalent is preferred. Proficiency in written and spoken German or French is highly desirable. Previous software training experience is desired. Previous PC helpdesk/applications support desired.

Latham & Watkins is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our commitment to diversity, equal opportunity and sustainability enables Latham & Watkins to draw from a remarkable wealth of talent to create one of the world's leading law firms

title: Educational Software Project Manager / Business Analyst
job_description:
This role is a great mix of Business Analysis / project Management and Implementation , very much a client facing role .

You are expected to develop and display excellent communication skills, both written and verbal as well as exemplary client facing skills, to support the client throughout the implementation process.

This work includes liaising with the client at all stages of the projects allocated to you, to develop a good working relationship with the client and to be responsible for effective and timely communication with both the client and your colleagues.

You will assume responsibility for the delivery of any project tasks allocated to you. You are expected to display the highest level of professional standards at all times when dealing with clients.

Where you are allocated the role of Project Manager, you will assume responsibility for the delivery of projects allocated to you; you will be expected to lead multi-disciplined teams to deliver the project to the agreed requirements, timescales and budget within clearly defined governance structures.

You will be knowledgeable of project management and software development life-cycle methodologies. Key Responsibilities

1. As an Implementation Consultant you will assist in all stages of the implementation of the clients software, or project life cycle and governance (when in the role of Project Manager), including, but not limited to: 

Implementation 

Requirements Analysis 

Application Design 

Implementation Design 

Implementation and configuration of the software 

Software testing 

2. Implementation tasks and projects may be directly for a client or as part of an internal company project.

3. The above activities are all part of a project implementation and you may carry out or assist with one or more of these activities for any number of clients/projects. You will be expected to manage a multi-disciplined team to ensure that the project life-cycle is executed to deliver the project requirements (when in the role of Project Manager). Please note this is not a technical role - installations and technical troubleshooting are carried out by our Technical Services Team, although any technical experience you have will be beneficial for this role.

4. Working at my client means that you are routinely exposed to a wide array of technologies. My client is an IT solutions supplier; customers may therefore reasonably expect members of the team to have a certain level of working knowledge of IT systems. Furthermore, having this knowledge helps you to distinguish between technology, people and process issues. You are expected to build on your existing knowledge, particularly where it is required directly on a given project.

5. Where you are to carry out training for clients, this will normally take place on the client’s premises.

6. Software testing is part of the software implementation. If you are allocated this role within a project, you will be expected to test any software which has been developed for the project, or manage and oversee all testing activities (when in the role of Project Manager), ensuring that it is fit for purpose and meets the client’s requirements.

7. You may also be required to input to the Pre-Sales support process, either by developing and/or presenting software demonstrations, at any stage of the sales process, or by preparing responses to specific tender/or other, questions allocated to you. Questions/Demonstrations allocated to you will relate only to areas of the software upon which you have specific experience, or where you are considered the most

title: Java Developer - GAIN SOLR JAVA 8 Ansible Spring Boot
job_description:
Java Developer - GAIN SOLR JAVA 8 Ansible Spring Boot.

Looking for Java Developer to work with the UK's fastest growing online travel company. You will get to gain SOLR Java 8 Ansible and Spring Boot. Working on developing a whole new booking application that will enable a smart insight to enhance the experience of users across their platform.
This company have gone from strength to strength through 2016 and 2017 will be no different! They have built an incredibly complex search function with SOLR. This also has a Machine Learning platform built in and they have had great response to this.

As a Java Developer working on the new booking application you will be working in a team that is integrating multiple RESTful APIs and also building new ones for consumption by their internal systems. You will also get the chance to gain DevOps! This will all be done using Java 8.

The Skill set you will need for this role is Java 7, Spring, jUnit and Jenkins to be able to hit the ground running. In addition to this experience with SOLR, Spring Boot, Camel and Ansible would be great but not necessary. You will also get the opportunity to work on Machine Learning should you wish.

The salary for this role is very competitive and is purely based on the experience that you will bring to this role. You will also get training invested in you! This is includes gaining Java 8, Spring Boot and DevOps if you wish. It is a really cool environment too, where a social Java Developer will fit right in!

If you are a Java Developer looking for a new challenge then I would love to hear from you. Please contact Sam Murray at Talent Point on or apply through this advert.

title: Java / Oracle Developer - Large Enterprise Software 45k
job_description:
My client is a global tech consultancy . This division works within the UK Education sector . The role will primarily be Oracle Forms , but there will be plenty of Java to get involved with .

You must have at least 3 to 5 years experience development experience of Oracle Forms and of PL SQL.

You will be developing maintaining and supporting education management systems. So any experience of local authority or education applications would be very handy.

This is role where you will be supporting and working on Oracle Forms and PL SQL applications. The Client also uses Java J2EE and XML so they would be very keen to talk to candidates with either or both Java and XML.

title: Data Analyst to move into Data Science - Insurtech, huge p
job_description:
Data Analyst (to move into Data Science) - Insurtech, huge progression

Although only 4 years old, this company have made a huge impact on the insurance industry. Utilising data in an intelligent way to improve customer engagement and replacing generic methods with a more personalised approach. Their forward thinking solutions are transforming the future of insurance and with a £10 mil. investment, this is merely the beginning…

Their talented team have built a robust platform that is collecting incredibly valuable data. But right now, not much is being done with that data. With ambitious plans to grow into a data analytics organisation, they need an equally ambitious Data Analyst to extract value from the data and use this to power the innovative platforms. You will be working directly with the CEO and CTO to investigate new ways of using the data to grow their partner base and organisation as a whole.

Data is everything for this company. Along with their cutting edge platforms, data is their most important asset to help make a global impact on the industry. So this is no ordinary role! There is huge scope for you to make your mark on this company and own this function. You will have the autonomy and freedom to make this role your own and help the business (and their partners) understand what value that data can give to the industry.

This is completely greenfield. You will be implementing data models from scratch, help to devise/ manage meaningful data analysis, use analytics to drive insights into business problems and then turn those problems into strengths, proactively transform data into actionable insights and use your expertise to ensure this function is constantly evolving.

Snap shot of what we are looking for..

We are fairly flexible on your background. We love our working environment and we are keen to find someone who is equally ambitious and ready to make their mark. There are skills that we are happy for you to learn on the job, but having the right attitude/ passion for data is something that we cannot teach. With recent investments, we have a great budget to introduce new technology to our current stack, another way you can make your mark by helping us to implement new technology. The fundamentals that we are looking for:
Understanding of how companies can use to data to drive value
Using Analytics to influence decision making
Work well with a team. Our team heavily embrace Agile, we constantly collaborate and learn from one another. You will also be working with Data Scientist/ Analysts from our partner network.
You will be driving/ owning this function, acting as a Data SME, supporting the business through Data insight. You will need to have the confidence/ eagerness to shape the long-term data strategy across the team.
Interested in and up-to-date with current trends and technologies, with ability to scope out and implement new technologies.
You will need to have experience coding in at least 1 core language R, Java, SQL etc. + some development experience in scripting language (i.e. Python, Shell Script etc.)
You will need to be very comfortable with statistics, with ability to create and apply statistical models to business problems
Ability to initiate and drive projects
We have a mixed environment, but flexible with your background. Any experience with NoSQL, Metabase, Hadoop etc with experience in data extraction, data mining and manipulation.
Data visualisation experience, but we are flexible with the type of tools that you have used (Qlikview, Tableau, PowerBI etc. )
Confidence interpreting data analysis to non-technical stakeholders
Experience in Machine Learning is a massive plus, but you also have the opportunity to put your knowledge around machine learning into practical use!
Most of all you are keen to make an impact on an incredibly lucrative industry. You are not afraid to tackle problems that may not have been solved before.

In addition to an awesome team and the opportunity to work in a company that have already been named as one of the most influential organisations' to work with… you will also get:
Opportunity to earn stock options
Gymbox membership (worth £90+ a month)
Food vouchers
Training budget specifically for each employee on training needs, certifications, conferences etc.
Free breakfasts and snacks
Awesome office in the heart of Soho
Super talented, social and friendly team
VC backed company
25 Days holiday + public holidays
Genuine opportunity to grow with an ambitious company

If you've not quite got that 2017 opportunity yet to transform your career and change your life, and you're reading this thinking that this could be it… why not apply? You never know unless you try. If you're feeling a bit undervalued, not challenged enough, keen to take the next step… whatever it may be. I want to hear from you. Send your CV to /

job_description:
Agresso (Unit4 Business World) Systems Analyst (£35K-£40K)

A newly created role has just been released! Are you the right person for this high profile nationwide Agresso implementation? This position will get you ahead of the competition by gaining exposure to Agresso in 2017.
The role will be based in the Finance team and will involve continuous improvement of the Agresso system, along with amending any errors that arise. You will be the key adviser on the Agresso help desk, and be the expert in resolving any issues. To be successful in this role you will need:

- Strong Agresso knowledge, including experience of process in all back office functions.
- Experience with SQL.
- Excellent communication skills.
- Experience of working within a large finance function.

Here at WFI we lead the way in Agresso recruitment, so we will only talk to you about roles in this space. Due to our position in the market, our clients trust us to find the best. If you want to embrace this amazing opportunity, register your interest now.

title: Developer
job_description:
Developer Opportunity To Work For A Market Leading Investment Bank

Essential

  • SQL
  • C#
  • SSIS
  • Market or Credit Risk experience is highly advantageous

My client is a market leading Tier 1 Investment Bank looking for an additional member of the team. If you are looking to work in an exciting environment where you are able to develop yourself whilst learning new things, then you are in the right place

Your new role
You will be working as part of the Risk team where you will be developing Market and Credit Risk Solutions. You will work with a variety of different team from Business Analysts to Risk Managers. You will analyse requirements and build robust solutions where needed.

What you'll need to succeed
You will be experienced with C#, SQL and SSIS, and have be self-starter. If you have banking experience, it will be an added bonus. Good communication skills are a must as you will be liaising with different members of the team on a daily basis.

What you'll get in return
My client is willing to pay up to £70k for the right candidate with an amazing bonus and benefits package. On top this, you will only be helping your own progression by working for a leading investment bank, where they encourage you to succeed.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

title: Sitecore  Engineer - GREENFIELD/E-COMMERCE/CLOUD
job_description:
Sitecore Engineer - GREENFIELD/E-COMMERCE/CLOUD

Sitecore Engineer - A leading Web Application and Software Development Organisation based in the heart of London are in the process of building a brand new team for GREENFIELD Project builds around E-Commerce and CMS projects. The company is incredibly forward thinking in their approach to development with everything being built using the latest .Net technologies in a cloud-based micro-service infrastructure.

We are looking for a prodigy in the making! The C# .Net Engineer will be working in a highly collaborative team working closely with the Tech Lead purely on Greenfield projects. We are not looking for the finished article here as you will receive constant support from senior peers to help your continuous development. You will however need:

Experience with Sitecore (preferably version 8)
Experience building robust Web applications in C#/MVC
A good background construction RESTful services (Web API)
Experience in an TDD, Agile environment

If you are looking to work in a massively varied roles, continuously working on new projects with a company that values its employees and is at the forefront of the .Net world, then this is for you! Huge growth opportunities, great bonus and benefits package and modern office in the heart of London.

title: Education Implementation / Training Consultant - PM
job_description:
This role is a great mix of Business Analysis / project Management and Implementation , very much a client facing role .

You are expected to develop and display excellent communication skills, both written and verbal as well as exemplary client facing skills, to support the client throughout the implementation process.

This work includes liaising with the client at all stages of the projects allocated to you, to develop a good working relationship with the client and to be responsible for effective and timely communication with both the client and your colleagues.

You will assume responsibility for the delivery of any project tasks allocated to you. You are expected to display the highest level of professional standards at all times when dealing with clients.

Where you are allocated the role of Project Manager, you will assume responsibility for the delivery of projects allocated to you; you will be expected to lead multi-disciplined teams to deliver the project to the agreed requirements, timescales and budget within clearly defined governance structures.

You will be knowledgeable of project management and software development life-cycle methodologies. Key Responsibilities

1. As an Implementation Consultant you will assist in all stages of the implementation of the clients software, or project life cycle and governance (when in the role of Project Manager), including, but not limited to: 

Implementation 

Requirements Analysis 

Application Design 

Implementation Design 

Implementation and configuration of the software 

Software testing 

2. Implementation tasks and projects may be directly for a client or as part of an internal company project.

3. The above activities are all part of a project implementation and you may carry out or assist with one or more of these activities for any number of clients/projects. You will be expected to manage a multi-disciplined team to ensure that the project life-cycle is executed to deliver the project requirements (when in the role of Project Manager). Please note this is not a technical role - installations and technical troubleshooting are carried out by our Technical Services Team, although any technical experience you have will be beneficial for this role.

4. Working at my client means that you are routinely exposed to a wide array of technologies. My client is an IT solutions supplier; customers may therefore reasonably expect members of the team to have a certain level of working knowledge of IT systems. Furthermore, having this knowledge helps you to distinguish between technology, people and process issues. You are expected to build on your existing knowledge, particularly where it is required directly on a given project.

5. Where you are to carry out training for clients, this will normally take place on the client’s premises.

6. Software testing is part of the software implementation. If you are allocated this role within a project, you will be expected to test any software which has been developed for the project, or manage and oversee all testing activities (when in the role of Project Manager), ensuring that it is fit for purpose and meets the client’s requirements.

7. You may also be required to input to the Pre-Sales support process, either by developing and/or presenting software demonstrations, at any stage of the sales process, or by preparing responses to specific tender/or other, questions allocated to you. Questions/Demonstrations allocated to you will relate only to areas of the software upon which you have specific experience, or where you are considered the most

job_description:
The Trainee Software Developer role is subject to successful completion of
the training course - details of costs & fees will be discussed at
registration

Become a Software Developer

Do you have a passion for all things tech?

Do you enjoy learning programme codes, creating software or are you interested in being involved in the development of the latest games?

Have you considered an exciting career in coding?

If so, software development is renowned as one of the fastest growing industries worldwide and is a great money earner; if you’re interested why not start your journey today?

The Training Room are keen to find individuals who are eager to learn and are motivated to start a career in software development. If you think you fit these criteria, then we have positions available for Junior Software Developers. We are working with IT companies all across the UK who have roles ready.

So how do you get started?We’ve partnered with leading IT companies in the UK to create their brand new Software Developer qualification, designed to give you the skills, knowledge and certification to kick start a career in software.

Our qualification has been developed based on feedback from the people that matter the most; leading employers. It doesn’t matter if you are a complete novice without any experience but like the idea of starting a career in this dynamic trade, or someone who has picked up the basic’s and now wants to turn it into an internationally recognised qualification.

We will teach you all the fundamentals in:

  • Java
  • HTML5
  • CSS3
  • Microsoft SQL
  • JavaScript

Successful candidates will gain the following certifications:

  • Microsoft Software Development Fundamentals (MTA)
  • CIW: Advanced HTML5 and CSS3 Specialist
  • Oracle OCA Java SE 8 Programmer
  • Microsoft MCP Querying Microsoft SQL Server 2012

If this sounds like the right career path for you, click to apply today and we’ll get in touch to help get you started!

The Training Room is authorised and regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority under reference number: 723720.

title: Software Tester
job_description:
Software Developer £35,000

My Client are a digital agency and are looking for an experienced Software tester to join the team.

The Role -
-To build Web Sites and Single Customer View databases and get insights from their clients data to drive their marketing strategies.

-Provide Testing & QA across a variety of digital web and non-web based projects as part of the Testing Team.

Experience needed-

- Excellent test automation experience, in particular of web applications coupled with either C# or javascript programming skills.

- Exposure to social networking testing
- Experience of data warehousing and an ETL tool e.g. Informatica or SSIS

*Needs to be a self-starter able to document the tests required and undertake them.
*Strong hands on experience of writing and executing manual test plans and test cases
*Ability to log and take ownership of the resolution of software defects
*Ability to assess risk and derive core functions for testing and manage testing within timescales allowed
*Experience working on projects using Agile methodology
*Used to working in a fast paced and pressured environment
*Excellent written and verbal communication skills
*Demonstrable experience of testing Web Sites, Email and Mobile user interfaces and APIs including the capture of data
*Experience with testing Web services e.g. using POSTman or SoapUI
*Extensive practical experience within multiple development and maintenance projects
*Good experience loading data files and working with complex databases including solid experience of utilising SQL, minimally on an advanced query basis

If you are interested and would like to know more then please send your CV to or alternatively, call Joe Ezzard on

Anything discussed will be kept confidential

title: IT System Administrator
job_description:
Junior IT Systems Administrator | Up to £30k | Hyde Park Corner |

Your new company
Your new company is a management services company who support their clients with business, investment, property and personal matters. As a Junior Systems Administrator, you will be supporting their 75 user base alongside the Network Manager.

Your new role
You new role will be to maintain, administer and help improve user delivery. You will have an exciting opportunity to expand your knowledge into the Networking field of IT! You will help create the network maps, get involved in rolling out projects, monitor networks, support LANs, WANs and Internet Systems. You will get to have experience with a wide range of technologies to really expand your knowledge and skill-set and have a smooth transition into Networks!

What you'll need to succeed
You will need to have experience of working in an 1st/2nd and preferably 3rd line IT environment. You will need to be enthusiastic, energetic, show a real willingness to learn! Passion is key!

What you'll get in return
You will have the excellent opportunity of having funded training networking courses, an annual bonus (dependent on personal/company performance and will have a contributory pension scheme. You will also get to work alongside the Network Manager.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

title: International Business Intelligence Manager SQL, Tableau
job_description:
INTERNATIONAL BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE MANAGER- (SQL, TABLEAU)
HUGELY SUCCESSFUL START-UP TURNED SME- E-COMMERCE
LONDON
£65,000

A hugely successful start-up in the e-commerce sector are looking to bring on board a Business Intelligence Manager (SQL, Tableau) to lead a specific faction of the Business Development team who are developing a new and exciting area of the business

COMPANY

This company has been a huge success story amongst the constantly evolving London start-up scene. They have enjoyed unprecedented growth since their inception over 10 years ago they have enjoyed rapid growth of 50% year on year, resulting in an IPO a few years ago which has cemented them as one of the most successful, rapidly growing and innovative technology firms in Europe and an altogether exciting place to work

THE ROLE

If you were to be successful in your application for the Business Intelligence Manager (SQL, Tableau) role your responsibilities would include:

  • Support the business with its data, research and analytics needs
  • Provide prescriptive insights to the delivery team in order to improve decision making
  • Work alongside delivery teams and other BI teams across the business and develop intelligent reporting frameworks that define the appropriate metrics and identify risks and opportunities for the business area
  • Develop tools in Tableau that enable teams to access data for themselves, helping to encourage a 'data culture' throughout the organisation
  • Use your unique view of the businesses data sets to identify opportunities that help improve the way the business works and optimising current operational delivery models

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

If this sounds like an opportunity you would like to apply to, please review the necessary competencies below:

  • Experience querying large SQL databases as well as expert knowledge of Excel or similar spreadsheet based anlaysis
  • Familiarity with statistical testing and modelling techniques and comfortable drawing conclusions when working with new data sets
  • Understand how to develop measurement frameworks and derive core metrics that drive a business and the ability to use data to tell a story easily understood by technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • Experience with Data Visualisation tools, ideally Tableau, as well as an understanding how to automate repetitive problems and tasks
  • An ability to build partnerships across the business and work effectively with other departments with the confidence to both gather requirements and present to senior stakeholders in the business

HOW TO APPLY

If you are interested in this Business Intelligence Manager (SQL, Tableau) role please apply via this site.

KEYWORDS

SQL, Analytics, Business Intelligence, BI Manager, Tableau, Dashboards, Google Analytics, R, AWS, BI,

job_description:
The Trainee Software Developer role is subject to successful completion of
the training course - details of costs & fees will be discussed at
registration

Become a Software Developer

Do you have a passion for all things tech?

Do you enjoy learning programme codes, creating software or are you interested in being involved in the development of the latest games?

Have you considered an exciting career in coding?

If so, software development is renowned as one of the fastest growing industries worldwide and is a great money earner; if you’re interested why not start your journey today?

The Training Room are keen to find individuals who are eager to learn and are motivated to start a career in software development. If you think you fit these criteria, then we have positions available for Junior Software Developers. We are working with IT companies all across the UK who have roles ready.

So how do you get started?We’ve partnered with leading IT companies in the UK to create their brand new Software Developer qualification, designed to give you the skills, knowledge and certification to kick start a career in software.

Our qualification has been developed based on feedback from the people that matter the most; leading employers. It doesn’t matter if you are a complete novice without any experience but like the idea of starting a career in this dynamic trade, or someone who has picked up the basic’s and now wants to turn it into an internationally recognised qualification.

We will teach you all the fundamentals in:

  • Java
  • HTML5
  • CSS3
  • Microsoft SQL
  • JavaScript

Successful candidates will gain the following certifications:

  • Microsoft Software Development Fundamentals (MTA)
  • CIW: Advanced HTML5 and CSS3 Specialist
  • Oracle OCA Java SE 8 Programmer
  • Microsoft MCP Querying Microsoft SQL Server 2012

If this sounds like the right career path for you, click to apply today and we’ll get in touch to help get you started!

The Training Room is authorised and regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority under reference number: 723720.

title: ERP Finance Consultant - £45-50k
job_description:
My leading client in the area is looking for a Finance ERP professional to come and join their growing team. They have doubled in size in the past 12 months and therefore need the right people to come in continue the success. There are a number of projects lined up so it really is the perfect opportunity to join a company and make a difference from the get go.
The candidate:
*Carried out a full life cycle ERP implementation
*Strong finance background
*SQL report writing skills desirable
The role:
*Carry out a number of implementation projects that are in the pipeline
*Communicate effectively with key stakeholders
*Ensure projects are completed in a timely manner

To discuss exciting ERP opportunities in more detail please send your CV to or call Beth Hamilton on in complete confidence.
Washington Frank International is the leading ERP recruitment firm in the UK, advertising more ERP jobs than any other agency. We work with both ERP Partners & End Users throughout the UK and Europe and we have never had more live requirements for ERP professionals. Solely by specializing in placing candidates in the ERP market I have built relationships with most of the key employers in the UK and have an unrivalled understanding of where the best opportunities and ERP jobs are.

I understand the need for discretion and would welcome the opportunity to speak to any ERP candidates that are considering a new career or job. For information on the ERP market and some of the opportunities that are available I can be contacted on or by email @

title: Data Engineer Python, Linux/Unix, SQL, Time series databases
job_description:
DATA ENGINEER (PYTHON, LINUX/UNIX, SQL, TIME SERIES DATABASES)
COMMUNICATIONS
LONDON
£65,000 + BONUS + PACKAGE

A FTSE listed communications company are looking for a new Data Engineer to work on a cutting edge project in an emerging area of the business which is set to grow rapidly over the coming years

COMPANY

This company is a leading communications firm with over 3 decades of experience. They are headquartered in London and have a headcount in the thousands.

THE ROLE

If you were to be successful in your application for the Data Engineer (Python, Linux/Unix, SQL, Time series databases) role your responsibilities would include:

  • Lead the design and implementation of data systems and pulling data from disparate sources using Python scripting
  • Lead the creative and strategically minded analysis of large data sets, extracting actionable insight to inform aero systems design
  • Drive the collection of new data and advise on relevant technologies/methods of big data analysis
  • Work closely with the operations team to provide required data to diagnose issues and improve quality of products and services
  • Communicate data-driven insights and trends to key stakeholders

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

If this sounds like an opportunity you would like to apply to, please review the necessary competencies below:

  • Strong Python Programming ability
  • Advanced data and analysis skills as well as scripting experience in Linux/Unix
  • Strong Academic background- ideally some knowledge of statistics
  • Excellent knowledge of relational databases (SQL, PostgreSQL)
  • An appreciation of Statistical techniques would be advantageous

HOW TO APPLY

If you are interested in this Data Engineer (Python, Linux/Unix, SQL, Time series databases) role please apply via this site.

KEYWORDS

SQL, Analytics, Python, SQL, PostgreSQL, Data Engineering, Big Data, Linux, Unix

title: DV Cleared Software Engineer - Hampshire or UK Wide - Permanent - up to £60,000
job_description:
DV Cleared Software Engineer - Hampshire or UK Wide - Permanent - up to £60,000

Cornucopia is currently working with a market leading software client who currently require a software engineer to join their team in Hampshire or UK Wide.

The company have an excellent reputation and are a market leader in a number of industries that they operate in. In addition they pride themselves on their working environment where they give their employees the tools to drive their own career forward and allow for the opportunity to work on a number of high profile projects.

My client is looking for a software engineer with some of the following:

  • C++
  • Java
  • Python
  • Embedded C
  • Networking Experience a great Plus!!!

This is a DV cleared Project so someone who has current DV Clearance or someone who has the ability to be DV Clearable please apply Now!!!!!!

This role will be liaising with clients and will be a full lifecycle role - Gathering requirements, then carrying out research and development to build what the client desires!!!

The company offer a vast amount of benefits including bonus, pension, flexi time, home working etc etc.

If you are passionate about code and engineering, this is the one for you!

Title - Software Engineer

Salary - £40,000 to £60,000

Location - Hampshire or UK Wide

Benefits - (Bonus, Pension, Flex time, Home working, Private Health Insurance, Generous holiday allowance).

What are you waiting for, click the apply button now to have the chance to work with a market leader!!!

This is a great role for the right technical candidate who is willing to grow their technical skills and like a challenge!!!

DV, engineer, C++, java, Pyhton, Network, Embedded, C, Developed Vetted, Hampshire, UK Wide, software, full lifecycle, requirements, R&D, research, development

title: Senior Application Support Analyst, Retail Trends and Fashion, (Business Intelligence)
job_description:
Senior Application Support Analyst, Retail Trends and Fashion, (Business Intelligence), £40-45k, Watford

Are you looking for a fast pace and even faster career progression? A global retail giant whose speciality is brand names and designer products are seeking a Support Engineer to join their busy, proactive business intelligence support team in Watford. They are a team of people passionate about getting the best out of large amounts of retail data. The successful candidate will have a background in support, administration or engineering with Business intelligence tools such as Cognos (Version 10), Tableau, Gartner…

As part of a 2nd line support team you will be responsible for diagnosing incidents reported to the service desk, resolving any functional or data related issue and escalating more technical issues or development requirements to the 3rd line support team. You will work with the business and 3rd Line Support teams to analyse the issues, establish root cause and resolve incidents within the businesses agreed service level agreements.

Desired Skills & Experience

• Highly focused on achieving or exceeding expected service levels to customers • Experience of working within or with a Helpdesk or Service Desk

• Business Intelligence tools - Cognos etc.

• Excellent organisational and communications skills

• A strong technical understanding of windows based retail systems

• Minimum three years in IT with at least two years in a similar role

• Experience of working within a retail environment

• Experience of supporting a mixed technology environment Passionate about retail and the latest trends in fashion, you will need to share this interest in the industry and be someone who adds a different dimension to their culture. To be successful in this role, you will have experience supporting BI applications. Experience working with Cognos (version 10) is desirable. Strong analytical / problem solving skills and an aptitude for troubleshooting is essential. You will have exceptional communication skills used to engaging with different areas of the business and will have the ability to develop people and talent!

If this position is of interest, or indeed you know someone suitable who might be interested, please send me an up to date CV as a Word document.

title: Software Tester - York - SQL
job_description:
Software Tester - York - SQL

We are working for a rapidly expanding company based in York who are looking for some talented Testers to compliment their already excellent Test Team.

We are looking for Testers with previous experience, who are looking for new challenges and experiences. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working with SQL, have great communication skills and be able to work well alone and as part of a team.

The role itself is for a Manual Tester, the company are looking to move over to Automation in the near future, so this provides an excellent opportunity to develop your skill set. The role also needs someone who is comfortable communicating with clients and able to deal with and understand their wants and needs. The role also gives opportunities to work on some huge projects, with the companies impressive client list.

The company is a market leading player in its sector, they are always looking to grow and expand and have been evolving ever since they started. They are looking for candidates who share their passion for growth and development. In return they can offer a very competitive salary, excellent benefits, a fabulous work environment and plenty of future opportunities.

If this sounds like the opportunity for you, apply with your CV or call James on .

Software Tester - York - SQL

For more information about Senitor and the opportunities we have to offer follow us on Twitter @SenitorIT

title: Project Manager Azure IoT
job_description:
Project Manager - Azure IoT

Our global client is recruiting for a Contract Project Manager with Microsoft Azure IoT experience on an initial 3-6 month contract, with scope to extend further.

They are undertaking a strategically-important project ("Azure IIoT") involving the consolidation and modernisation of its telematics solutions to make use of modern IoT technologies, specifically the Microsoft Azure IoT platform. We require an experienced project manager to lead the project, which is planned to be delivered in phases.

The first phase will be a pilot completing in April 2017, followed by a second phase estimated at 6 months, with subsequent phases and development also expected. The project involves both IT and OT (Operational Technology, such as telematics devices). It requires an understanding of projects involving data-warehousing and analytics, and preferably experience of the Microsoft Azure platform.

Requirements:

  • A track record of success in delivery of projects and programmes to time, scope and cost.
  • Able to demonstrate major personal contribution to the delivery of projects, featuring:

o Operational Technology, such as telematics devices.

o Data-warehousing and analytics.

o Microsoft Azure platform.

o Material customer change, including programmes of awareness and engagement.

  • Experience in programme and portfolio management, including the establishment/operation of PMO functions.
  • High standard of communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate at all levels of the business including senior management.
  • Experience of working in a matrix managed environment.
  • Experience of working in an international business is desirable.
  • Degree-qualified digital product management professional with a proven track record of achievement at a management level.
  • Excellent analytical skills, being comfortable working with data and the use of data for decision-making.
  • Excellent influencing, negotiation and facilitation skills.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills with stakeholders at a variety of levels through to group executive team, including 3rd parties and IT technical teams.

This is an urgent requirement with an ASAP start. For immediate consideration please forward your CV and daily rate expectations.

title: Solution Architect
job_description:
Solution Architect, ERP, £550-£600 a day, Biztalk, ERP, System Implementation

Your new company
I am recruiting for a very well known independently run government organisation based in Southwark.

Your new role
The role for an experienced Solutions Architect to join this organisation on a contract basis. You will work with the IT Director and Change Director to deliver cohesive solution architecture to integrate the planned projects in 2017/18 and build on enterprise level architecture to design solution architecture for the proposed change portfolio in 2017/18, both at a high level and detailed level on a project by project basis.

What you'll need to succeed
To be considered for this vacancy you will need to be qualified to TOGAF level or equivalent and qualifications in Microsoft Biztalk and MCSD are essential. Experience in designing solutions using Biztalk and Microsoft technologies is strongly desired, as is experience in solution architecture roles within financial services or public sector. Working on a large and complex system implementation with one of the big four or major software house would be highly sought after along with architecting integration of HR, Finance and ERP solutions.

What you'll get in return
In return for all of the above you will be given the opportunity to work for a highly recognisable government organisation.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

Hays Specialist Recruitment Limited acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and employment business for the supply of temporary workers. By applying for this job you accept the T&C's, Privacy Policy and Disclaimers which can be found at hays.co.uk

title: Front End Developer Angular / React
job_description:
Front End Developer, Southampton, £30-£40k, Angularjs, ReactJS, Global business with prestigious client base

Front End Developer (Angular / React)
Southampton / Hampshire
£30000 - £40000 + Package

Please note my client cannot offer VISA sponsorship.

Your new company
This award-winning global organisation, born out of the digital age, are seeking an additional Front End Web Developer with extensive JavaScript knowledge to join their team due to continued growth and extra project work. You will be joining their head office location in Southampton, 5 minutes from the train station, and on main commuting lines to London.

Your new role
You will be joining one of the most established digital businesses on the South Coast and will work in a dynamic, social environment. The team has undergone some structural changes so you'll instantly become a key member of the front end offering. We want developers who are innovative, challenge the status quo and bring new ideas to the table. The corners are not for hiding - you will work hard but reap the rewards, both personally and as a team.

You will be working with a list of A Grade clients that lead their respective markets. As a result the technology stack you will be working with is cutting edge and the work will encompass large scale app builds, social apps and internal builds. Developers are trusted, given ownership of projects and a command of new tools introduced to complete work.

What you'll need to succeed
The development projects you will be working on are bespoke. To be successful in the role you must have experience building large scale applications, with heavy business logic, rather than single pages or pure presentation work in HTML/CSS. As a purist in JavaScript you should have knowledge of modern JavaScript frameworks, notably AngularJS or ReactJS.

On the server side experience with Node.js is highly advantageous and an interest ES2015 JavaScript and the MEAN development stack will serve you well. It is essential that you can take Photoshop designs through the whole front end process to a high degree of quality, an experience with linking this to the back end of projects in PHP is an advantage.

Strong communication and interpersonal skills are essential for this position.

What you'll get in return
You will receive a salary above market levels and be entitled to one of the strongest benefits packages in the area including a bonus, private healthcare, pension, 30 days holiday and flexible working. On top of this you will have access to industry leading training/learning and development courses and will have a direct progression path to a lead level within the agency.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up to date copy of your CV, or call Max Wilcock at Hays using .

If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a technical IT role on the South Coast, please get in touch.

Hays Specialist Recruitment Limited acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and employment business for the supply of temporary workers. By applying for this job you accept the T&C's, Privacy Policy and Disclaimers which can be found at hays.co.uk
