title: Graduate / Junior .NET Developer - Billion-Dollar Internet Co
job_description:
Graduate / Junior .NET Developer (ASP.NET, C#, C#.NET, dot NET, Web Application Development, Desktop, Winforms, Windows Forms, .NET 4.5, ASP.NET MVC 5, WCF, WPF, MVVM, Prism, Continuous Integration, Dependency Injection, Ninject, Spring.net, IoC, Unity, Castle Windsor, TDD, NUnit, MSTest, Mocking, Moq, RhinoMocks, Agile, Scrum, Kanban, Urgent)

We're pleased to announce the arrival in the UK of one of Silicon Valley's most successful and exciting brands. They're at the heart of the Internet, helping the most innovative companies remove the complexities of delivering any experience, to any device, anywhere.

Having setup an R&D centre in Hoddesdon, Hertfordshire they are looking to hire several Graduate / Junior .NET Developer to work on complex Greenfield .NET software development projects that have attracted much attention in the trade press. These positions would be suitable for Graduate .NET Developer candidates who have recently graduated in Computer Science or a related subject and have a basic understanding of the .NET framework. Alternatively these positions would be suitable for Junior .NET Developer candidates with experience in either web application development (ASP.NET using C#) or winforms / WPF development (C#.NET). Our client can provide you with Greenfield project work and exposure to: .NET 4.5, ASP.NET MVC 5, WCF, WPF, MVVM, Prism, continuous integration, dependency injection (Ninject / Spring.net etc), IoC (Unity / Castle Windsor etc), TDD (NUnit / MSTest etc), Mocking (Moq / RhinoMocks etc) and Agile (Scrum / Kanban).

If you're dedicated to the youthful optimism of problem solving through intellectual curiosity, collaboration and commitment this could be the role for you. Our client is growing quickly. If you'd like to work in a culture where hard work and innovative ideas are consistently rewarded, join them and help shape the future of the hyper connected world.

To apply for this position please send your CV to Richard Gibson at Noir Consulting.

Noir Consulting continues to be the UK's premier .NET recruitment agency; we can help you make the right career decisions!

(Graduate / Junior .NET Developer, ASP.NET, C#, C#.NET, dot NET, Web Application Development, Desktop, Winforms, Windows Forms, .NET 4.5, ASP.NET MVC 5, WCF, WPF, MVVM, Prism, Continuous Integration, Dependency Injection, Ninject, Spring.net, IoC, Unity, Castle Windsor, TDD, NUnit, MSTest, Mocking, Moq, RhinoMocks, Agile, Scrum, Kanban, Analyst Programmer, Engineer, Architect, Consultant, Graduate / Junior .NET Developer)

title: Developer - Gaming
job_description:
Developer - Games /Gaming

Fantastic opportunity to work with a leading developer & publisher of mobile games, based in South Manchester / Cheshire in their new Gaming Studio.

This opportunity is working as part of a highly reputable team developing quality online mobile games. You will be a Server Side Developer with strong knowledge of the leading server side development tools, software and methodologies.

Core Skills & Experience

- C#, ASP.net, MVC (Visual Studio 2015 and ReSharper)

- Experience of working with large volume relational databases such as MS SQL, MYSQL, etc.

- Entity Framework

- Javascript, jQuery, HTML, CSS

- 2-5 years of relevant commercial experience

- Experience of technical design

It would be fantastic if you were an avid gamer, however this is not a pre-requisite. Cloud development experience (noSQL, caching and scaling technologies) and exposure to high traffic distributed architecture would be looked upon favourably however do get in touch should you meet the above criteria.

Brand new Gaming studio - the environment really is one to be seen and includes benefits such as flexible working, annual bonus (performance related), subsidised gym membership and complimentary fruit, drinks and snacks.

APPLY NOW for a fast response

title: Trainee Software Developer
job_description:
The Trainee Software Developer role is subject to successful completion of
the training course - details of costs & fees will be discussed at
registration

Become a Software Developer

Do you have a passion for all things tech?

Do you enjoy learning programme codes, creating software or are you interested in being involved in the development of the latest games?

Have you considered an exciting career in coding?

If so, software development is renowned as one of the fastest growing industries worldwide and is a great money earner; if you’re interested why not start your journey today?

The Training Room are keen to find individuals who are eager to learn and are motivated to start a career in software development. If you think you fit these criteria, then we have positions available for Junior Software Developers. We are working with IT companies all across the UK who have roles ready.

So how do you get started?We’ve partnered with leading IT companies in the UK to create their brand new Software Developer qualification, designed to give you the skills, knowledge and certification to kick start a career in software.

Our qualification has been developed based on feedback from the people that matter the most; leading employers. It doesn’t matter if you are a complete novice without any experience but like the idea of starting a career in this dynamic trade, or someone who has picked up the basic’s and now wants to turn it into an internationally recognised qualification.

We will teach you all the fundamentals in:

  • Java
  • HTML5
  • CSS3
  • Microsoft SQL
  • JavaScript

Successful candidates will gain the following certifications:

  • Microsoft Software Development Fundamentals (MTA)
  • CIW: Advanced HTML5 and CSS3 Specialist
  • Oracle OCA Java SE 8 Programmer
  • Microsoft MCP Querying Microsoft SQL Server 2012

If this sounds like the right career path for you, click to apply today and we’ll get in touch to help get you started!

The Training Room is authorised and regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority under reference number: 723720.

title: BI / Data Warehouse Developer, SQL Server - Petersfield
job_description:
BI / Data Warehouse Developer (SQL Server 2016, SSAS, SSRS, SSIS, Business Intelligence, Database, Urgent)

Since 2006 our client's revolutionary marketing software platform has been helping businesses all over the world to attract, engage, and delight customers by delivering inbound experiences that are relevant, helpful, and personalized. Having recently launched in the UK, they looking to hire SQL Server BI Developer to become a part of their ever growing family.

They believe that individual developers are in the best position to make decisions about what should be created, and how it should be built. Within their setup those decisions are made by small teams of three or four developers who own each piece of their product. They believe that problems are solved with technology and experience, not process, and that mistakes are a normal part of learning.

SQL Server BI / Data Warehouse Developer applicants should have experience of developing either BI or Data Warehouse solutions. Your skill set should include: SQL Server 2014, T-SQL, stored procedures, SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS), SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) and business intelligence / data warehouse technologies.

At the centre of our client's culture is freedom and openness which takes a lot of people by surprise. But the good kind of surprise, like a birthday party!

Their benefits include the following:

  • Private medial healthcare (family plan included).
  • Bonus (12%).
  • Student loan reimbursement. They will pay £5'000 per year towards the outstanding balance of your student loan, assuming you have one.
  • Unlimited holiday allowance.
  • Company pension.
  • Free books and beers, and a 24/7 snack wall!

Our client is building a company people love. A company that will stand the test of time. So they invest in their people, and optimize for your long term happiness. If you would like to explore the possibility of joining their family can you please send your CV to Richard Gibson at Noir Consulting.

(BI / Data Warehouse Developer, SQL Server 2016, SSAS, SSRS, SSIS, Business Intelligence, Database, Analyst Programmer, Engineer, Architect, Consultant, BI / Data Warehouse Developer)

title: Software Developer
job_description:
Software Developer - ASP.NET / MVC / C# / SQL

NEW ROLE WITH AN AWARD WINNING DIGITAL AGENCY BASED IN CREWE …

  • Based in Crewe, and easily commutable by car or public transport
  • Graduate to Senior level
  • ASP.NET / MVC / C# / SQL
  • Attractive salary and benefits
  • Great working environment, driven by technology
  • To find out more information call / or email

Based in Crewe, we are an award winning digital agency who are looking to grow the development team with a number of talented developers.

Sourced by: @ITJobs_NW - your 24/7 twitter feed of latest IT vacancies across the North-West

WHO ARE WE?

We are a highly creative agency based in Crewe, who enjoy working with an extensive list of successful clients from a number of industries. Working with the latest .NET technologies, we design and develop world class websites that help businesses grow. We have a great working environment, with a dedicated team of developers who are all driven by the challenging and rewarding projects that we work on.

WHAT WILL YOU BE DOING?

Immersing yourself into existing and new projects, you be at the forefront of the design and development of highly responsive websites. Using your existing knowledge of .NET technologies, you will apply modern practices to produce industry leading sites that will help businesses grow. A passion for creativeness is a must, alongside the desire to push the boundaries with technology and be at the cutting edge of future development methodologies.

WE NEED YOU TO HAVE...

  • Experience of ASP.NET, MVC, C#, SQL
  • Previous experience of developing high quality responsive websites
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment on multiple projects
  • Desire to succeed in a thriving agency environment

IT'S NICE TO HAVE…

  • Previous agency experience
  • A good sense of humour!

TO BE CONSIDERED...

Please either apply by clicking online or emailing me directly to . For further information please call me on / . I can make myself available outside of normal working hours to suit from 7am until 10pm. If unavailable please leave a message and either myself or one of my colleagues will respond. By applying for this role you give express consent for us to process & submit (subject to required skills) your application to our client in conjunction with this vacancy only. Also feel free to follow me on Twitter @DigiDoyle or connect with me on LinkedIn, just search Patrick Doyle in Google! I look forward to hearing from you.

Key Skills:

ASP.NET / MVC / C# / SQL

title: AGILE PROJECT MANAGER /SCRUM MASTER - CENTRAL LONDON - UP TO £55,000
job_description:
AGILE PROJECT MANAGER /SCRUM MASTER - CENTRAL LONDON - UP TO £55,000

About the Agile Project Manager / Scrum Master role…

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a traditional English automotive company who are undergoing a huge and extremely exciting business transformation.

The Agile Project Manager will be responsible for leading and providing clear guidance and leadership to Scrum Masters, representing Scrum to senior team level as well as reporting the status of the scrum teams. Joining an exciting time, with transformative projects underway across the business there is huge opportunity to drive changes and improvements as part of a successful team.

Expectations:

  • To instill a culture of quality and continual improvement within the Scrum teams, maintaining the product backlog, removing impediments and overall maximizing productivity
  • Responsible for the most business critical daily scrum, which develops the website area that contributes the most to online revenues
  • Responsible for key projects that support revenue targets and strategic business objectives
  • Be responsible for the "Scrum of Scrums" and mentoring all other Scrum Masters in the organisation
  • Assessing the maturity of the Scrum team, coaching the team to higher levels

Must haves:

  • Must have experience of Project Management and working as a Scrum Master (Agile Scrum)
  • Track Record of delivering digital projects in an Agile environment on time and to budget
  • Scrum Certification
  • Experience of managing daily Scrums and ideally Scrum of Scrum ceremonies
  • Track record of ensuring best practice

If you are a Scrum Master with experience of delivering web based projects and are passionate about making change and adhering to best practices then please get in touch.

If you are interested in finding out more about this position, it would be great to hear from you and so please hit the 'Apply’ button below or email your CV to me, Bryonny.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
job_description:
A client of mine are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join their team. They work within the healthcare sector and have gone from strength to strength since they were founded.

Essential Requirements:

  • MSc or PhD in Computer Science/Statistics/Mathematics or similar quantitative field
  • Demonstrated Machine Learning experience (1+ years commercial experience
  • Strong Python coding
  • Knowledge of major Data Science tools and frameworks

Beneficial Requirements:

  • Experience with Deep Learning techniques
  • Experience with TensorFlow Serving or similiar high performance deployment tools
  • NoSQL Database experience
  • Healthcare Domain experience

They will be looking to start conducting interviews from 15th February with the successful candidate starting ASAP.

If this role sounds like one that fits your skillset then please apply here or contact Luke on to hear more about the role.

title: Software Team Lead .Net, JS, Agnostic
job_description:
Software Team Lead, .Net, C#, JS, Language agnostic, 80% hands on, 20% leadership, Software company, Poole.

Software Team Lead (.Net, JS, Agnostic)
Poole, Dorset
Highly Competitive with up to 20% Bonus + Package

NO Visa Sponsorship Offered.

Your new company
This market leading software business offer a powerful and ever-evolving management system to help organisations streamline their operations and improve outputs. You'll be working from their head office, based in between Poole and Bournemouth, in the heart of the South Coast. Due to sustained growth they are now in a position to add a Development / Software Engineering Team Lead to implement best practice and drive the team forward.

This is a hybrid role, split between leadership (20%) and hands-on work (80%) and sits underneath management and its inherent responsibilities.

Your new role
This is a multi-faceted position is crucial to the company delivering technical projects and as such the role covers the whole project lifecycle. You'll provide technical leadership by mentoring and coaching developers and will expand the current software and work on new developments.

You'll primarily be a developer, passionate about problem solving and implementing clean code following design patterns. The team run Agile and you'll lead stand ups, delegate tasks across the team and ensure the roadmap is constantly aligned to building a quality product focused on the customer and their experience. The role extends further and you'll run professional development sessions for the dev team.

The company sits in the medium size bracket where you retain autonomy and control of projects and can influence the direction of the department and the systems used internally, without corporate red tape.

What you'll need to succeed
We're seeking language agnostic, polyglot developers that have mastered a few technologies and are not precious about one approach or language.

Looking to the future a strong .Net background will serve you well, comfortable working across desktop and the web. You will require a knowledge of the full stack from GUI to database and will work predominantly with a powerful language associated with modernising applications for the 21st Century.

You'll have previous leadership experience and will be passionate about continuous improvement. The company champion a customer first approach so strong communication skills and requirements interpretation are essential.

What you'll get in return
This role comes with a generous starting salary and an excellent bonus scheme controlled by personal and company performance. There is flexible working, free parking, government pension and a the company have excellent retention levels and pride themselves on being a welcoming, enjoyable place to work.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in the role, please apply now or call Max Wilcock at Hays IT using .

If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new role in IT Development, please contact me for a confidential discussion.

title: IT Helpdesk / 1st Line Support
job_description:
IT Helpdesk / 1st Line Support

Location: Portsmouth

Salary: £16000 - £18000 dependant on experience

Hours of work: 09:00am - 17:00pm

Duration: Temporary with a view that it could continue to permanent

Dynamite Recruitment are proud to be working in partnership with a technical business based in Portsmouth. You will work on a customer service helpdesk and provide specialist support to clients in an efficient and accurate manner.

You will be the first point of contact for all clients and will manage all issues to the point of resolution or further escalation across the team.

Primary duties and responsibilities

  • Provide first and second level support for hardware and software application issues
  • Provide resolutions to customer issues
  • Diagnose system errors and other issues
  • Track, route and redirect problems to correct resources
  • Respond to queries via telephone, email and system portal
  • Identify, investigate and research user questions and issues
  • Follow up with customers, provide feedback and see issues through to resolution
  • Utilise excellent customer service skills and exceed customers' expectations
  • Ensure proper recording, documentation and closure of issues


In addition to the above duties, the higher levels within this job family may also perform the following:

  • Briefs customers and/or management on the status of resolution efforts
  • Serves as a technical advisor to users with complex systems issues by resolving or conferring with technical personnel
  • Recommends system or process improvements, including procedures, training, and enhanced documentation


Required Skills

  • Identifies problems in straightforward situations, and makes sound decisions using standard procedures
  • Works within established procedures with a moderate degree of supervision
  • The ability to work under pressure and to deadlines
  • Has developed knowledge and skills through formal training
  • Good Customer service and experience in a 1st line / 2nd line support environment
  • Good PC and Microsoft product knowledge (including Word & Excel)
  • Good time management / understanding priorities
  • Good communication (written and spoken)
  • Advanced troubleshooting and multi-tasking skills


Preferred Skills

  • Basic understanding of Networks
  • Some knowledge of SQL, Citrix, Active Directory, SFTP
Dynamite Recruitment Solutions Ltd is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

title: BI / Data Warehouse Developer - SQL Server - Leicester
job_description:
BI / Data Warehouse Developer (SQL Server 2016, SSAS, SSRS, SSIS, Business Intelligence, Database, Urgent)

Established in the 1990s our client is one the fast growing technologies brands across Europe. They have built an unrivalled reputation for developing revolutionary SQL Server BI / Data Warehouse solutions. Having recently embarked upon a number of cutting edge Greenfield SQL Server BI / Data Warehouse projects they are looking to recruit BI / Data Warehouse Developer to join their award winning SQL Server BI / Data Warehouse development team.

We are seeking several BI / Data Warehouse Developer candidates with experience of developing either BI or Data Warehouse solutions. Your skill set should include: SQL Server 2014, T-SQL, stored procedures, SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS), SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) and business intelligence / data warehouse technologies.

This is a unique opportunity to join a firm that genuinely values its employees; they have ranked highly in the Times Top 100 List of Employers over the last 5 years. These positions are urgent, as such our client guarantees to provide feedback on CV's within 24 hours of submission and complete the interview process within 1 week.

To apply for this position please send your CV to Richard Gibson at Noir Consulting.

(BI / Data Warehouse Developer, SQL Server 2016, SSAS, SSRS, SSIS, Business Intelligence, Database, Analyst Programmer, Engineer, Architect, Consultant, BI / Data Warehouse Developer)

title: Junior Java Developer
job_description:
Job Title: Junior Java Developer
Contract Type: Permanent
Location: Buckinghamshire
Salary: Circa £20,000-23,000
Date Posted: 06/02/2017

I am pleased to announce an exciting new opportunity for a junior Java developer to help deliver innovative software products to customers from our head office in Buckinghamshire. The client is an award-winning digital-technology company that offers innovative software products and technical consultancy to leading industry companies and research institutions around the world. As a member of the development team, you will have full exposure to the latest technology within their growing business. You will be taking a hands on approach whilst developing your skills further in tandem with the company's growth.

The Role:
*Create features that are intuitive, time-saving and allow users to provide critical services to our products.
*Proficiency in a programming language and will take that ability into coaching them in different coding languages required by the web services.
*Keep up to date with the latest changes in industry technology, and acquire industry standard certification and learn from seniors within your field.
*Ability to notice and implement the latest technologies to the working environment.
Required Skills:
*Demonstrate-able, well-established Java skills inc. writing code
*Strong mathematical, literacy skills and the ability to solve problems/use initiative
*Strong organisational skills with the ability to hit deadlines
*Experience working within a professional environment
*Demonstrable evidence of working on projects either commercially or academically
Qualifications and Experience:
*Relevant degree (Computer science, mathematics, engineering etc.) with a heavy focus on software development - 2:1 or above preferred. Candidates who possess a 2:2 with evidence of significant further study will be considered.
*The successful candidate must be able to demonstrate their experience in working with Java systems, and why they would be suitable for the role.

How to Apply:
This role is exclusive to Pearson Frank (as part of the Nigel Frank International recruitment group) and registering your interest now will help to ensure you don't miss out. The successful candidate will have to demonstrate their eligibility to work within the UK. To apply, e-mail a copy of your CV with a covering letter (highlighting your experience, and why you feel as though you would be suitable for the role) to or contact me directly on (ext. 1484.)
Pearson Frank International is a leading, niche recruiter that matches global clients with the best Java programmers and developers across the development cycle. We work with more exclusive clients than any other agency, giving you more access to the job you desire.
Java, Developer, Junior Developer, Graduate, Cambridgeshire, London, Southern England, JavaFX, UI, UX

title: C# MVC Developers
job_description:
C# MVC stack Developers required in Salisbury area. Variety of project work, Salary negotiable close to £40k.

C# MVC Developers
Salisbury, Wiltshire
£38000 - £43000

My Client cannot offer VISA sponsorship for this role.

The Role
My Client is a a specialist provider of software solutions looking to expand their technical team with talented Asp.Net MVC Developers. the positions will be based from their head offices near Salisbury and come as a result of securing new work. You must be strong coding OO C#.

You will be a highly motivated, innovative developer looking to progress within a well-established organisation and technical team. Reporting to the Development Manager in a mid sized team the role is dynamic and challenging, allowing the successful candidates the opportunity to work on several different projects with a variety of technologies within the Microsoft stack. .

Skills required:
You will have gained an excellent level of experience covering application development across the full software lifecycle, preferably within a corporate environment.

* 5+ Years + Commercial experience with ASP.NET, C# - web based functionality for HTML, CSS, JavaScript.
* Experience working with Asp.Net MVC
* Experience of working with SQL Server up to version 2012
* A good understanding of design patterns including SOLID advantageous.

What you'll get in return
This role comes with an excellent range of benefits in addition to a generous starting salary including a bonus and flexible working. The organisation is easily commutable from Salisbury, Devizes, Melksham, Andover, Bath, Amesbury, Swindon, Trowbridge, Chippenham, Marlborough, Hampshire, Wiltshire.

What you'll need to do next
The projects within the organisation are set to start in January so they'd like someone in post around this time.

To be considered for the position please apply direct.

title: Technical Project Manager - Hemel Hempstead
job_description:
Technical Project Manager – Hemel Hempstead

£45,000 - £55,000

Project Management/ Agile / Waterfall / Hands-on / Infrastructure

My client is looking for a Technical Project Manager to lead and deliver a set of new transformation projects. This role is infrastructure based and will be responsible for ensuring all infrastructure projects are delivered on time and on budget.  You will work with a wide range of stakeholders across the business and work with the architecture, infrastructure and implementations teams. It will be up to you to make sure all teams are working with one another and to one common goal.

This opportunity will be a platform to progress within the business and will report directly into the Programme Manager.

- Experience of working the full SDLC

Service Delivery Manager / Service Manager - (SFIA)

West London


£350 - £450 per day

4 MONTH CONTRACT


Skills
SFIA,Skills Frameworks for the Information Age, Service Manager, Service Delivery, Service Improvement, Project management, business improvement, stakeholder management, SFIA, ITIL, broadcast media technology, online services, internet services, mobile, multi-platform

We have a fantastic Service Delivery Manager / Service Manager (SFIA) role available for a leading Broadcast / Media organisation in West London and play a key role in driving service operation levels across technology services with involvement throughout the design and transition phases.

This is a rare opportunity to work in a team where they design and develop exciting new technology, therefore we require a Service Delivery expert at the top of their game, with proven experience in technology, service, media or creative environments.

This is the ideal opportunity for a highly experienced, driven and confident Service Manager / Service Delivery expert (SFIA) who has a proven background utilising Skills Frameworks for the Information Age, and working to keep key external partners and stakeholders happy whilst developing service improvement plans / Service Level Agreements. For this role it is essential to have experience of projects within an SFIA frame work Level 5 and above.

Working closely with business owners and portfolio leaders ensuring continuous service improvements are made and implemented, the successful Service Manager / Service Delivery Manager will ensure teams and suppliers meet their performance targets and service levels agreed within the contract (service management contracts, KPI measurement and management reporting).

It is also essential that the successful Service Manager has extremely strong stakeholder/supplier management experience, along with Project Management and Business Improvement experience.

This is an urgent hire and therefore we require candidates with no more than 2 weeks' notice periods. To be considered for this outstanding Service Management opportunity then apply with your CV at the earliest chance.

job_description:
QA Functional Tester - Slough - Permanent

Salary: £30,000 + Benefits

A very exciting opportunity is available for a QA Functional tester at a market leading client based in Slough.

The company is a well-known name within their core market. The company looks for very passionate testers who are interested in learning new skills, testing ground-breaking software applications and the opportunity to progress within a thriving company. Bournemouth, Dorset

Your New Company
This product focussed technology organisation require an additional .Net developer to their talented in-house team based local to Bournemouth. The company have experienced considerable growth over the past years and this trend is set to continue due to their ongoing success.

This position is open to a strong mid-level or senior developer keen to progress their career in an Agile environment.

Your New Role
This is predominantly a hands-on position working with C# to a high standard. You'll be working in small team within the technology department to deliver specific projects related to the core product offering. You should pride yourself on following Agile practices and working collaboratively but will be expected to challenge ideas where necessary as well to ensure a seamless product roadmap.

You'll get exposure to the best technologies, follow software best practice and work alongside some of the most talented developers in the area. Culture fit is hugely important and despite the company's rapid growth they've retained a family feel where each individual feels valued.

To be successful you will be active in development projects outside of work and will see coding as a passion rather than a professional. C# will be second nature to you and you should be a proponent of software design patterns used appropriately / SOLID principles and Dependency Injection.

You should be proficient across the entire SDLC, and have a passion to work using Continuous Integration, TDD/BDD, you will also have heavy data experience (MS SQL/NoSQL)

You'll get access to one of the best benefits packages in the area, which includes corporate aids such as private healthcare, pension, life insurance but also social incentives to encourage a positive work life balance and flexible working for the whole tech department.

title: Manager/Principal Security Consultant
job_description:

An information security consulting firm that works across the whole Security spectrum, are looking to take on a Security Manager or a Principal Security Consultant. title: Senior .Net Developer
job_description:
C# Web Developer role, £50k in Bournemouth, modern tech stack, structured Agile team, award winning company,

.Net Developer (Agile, C#, Asp.Net MVC)
Central Bournemouth, Dorset
£35000 - £50000 + Package.

Please note my client cannot offer VISA sponsorship for these positions.

Your new company
This well-established financial services organisation, backed by a global business, is looking to undergo a further phase of expansion to increase the in house .Net development team. You will be working from their head office location in central Bournemouth, 5 minutes from the beach on with direct transport links to Southampton and London.

Your new role
There is a variety of project work that you will be involved with including bespoke development on internal systems, BAU requirements and rebuilds for the wider Group who utilise my clients systems and replicate their business model.

There are opportunities for ambitious developers to join from mid-level up to seasoned senior developers looking to drive new technologies/practices. The team is dynamic and not 100% process focussed, developers are empowered to think creatively and the team are seen as the enablers that drives the organisations success. If you are looking for a culture where responsibility is encouraged and where developers are consulted on business decisions, this would suit.

Teams are self-managed and they have avoided the governance and big management issues found in larger financial services organisations. No red tape, no hoops to jump through, just quality development, delivered on time using cutting edge technologies.

What you'll need to succeed
Team fit is vitally important and despite rapid growth the company has retained its identity and autonomy. You should have a positive can do attitude, should encourage collaboration and continuous improvement and will be happy to go the extra mile for the benefit of the team.

Technically you must be able to evidence substantial web development work in a commercial setting using C# / Asp.Net MVC, JavaScript and SQL Server. You will support Agile development principles and will consider yourself, or have aspirations to become a full stack .Net developer.

Experience with any of the following will serve you will and will be utilised in your role: Modern JavaScript Frameworks (Angular/Knockout.js), HTML/CSS, Web API, TDD, SOA, WCF.

What you'll get in return
On top of a highly competitive salary you will be entitled to a comprehensive benefits package including private healthcare, pension scheme, life assurance, gym membership, flexible working and childcare vouchers. The company are big on internal progression and will fund courses where necessary to improve your skill set.

There is access to parking on site and the company is very easy to commute to using train or bus.

title: Product Owner
job_description:
Job for a Product Owner based in Central London paying £510 per day

Your new company
A large public sector transport organisation.

Your new role
You will be working as a Product Owner on the Wifi Projects (Digital marketing cloud), working with the customer to understand the Data requirements then getting the requirements ready for the data team to work on.

Last few years, we launched our contactless payments system - the first of its kind in the world. We built this technology in-house from the ground up using a Microsoft stack. That's unusual for a public sector organisation to say the least. Six months on and contactless is already processing over a million transactions a day. Over 14% of all pay as you go journeys on TfL services are now contactless. What's more, around 1 in 7 of all contactless transactions in the UK now take place on London's transport services. These stats should give you a sense of the impact you could have here.

What you'll need to succeed
Knowledge

  • Strong knowledge in revenue collection and apportionment system development and implementation techniques.
  • Broad experience of managing system risks and their associated mitigation plan
  • Able to understand the agile & V-model methodology and apply appropriately.
  • Commercial awareness, ensuring systems development is aligned with contractual agreements.
  • Good knowledge of customer facing and in house revenue collection infrastructure and technology trends, particularly those to public transport operations
  • Degree, or equivalent qualified in a relevant subject area is desirable.

Skills

  • Strong analytical capabilities;
  • Proven ability to define and document functional and non functional systems specifications for large, complex back office transaction processing or front end systems.
  • Proven ability to resolve Client-Contractor conflicts;
  • Proven ability to build effective working relations (partnering) with people at all levels across the organisation and outside.
  • Strong verbal communication skills including ability to talk through complex information with senior management and Directors.
  • Strong written communication skills including ability to produce summary and feasibility reports on complex technical and business issues.
  • Ability to influence people at all levels across the organisation and outside, including negotiating and successfully facilitating joint decision-making.
  • Proven ability to analyse complex systems, spot trends, draw conclusions, and produce solutions and decisions.

Experience

  • Proven track record in stakeholder engagement: enthusing people, maintaining trust and supporting groups to ensure continued participation over time.
  • Broad experience of analysing complex issues in high volume transaction systems.
  • Broad experience of managing the full IT delivery lifecycle.
  • Broad experience of writing techniques for documenting functional and non functional requirements.
  • Proven experience in collaborating with development teams, acting as an authoritative source of information for technical teams and informing the design and development of systems/processes.
  • Broad experience of building relationships with, and influencing, a range of people at all levels within and outside the organisation


What you'll get in return
To get to work with a successful team.

title: Strategic Consultant
job_description:
Strategic Consultant - NHS Support role
Commission NHS Support Role
Start date ASAP
End date 19th April 2017 - (extension dependant on budget)
Location London
Purpose of Service Commission
1. To work on a NHS strategy for our client on how best to engage with levy paying NHS employers.
2. Amalgamate understanding of provision likely to be needed within April 2017 and September 2018 and map the release of new relevant health standards to demand. This will then be mapped to provision currently available and where provision gaps evident, inform our client to consider how best to fill this provision gap.
3. To work closely with NAS London & SE employer engagement National Account Manager and Health Education England.
Activities for New Commission
The main responsibilities of the post are to:
1. To work on a NHS strategy for our client on how best to engage with levy paying NHS employers.
2. Use the refreshed HEE hot/cold spot map to inform our client of which 'cold' spots to proactively engage, particularly if within Top 260 large levy trusts.
3. Use the refreshed HEE hot/cold spot map to map out where best to place Project Managers within HEE if monies secured for posts from April 17.
4. To work on support Trusts to complete our client's readiness questionnaires and consolidated for NHS strategy and Account Managers.
5. Consult all Trusts and amalgamate understanding of provision likely to be needed within April 2017 and September 2018 and map the release of new relevant health standards to demand. This will then be mapped to provision currently available and where provision gaps evident, inform our client to consider how best to fill this provision gap.
6. To work closely with Monique Lavers on the NHS strategy alongside Zeena Cala and Kirk Lower (HE)
7. Act as a central contact point for our client's National Account Managers with regards to the NHS.
8. Ensure attendance at internal local and national monthly account meetings to update the team on the status and progress of the work.
Key Deliverables
1. Analyse, map out and produce NHS Strategy for our client on how best to work with levy paying NHS Trusts by March 2017
2. Consult all Trusts , via HEE Managers and amalgamate understanding of provision likely to be needed between April 2017 and September 2019 and map the release of new relevant health standards to demand by end of Feb 17.
3. Use provision demands to map to current provision available and where specific provision gaps evident, inform our client to consider how best to fill this provision gap and when it will be required in which geographical area.
4. Use the refreshed HEE hot/cold spot map to inform our client of which 'cold' spots to proactively engage, particularly if within Top 260 large levy trusts by February 2017.
4. Use the refreshed HEE hot/cold spot map to map out where best to place Project Managers within HEE if monies secured for posts from April 17.
5. To work closely with Monique Lavers on the NHS strategy alongside Zeena Cala and Kirk Lower (HE)
6. Prepare business case for additional HEE posts funded and managed by our client working within HEE.
Skills and Attributes
LEADERSHIP, MANAGEMENT, PERSONAL SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, OR QUALITIES
Open and approachable management style.
Able to inspire and leads others to achieve challenging results.
To work as an individual and to be a team player.
Confident, articulate and clear communication skills with all level of employees.
To develop good working relationships with colleagues and other internal departments. Motivational with a positive attitude at all times.
Strong organisational skills.
TECHNICAL SKILLS, OR KNOWLEDGE
Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Email. Numerically and grammatically accurate.
EXPERIENCE & TRACK RECORD
Thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment requiring a high degree of flexibility whilst retaining business disciplines.
Previous experience of NHS.

title: ICT Support Execuctive
job_description:
Citytalk Communications are an award-winning provider of Telecoms, IT and Security solutions to businesses across the UK. We’re an innovative and growing technology company that installs and maintains unified communications solutions to various vertical markets. This is a great time to start a career with Citytalk; we are looking to recruit an ICT Support Executive to join our team.

About the role

This role requires you to provide desk based support to clients in response to reactive request for technical support alongside the proactive support enabled from a wide range of monitoring solutions. You will need to be able to take on technical issues such as; WLR/SIP & Broadband carrier & local equipment issues, Avaya & E-LG Telephone system faults/Change requests, IT Related Software & Hardware issues; managing them through to resolution.

Day-to-day you will be carrying out support tasks for customers including:

  • Performing change requests to LG and Avaya phone systems, troubleshooting handset connection issues and system issues.
  • Ensuring that accompanying software is running correctly and make configuration changes to the software.
  • Troubleshooting line faults and liaising with BT Openreach and SIP providers to resolve any line faults.
  • Troubleshooting broadband connectivity and speed issues, liaising with the carrier and the customer. Performing setup of routers and configuration changes.
  • Maintaining Customer cloud service accounts.
  • Ensuring that customer anti-virus, remote access and monitoring clients are installed, monitored correctly and up-to-date.
  • Ensuring that customer backup clients are operating correctly.
  • Building new PCs and laptops for customers.
  • Recommending add-on products to compliment the customer’s business.

Person Specification

This role requires the candidate to be keen to learn and capable of working in a team. Providing an excellent level of customer service is essential which includes positively dealing with customer needs and regularly updating customers.

Technical or practical experience would be advantageous but not essential as full training will be given. You will also need to keep up to date with new technologies including relevant technical training and certifications as required by the business.

Benefits

We offer fantastic career development opportunities for motivated self-starters; and as well as earning a competitive salary OTE: £20,000 - £23,000 per annum (Lead Passing Commissions & Ticket Closing Bonus), you can expect an extensive benefits package including, up to 25 days holiday with additional days earnt for each year of service, healthcare insurance, pension, gym membership, childcare vouchers and a paid day off on your birthday.

Feeling inspired? Apply now!

title: Director of Ops and Delivery Local Office
job_description:
*Director of Ops and Delivery Local Office - up to £950/ day - 6 months - Southampton*

Security Clearance: Must already hold BPSS + Standard DS (issued by the Disclosure & Barring Service)

This role will provide clear and visible leadership at local office level in implementing the NHS 5 year Forward View. Working as part of the Wessex team, the postholder will play a lead role in developing, assuring and implementing Sustainability and Transformation Plans and ensuring Clinical Commissioning Groups (CCGs) meet the requirements of the CCG improvement and assurance framework. The role also carries the lead responsibility in the team for ensuring effective emergency preparedness, resilience and response arrangements are in place and assured across the geography.

Key tasks and deliverables:
*Being a key member of the NHS England (Wessex) local office leadership team and support the implementation of the NHS Five Year Forward View.
*As a key part of this, leading work to support the development and implementation of, and assure, the two Sustainability and Transformation Plans in the Wessex geography.
*Leading the Operations and Delivery team to support the development of, and assure, CCG annual operating plans, ensuring they meet NHS England requirements and support delivery of the Mandate. This will have a specific focus on ensuring delivery of agreed A&E and RTT trajectories.
*Working directly with, and assure, CCGs' work to implement operating plans and comply fully with the CCG improvement and assurance framework.
*Supporting the development of CCGs and the commissioning system as a whole in the Wessex geography
*Working with key local partners in arms' length bodies, including NHS Improvement, Health Education England (Wessex), the Care Quality Commission and Public Health England to ensure a clear and consistent regulatory approach is communicated and applied across the geography.
*Leading, sustaining and further developing effective emergency planning, resilience and response arrangements for the Wessex geography, working in partnership through Local Health Resilience Partnerships. This includes ensuring that the team is represented in Local Resilience For a and contributes fully to planning and preparing for, and exercising for major incidents
*Leading preparations for and overseeing the response to predictable events that require a specific, significant response, including periods of seasonal escalation and industrial action.
*Leading on applying NHS England's assurance process for major service change locally, including advising commissioners on requirements and supporting them to prepare for milestones in the process.
*Providing clear and visible leadership and management to the operations and delivery team in the Wessex office, including setting clear expectations and objectives, providing support and development to enable them to deliver, and regularly reviewing progress with the team.
*Being a full member of the NHS England Wessex senior management team and provide corporate leadership to staff in the whole office, ensuring staff are able to perform to the best of their ability.
*Actively promote the NHS Constitution by championing the values and principles in the NHS Constitution
*Promote equality and diversity and the reduction of inequalities in all activities.
*Create an inclusive working environment where diversity is valued, everyone can contribute and everyday action ensures we meet our duty to uphold and promote equality.
*Promoting the Workforce Race Equality Scheme, drawing attention to staff engagement and experience of BME staff
*Support the improvement in gender and BME diversity in senior positions so that they reflect the workforce and populations served
*Working with the Regional Director of Assurance and Delivery and other Very Senior Managers across the region and NHS England more widely to develop and apply regional and national programmes of work, as required.
*Adhering to the NHS Managers' Code of Conduct and any other relevant professional codes.

Essential skills and experience:
*Demonstrable understanding of the NHS political environment and evidence-based approach to decision making
*Extensive knowledge of NHS performance management and accountability frameworks
*Extensive knowledge of the whole health system to enable appropriate decision making on area-wide issues
*Knowledge and delivery of effective governance/accountability systems to secure quality, performance and Value For Money (VFM) improvement at both organisation and system level
*Demonstrable appreciation and acknowledgment of the range and complexities of diversity; self-awareness in terms of emotional intelligence, biases and personal triggers; cultural competence - cultural sensitivity and awareness
*A wide range, and breadth, of experience of operating at Board level in the NHS, preferably in provider and commissioning role
*Leadership role in overseeing, assuring or delivering strategic change to secure improved outcomes for patients within available resources

title: IT Change and Configuration Technician
job_description:
IT Change and Configuration Technician

We are currently recruiting for one our fastest growing customers who are a leading player in their specific area of the Financial Services Sector. The position is located in their Head Offices based in Chatham overlooking the river Medway.

JOB PUROSE

The Change and Configuration Analyst will focus on oversight and control of system changes into the live environment and will be expected to work with development teams, project managers, testers, business users and management to meet Software Development Lifecycle Requirements.
The role will also require establishing processes for configuration management of websites and systems in support of the Software Development Lifecycle and Change Management Processes. This will include administration of the software version tool and scripting of processes to aid with release control and migration of change to Live.

RESPONSIBILITIES

* Establishing and supporting configuration and release management processes for websites including management and administration of source code control.
* Identifying opportunities for process improvement as part of continuous improvement to Change, Configuration and Release Management processes.
* Supporting IT Governance Controls and Processes within the Bank.
* Identifying, supporting and delivering change for the business in line with Change Management processes and policies and the business schedule.
* Supporting amendments to plans within change requests and schedules as required.

EXPERIENCE

* Minimum 1 year experience of developing and maintaining documentation is essential.
* Minimum 1 year experience with VB Scripting and/or Powershell is essential.
* Minimum 1 year experience with version control tools such as Perforce or SVN (subversion) is desirable.
* Minimum 2 years previous experience undertaking analytical problem solving within an IT environment is essential.
* Previous experience with support or implementation of a Configuration Management Database would be desirable.

BENEFITS

* Holiday = 24 days, 1 day increase after 2 years completed service, maximum 28 days
* Holiday purchase scheme - up to 5 days in an annual leave year.
* Discretionary bonus of up to 10%
* Pension - 5% employee, 8% employer contribution
* Private Medical Insurance = 50% individual cover
* Private Health Insurance - a year's service - 75% of basic salary, payable on an ongoing basis after 28 weeks of continuous absence.
* Overtime eligibility
* Death in Service = 4 times basic salary
* Season Ticket Loan
* Cycle to work scheme
* Eye Test
* Childcare Voucher
* Perkbox discounts

title: Data Scientist
job_description:
Data Scientist - R / Python / SQL / Statistics / Predictive Modelling

HUGELY EXCITING OPPORTUNITY FOR A DATA SCIENTIST TO JOIN A MARKET LEADING MEDIA AGENCY IN HULL!!

  • Minimum of 2 years commercial experience
  • Excellent leadership and growth potential
  • R / Python / SQL / Statistics / Predictive Modelling

Based in Hull, we are a market leading Media Agency and has has enjoyed rapid growth since they were established over 12 years ago. We employ over 125 people across multiple offices in UK and Europe. We are recruiting for an experienced Data Scientist with strong R / Python / SQL / Statistics / Predictive Modelling experience.

Sourced by: @ITJobs_N - your 24/7 twitter feed of latest IT vacancies across Yorkshire

WHO ARE WE?

We are an award winning Media Agency and we provide cutting edge solutions to some of the country's biggest online retailers. We are a rapidly expanding company with a hugely talented team that is the driving force behind the business. We have a passion for innovation and this passion will remain a fundamental part of the business and the basis for our continuing success. WHAT WILL YOU BE DOING?

As an experienced Data Scientist you will be required to develop statistical models using R that will be integrated into our proprietary data platform. You will play an important role in new project implementation that will improve our clients' online marketing strategies.

The candidate will have strong predictive modelling skills and will be well versed with handling and analysing large unstructured data sets and providing key insights that senior stakeholders will utilise to aid decision making. The Data Scientist must also have strong Python programming skills and be confident querying, cleansing and managing data using SQL.

You will be responsible for adding functionality to our existing products and be responsible for improving the quality of the data that the company uses.

Candidates must have an understanding of quantitative approaches for large scale data manipulation and analytics and have experience using Data Mining algorithms.
